The late 1950s to the early 1970s be a period of intense research and institutional expansion for molecular biology, which have only recently become a somewhat coherent discipline. In what organismic biologist E. O. Wilson call `` The Molecular Wars'', the methods and practitioners of molecular biology spread rapidly, often come to dominate departments and even entire disciplines.[ 75] Molecularization be particularly important in genetics, immunology, embryology, and neurobiology, while the idea that life be control by a `` genetic program'' —a metaphor Jacob and Monod introduce from the emerge fields of cybernetics and computer science—became an influential perspective throughout biology.[ 76] Immunology in particular become link with molecular biology, with innovation flow both ways: the clonal selection theory develop by Niels Jerne and Frank Macfarlane Burnet in the mid-1950s help shed light on the general mechanisms of protein synthesis.[ 77]

The war begin with the audacious invasion of Hispania by Hannibal, the Carthaginian general who have lead operations on Sicily in the First Punic War. Hannibal, son of Hamilcar Barca, rapidly march through Hispania to the Italian Alps, cause panic among Rome's Italian allies. The best way find to defeat Hannibal's purpose of cause the Italians to abandon Rome be to delay the Carthaginians with a guerrilla war of attrition, a strategy propound by Quintus Fabius Maximus, who would be nickname Cunctator( `` delayer'' in Latin), and whose strategy would be forever after know as Fabian. Due to this, Hannibal's goal be unachieved: he could not bring enough Italian cities to revolt against Rome and replenish his diminish army, and he thus lack the machines and manpower to besiege Rome.

In China, the Qing Dynasty be overthrow follow the Xinhai Revolution. The Xinhai Revolution begin with the Wuchang Uprising on October 10, 1911 and end with the abdication of Emperor Puyi on February 12, 1912. The primary parties to the conflict be the Imperial forces of the Qing Dynasty( 1644–1911), and the revolutionary forces of the Chinese Revolutionary Alliance( Tongmenghui).

The first developments for storing data were initially based on photographs, starting with microphotography in 1851 and then microform in the 1920s, with the ability to store documents on film, making them much more compact. In the 1970s, electronic paper allowed digital information appear as paper documents.

The industrialisation of the watch industry start 1854 also in Waltham, Massachusetts, at the Waltham Watch Company, with the development of machine tools, gauges and assemble methods adapt to the micro precision require for watches.

The ancient Egyptians view men and women, include people from all social classes except slaves, as essentially equal under the law, and even the lowliest peasant be entitle to petition the vizier and his court for redress.[ 97] Although, slaves be mostly use as indentured servants. They be able to buy and sell, or work their way to freedom or nobility, and usually be treat by doctors in the workplace.[ 98] Both men and women have the right to own and sell property, make contracts, marry and divorce, receive inheritance, and pursue legal disputes in court. Married couples could own property jointly and protect themselves from divorce by agree to marriage contracts, which stipulate the financial obligations of the husband to his wife and children should the marriage end. Compared with their counterparts in ancient Greece, Rome, and even more modern places around the world, ancient Egyptian women have a greater range of personal choices and opportunities for achievement. Women such as Hatshepsut and Cleopatra VII even become pharaohs, while others wield power as Divine Wives of Amun. Despite these freedoms, ancient Egyptian women do not often take part in official roles in the administration, serve only secondary roles in the temples, and be not as likely to be as educate as men.[ 97]

The Edwin Smith papyrus is one of the first medical documents still extant, and perhaps the earliest document that attempts to describe and analyse the brain: it might be seen as the very beginnings of modern neuroscience. However, while Egyptian medicine had some effective practices, it was not without its ineffective and sometimes harmful practices. Medical historians believe that ancient Egyptian pharmacology, for example, was largely ineffective. [7] Nevertheless, it applies the following components: examination, diagnosis, treatment and prognosis, to the treatment of disease,[2] which display strong parallels to the basic empirical method of science and according to G. E. R. Lloyd[8] played a significant role in the development of this methodology. The Ebers papyrus (c. 1550 BC) also contains evidence of traditional empiricism.

Although the exact species authoring the tools remains unknown, Mode 1 tools in Africa were manufactured and used predominantly by Homo habilis. They cannot be said to have developed these tools or to have contributed the tradition to technology. They continued a tradition of yet unknown origin. As chimpanzees sometimes naturally use percussion to extract or prepare food in the wild, and may use either unmodified stones or stones that they have split, creating an Oldowan tool, the tradition may well be far older than its current record.[citation needed]

When the Ottoman Empire be defeat by an Arab uprising and British Empire forces after the Sinai and Palestine Campaign in 1918, the Arab population be reward with what many Islamic activists of more recent times have describe as an Anglo-French betrayal. British and French governments conclude a secret treaty( the Sykes–Picot Agreement) to partition the Middle East between them and, additionally, the British, via the Balfour Declaration promise the international Zionist movement their support in re-create the historic Jewish homeland in Palestine.

The years of the First World War were a complex transitional period for the film industry. The exhibition of films changed from short one-reel programmes to feature films. Exhibition venues became larger and began charging higher prices.

Urbanization increased as the population grew and as the division of labor grew more complex. Large urban centers, such as Nanjing and Beijing, also contributed to the growth of private industry. In particular, small-scale industries grew up, often specializing in paper, silk, cotton, and porcelain goods. For the most part, however, relatively small urban centers with markets proliferated around the country. Town markets mainly traded food, with some necessary manufactures such as pins or oil.

The domestic dwellings of elite and ordinary Egyptians alike be construct from perishable materials such as mud bricks and wood, and have not survive. Peasants live in simple homes, while the palaces of the elite and the pharaoh be more elaborate structures. A few survive New Kingdom palaces, such as those in Malkata and Amarna, show richly decorate walls and floors with scenes of people, birds, water pools, deities and geometric designs.[ 154] Important structures such as temples and tombs that be intend to last forever be construct of stone instead of mud bricks. The architectural elements use in the world's first large-scale stone building, Djoser's mortuary complex, include post and lintel supports in the papyrus and lotus motif.

Ancient China was home to several competing schools of political thought, most of which arose in the Spring and Autumn period. These included Mohism (a utilitarian philosophy), Taoism, Legalism (a school of thought based on the supremacy of the state), and Confucianism. Eventually, a modified form of Confucianism (heavily infused with elements of Legalism) became the dominant political philosophy in China during the Imperial Period. This form of Confucianism also deeply influenced and were expounded upon by scholars in Korea and Japan.

Charles S. Peirce was also a pioneer in statistics. Peirce held that science achieves statistical probabilities, not certainties, and that chance, a veering from law, is very real. He assigned probability to an argument’s conclusion rather than to a proposition, event, etc., as such. Most of his statistical writings promote the frequency interpretation of probability (objective ratios of cases), and many of his writings express skepticism about (and criticize the use of) probability when such models are not based on objective randomization.[92] Though Peirce was largely a frequentist, his possible world semantics introduced the "propensity" theory of probability. Peirce (sometimes with Jastrow) investigated the probability judgments of experimental subjects, pioneering decision analysis.

Until the early 1970s, the Republic of China was recognized as the sole legitimate government of China by the United Nations and most Western nations, refusing to recognize the People's Republic of China on account of the Cold War. However in 1971, Resolution 2758 was passed by the UN General Assembly and "the representatives of Chiang Kai-shek" (and thus the ROC) were expelled from the UN and replaced as "China" by the PRC. In 1979, the United States switched recognition from Taipei to Beijing. The KMT ruled Taiwan under martial law until the late 1980s, with the stated goal of being vigilant against Communist infiltration and preparing to retake mainland China. Therefore, political dissent was not tolerated.

For the duration of the 6th century, the Eastern Roman Empire was embroiled in a series of deadly conflicts, first with the Persian Sassanid Empire (see Roman–Persian Wars), followed by the onslaught of the arising Islamic Caliphate (Rashidun and Umayyad). By 650, the provinces of Egypt, Palestine and Syria were lost to the Muslim forces, followed by Hispania and southern Italy in the 7th and 8th centuries (see Muslim conquests). The Arab invasion from the east was stopped after the intervention of the Bulgarian Empire (see Tervel of Bulgaria).

Education in New Zealand begin with provision make by the provincial government, the missionary Christian churches and private education. The first act of parliament for education be pass in 1877, and seek to establish a standard for primary education. It be compulsory for children to attend school until the age of 14 years.

Most of what is known of the ancient world comes from the accounts of antiquity's own historians. Although it is important to take into account the bias of each ancient author, their accounts are the basis for our understanding of the ancient past. Some of the more notable ancient writers include Herodotus, Thucydides, Arrian, Plutarch, Polybius, Sima Qian, Sallust, Livy, Josephus, Suetonius, and Tacitus.
The Pacific front saw major action during the Second World War, mainly between the belligerents Japan and the United States.

The first ruler in the Mediterranean know to have officially set standards of weight and money be Pheidon.[ 67] Minting occur in the latter parts of the 7th century amongst the cities of Grecian Asia Minor, spread to Aegean parts of the Greek islands and the south of Italy by 500 BC.[ 26] The first stamp money( have the mark of some authority in the form of a picture or words) can be see in the Bibliothèque Nationale of Paris. It be an electrum stater of a turtle coin, coin at Aegina island. This coin[ 68] dates about 700 BC.[ 69]
More than 2,000 bushrangers are believed to have roamed the Australian countryside, beginning with the convict bolters and ending after Ned Kelly's last stand at Glenrowan.[199]

Over the next half-century, all areas previously under the Ming dynasty were consolidated under the Qing. Xinjiang, Tibet, and Mongolia were also formally incorporated into Chinese territory. Between 1673 and 1681, the Kangxi Emperor suppressed the Revolt of the Three Feudatories, an uprising of three generals in Southern China who had been denied hereditary rule of large fiefdoms granted by the previous emperor. In 1683, the Qing staged an amphibious assault on southern Taiwan, bringing down the rebel Kingdom of Tungning, which was founded by the Ming loyalist Koxinga (Zheng Chenggong) in 1662 after the fall of the Southern Ming, and had served as a base for continued Ming resistance in Southern China. The Qing defeated the Russians at Albazin, resulting in the Treaty of Nerchinsk.

In the 9th century, Bimaristan medical schools be form in the medieval Islamic world, where medical diplomas be issue to students of Islamic medicine who be qualify to be a practicing Doctor of Medicine.[ 51] Al-Azhar University, found in Cairo, Egypt in 975, be a Jami'ah( `` university'' in Arabic) which offer a variety of post-graduate degrees, have a Madrasah and theological seminary, and taught Islamic law, Islamic jurisprudence, Arabic grammar, Islamic astronomy, early Islamic philosophy and logic in Islamic philosophy.[ 51]

His successor, Tanutamun, also make a failed attempt to regain Egypt for Nubia. He successfully defeat Necho, the native Egyptian puppet ruler instal by Ashurbanipal, take Thebes in the process. The Assyrians then send a large army southwards. Tantamani( Tanutamun) be heavily rout and flee back to Nubia. The Assyrian army sack Thebes to such an extent it never truly recovered. A native ruler, Psammetichus I be place on the throne, as a vassal of Ashurbanipal, and the Nubians be never again to pose a threat to either Assyria or Egypt.[ 74]

Empiricism be one of several compete views that predominate in the study of human knowledge, know as epistemology. Empiricism emphasize the role of experience and evidence, especially sensory perception, in the formation of ideas, over the notion of innate ideas or tradition[ 2] in contrast to, for example, rationalism which rely upon reason and can incorporate innate knowledge.

International cooperation in sociology began in 1893 when René Worms (1869–1926) founded the small Institut International de Sociologie, eclipsed by much larger International Sociological Association from 1949. In 1905 the American Sociological Association, the world's largest association of professional sociologists, was founded, and Lester F. Ward was selected to serve as the first President of the new society.

One response be the Keynesian Resurgence. This emerge as a consensus among some policy makers and economists for a Keynesian solutions. As contrasted sharply with the previous economic orthodoxy in its support for government intervention in the economy. Figures in this school include Dominique Strauss-Kahn, Olivier Blanchard, Gordon Brown, Paul Krugman, and Martin Wolf.[ 116][ 117][ 118]

However, it was his successor at the Lyceum, the philosopher Theophrastus, who made the greatest progress in antiquity in his work On Stones. He described many minerals and ores both from local mines such as those at Laurium near Athens, and further afield. He also quite naturally discussed types of marble and building materials like limestones, and attempted a primitive classification of the properties of minerals by their properties such as hardness.

After the downfall of the prior Gupta Empire in the middle of the 6th century, North India revert to smaller republics and monarchical states. The power vacuum result in the rise of the Vardhanas of Thanesar, who begin unite the republics and monarchies from the Punjab to central India. After the death of Harsha's father and brother, representatives of the empire crown Harsha emperor at an assembly in April 606 CE, give him the title of Maharaja when he be merely 16 years old.[ 193] At the height of his power, his Empire cover much of North and Northwestern India, extend East till Kamarupa, and South until Narmada River; and eventually make Kannauj( in present Uttar Pradesh state) his capital, and rule till 647 CE.[ 194]
Canada during this era be dominate by the leadership of Pierre Elliot Trudeau. Eventually in 1982 at the end of his tenure, Canada receive a new constitution.

The empire's legacy includes many monuments spread over South India, the best known of which is the group at Hampi. The previous temple building traditions in South India came together in the Vijayanagara Architecture style. The mingling of all faiths and vernaculars inspired architectural innovation of Hindu temple construction, first in the Deccan and later in the Dravidian idioms using the local granite. South Indian mathematics flourished under the protection of the Vijayanagara Empire in Kerala. The south Indian mathematician Madhava of Sangamagrama founded the famous Kerala school of astronomy and mathematics in the 14th century which produced a lot of great south Indian mathematicians like Parameshvara, Nilakantha Somayaji and Jyeṣṭhadeva in medieval south India.[295] Efficient administration and vigorous overseas trade brought new technologies such as water management systems for irrigation.[296] The empire's patronage enabled fine arts and literature to reach new heights in Kannada, Telugu, Tamil and Sanskrit, while Carnatic music evolved into its current form.[297]
As soon as intercontinental missiles were developed, military planners began programmes and strategies to counter their effectiveness.

The history of musical development in Iran( Persian music) date back to the prehistoric era. The great legendary king, Jamshid, be credit with the invention of music. Music in Iran can be trace back to the days of the Elamite Empire( 2500-644 BC). Fragmentary documents from various periods of the country's history establish that the ancient Persians possess an elaborate musical culture. The Sassanid period( AD 226-651), in particular, have leave us ample evidence point to the existence of a lively musical life in Persia. The names of some important musicians such as Barbod, Nakissa and Ramtin, and titles of some of their works have survive.

The Thera eruption occurred around the Aegean Collapse, 110 km (68 mi) north of Crete. Speculation include a tsunami from Thera (more commonly known today as Santorini) destroyed Cretan cities. A tsunami may have destroyed the Cretan navy in its home harbour, which then lost crucial naval battles; so that in the LMIB/LMII event (c. 1450 BC) the cities of Crete burned and the Mycenaean civilization took over Knossos. If the eruption occurred in the late 17th century BC (as most chronologists now think) then its immediate effects belong to the Middle to Late Bronze Age transition, and not to the end of the Late Bronze Age; but it could have triggered the instability that led to the collapse first of Knossos and then of Bronze Age society overall. One such theory looks to the role of Cretan expertise in administering the empire, post-Thera. If this expertise was concentrated in Crete, then the Mycenaeans may have made political and commercial mistakes in administering the Cretan empire.
The Stone Age be the first of the three-age system of archaeology, which divide human technological prehistory into three periods:

Internally the Taiping Rebellion (1851–1864), a quasi-Christian religious movement led by the "Heavenly King" Hong Xiuquan, raided roughly a third of Chinese territory for over a decade until they were finally crushed in the Third Battle of Nanking in 1864. This was one of the largest wars in the 19th century in terms of troop involvement; there was massive loss of life, with a death toll of about 20 million.[43] A string of civil disturbances followed, including the Punti–Hakka Clan Wars, Nian Rebellion, Dungan Revolt, and Panthay Rebellion.[44] All rebellions were ultimately put down, but at enormous cost and with millions dead, seriously weakening the central imperial authority. The Banner system that the Manchus had relied upon for so long failed: Banner forces were unable to suppress the rebels, and the government called upon local officials in the provinces, who raised "New Armies", which successfully crushed the challenges to Qing authority. China never rebuilt a strong central army, and many local officials became warlords who used military power to effectively rule independently in their provinces.[45]

A major breakthrough in epidemiology came with the introduction of statistical maps and graphs. They allowed careful analysis of seasonality issues in disease incidents, and the maps allowed public health officials to identifical critical loci for the dissemination of disease. John Snow in London developed the methods. In 1849, he observed that the symptoms of cholera, which had already claimed around 500 lives within a month, were vomiting and diahrrea. He concluded that the source of contamination must be through ingestion, rather than inhalation as was previously thought. It was this insight that resulted in the removal of The Pump On Broad Street, after which deaths from cholera plummeted afterwards. English nurse Florence Nightingale pioneered analysis of large amounts of statistical data, using graphs and tables, regarding the condition of thousands of patients in the Crimean War to evaluate the efficacy of hospital services. Her methods proved convincing and led to reforms in military and civilian hospitals, usually with the full support of the government.[115][116][117]

The first major model, implicit in most early histories of science and generally a model put forward by practicing scientists themselves in their textbook literature, is associated with the criticisms of logical positivism by Karl Popper (1902–1994) from the 1930s. Popper's model of science is one in which scientific progress is achieved through a falsification of incorrect theories and the adoption instead of theories which are progressively closer to truth. In this model, scientific progress is a linear accumulation of facts, each one adding to the last. In this model, the physics of Aristotle (384 BC – 322 BC) was simply subsumed by the work of Isaac Newton (1642–1727) (classical mechanics), which itself was eclipsed by the work of Albert Einstein (1879–1955) (Relativity), and later the theory of quantum mechanics (established in 1925), each one more accurate than the last.

The suppose Martian canals be first report in 1877, by the Italian astronomer Giovanni Schiaparelli. The belief in them peak in the late 19th century, but be widely discredit in the beginning of the 20th century.

Major American studios begin to create their own `` independent'' production companies to finance and produce non-mainstream fare. One of the most successful independents of the 1990s, Miramax Films, be buy by Disney the year before the release of Tarantino's runaway hit Pulp Fiction in 1994. The same year mark the beginning of film and video distribution online. Animated films aim at family audiences also regain their popularity, with Disney's Beauty and the Beast( 1991), Aladdin( 1992), and The Lion King( 1994). During 1995, the first feature length computer-animated feature, Toy Story, be produce by Pixar Animation Studios and release by Disney. After the success of Toy Story, computer animation would grow to become the dominant technique for feature length animation, which would allow compete film companies such as DreamWorks Animation and 20th Century Fox to effectively compete with Disney with successful films of their own. During the late 1990s, another cinematic transition begin, from physical film stock to digital cinema technology. Meanwhile, DVDs become the new standard for consumer video, replace VHS tapes.

In the 3rd century BC Aristarchus of Samos be the first to suggest a heliocentric system, although only fragmentary descriptions of his idea survive.[ 27] Eratosthenes, use the angles of shadows create at widely separate regions, estimate the circumference of the Earth with great accuracy.[ 28]

The Industrial Revolution concentrated labour into mills, factories and mines, thus facilitating the organisation of combinations or trade unions to help advance the interests of working people. The power of a union could demand better terms by withdrawing all labour and causing a consequent cessation of production. Employers had to decide between giving in to the union demands at a cost to themselves or suffering the cost of the lost production. Skilled workers were hard to replace, and these were the first groups to successfully advance their conditions through this kind of bargaining.

Even though Northern European Bronze Age cultures be relatively late, and come in existence via trade, sit present rich and well-preserved objects make of wool, wood and import Central European bronze and gold. Many rock carvings depict ships, and the large stone burial monuments know as stone ships suggest that ship play an important role. Thousands of rock carvings depict ships, most probably represent sewn plank build canoes for warfare, fishing and trade. These may have a history as far back as the neolithic period and continue into the Pre-Roman Iron Age, as show by the Hjortspring boat. There be many mounds and rock carve sites from the period. Numerous artifacts of bronze and gold be find. No write language exist in the Nordic countries during the Bronze Age. The rock carvings have be date through comparison with depicted artifacts.

In the mid 16th-century Russians adopted printing from Central Europe, with Ivan Fyodorov being the first known Russian printer. In the 17th century printing became widespread, and woodcuts became especially popular. That led to the development of a special form of folk art known as lubok printing, which persisted in Russia well into the 19th century.

Conservation for ecologists create travails parallel those nuclear power give former Manhattan Project scientists. In each case, science have to be reconcile with individual politics, religious beliefs, and worldviews, a difficult process. Some ecologists manage to keep their science separate from their advocacy; others unrepentantly become avowed environmentalists.[ 92]
Transportation improvements, such as canals and improved roads, also lowered food costs. Railroads were introduced near the end of the Industrial Revolution.

Magadha( Sanskrit: मगध) form one of the sixteen Mahā-Janapadas( Sanskrit: `` Great Countries'') or kingdoms in ancient India. The core of the kingdom be the area of Bihar south of the Ganges; its first capital be Rajagriha( modern Rajgir) then Pataliputra( modern Patna). Magadha expand to include most of Bihar and Bengal with the conquest of Licchavi and Anga respectively,[ 123] follow by much of eastern Uttar Pradesh and Orissa. The ancient kingdom of Magadha be heavily mention in Jain and Buddhist texts. It be also mention in the Ramayana, Mahabharata, Puranas.[ 124] The earliest reference to the Magadha people occur in the Atharva-Veda where they be find list along with the Angas, Gandharis, and Mujavats. Magadha play an important role in the development of Jainism and Buddhism, and two of India's greatest empires, the Maurya Empire and Gupta Empire, originate from Magadha. These empires saw advancements in ancient India's science, mathematics, astronomy, religion, and philosophy and be consider the Indian `` Golden Age''. The Magadha kingdom include republican communities such as the community of Rajakumara. Villages have their own assemblies under their local chiefs call Gramakas. Their administrations be divide into executive, judicial, and military functions.

Assyro-Babylonian literature, written in the Akkadian language, of Mesopotamia (Assyria and Babylonia) continues into the Iron Age up until the 6th centuries BC. The oldest Phoenician alphabet inscription is the Ahiram epitaph, engraved on the sarcophagus of King Ahiram from circa 1200 BC.[20] It has become conventional to refer to the alphabetic script as "Proto-Canaanite" until the mid-11th century BC, when it is first attested on inscribed bronze arrowheads, and as "Phoenician" only after 1050 BC.[21] The Paleo-Hebrew alphabet is identical to the Phoenician alphabet and dates to the 10th century BC.

Ibn Sina( Avicenna) be regard as the most influential philosopher of Islam.[ 70] He pioneer the science of experimental medicine[ 71] and be the first physician to conduct clinical trials.[ 72] His two most notable works in medicine be the Kitāb al-shifāʾ( `` Book of Healing'') and The Canon of Medicine, both of which be use as standard medicinal texts in both the Muslim world and in Europe well into the 17th century. Amongst his many contributions be the discovery of the contagious nature of infectious diseases,[ 71] and the introduction of clinical pharmacology.[ 73]

Marx's work turn the labor theory of value, as the classicists call it, on its head. His dark irony go deeper by ask what be the socially necessary labor time for the production of labor( i.e. work people) itself. Marx answer that this be the bare minimum for people to subsist and to reproduce with skills necessary in the economy.[ 54]
For the emergence of 20th century modern dance see also: Mary Wigman, Gret Palucca, Harald Kreutzberg, Yvonne Georgi, and Isadora Duncan.

The writings of Greek physician Galen had dominated European medical thinking for over a millennium. The Italian scholar Vesalius demonstrated mistakes in the Gaelic's ideas. Vesalius dissected human corpses, whereas Galen dissected animal corpses. Published in 1543, Vesalius' De humani corporis fabrica[77] was a groundbreaking work of human anatomy. It emphasized the priority of dissection and what has come to be called the "anatomical" view of the body, seeing human internal functioning as an essentially corporeal structure filled with organs arranged in three-dimensional space. This was in stark contrast to many of the anatomical models used previously, which had strong Galenic/Aristotelean elements, as well as elements of astrology.

It be not until Prince Henry the Navigator begin in 1418 to encourage the penetration of the torrid zone in the effort to reach India by circumnavigate Africa that European exploration of the southern hemisphere begin. In 1473 Portuguese navigator Lopes Gonçalves prove that the equator could be cross, and cartographers and sailors begin to assume the existence of another, temperate continent to the south of the known world.

The Akan speak a Kwa language. The speakers of Kwa languages be believe to have come from East/Central Africa, before settle in the Sahel.[ 180] By the 12th century, the Akan Kingdom of Bonoman( Bono State) be establish. During the 13th century, when the gold mines in modern-day Mali start to dry up, Bonoman and later other Akan states begin to rise to prominence as the major players in the Gold trade. It be Bonoman and other Akan kingdoms like Denkyira, Akyem, Akwamu which be the predecessors to what become the all-powerful Empire of Ashanti. When and how the Ashante get to their present location be debatable. What be know be that by the 17th century an Akan people be identify as living in a state call Kwaaman. The location of the state be north of Lake Bosomtwe. The state's revenue be mainly derive from trading in gold and kola nuts and clear forest to plant yams. They build towns between the Pra and Ofin rivers. They form alliances for defense and pay tribute to Denkyira one of the more powerful Akan states at that time along with Adansi and Akwamu. During the 16th century, Ashante society experience sudden changes, include population growth because of cultivation of New World plants such as cassava and maize and an increase in the gold trade between the coast and the north.[ 181]

By 4 million years ago, several australopithecine hominid species had developed throughout Southern, Eastern and Central Africa. They were tool users, and makers of tools. They scavenged for meat and were omnivores.[5]

The Hellenic civilisation be a collection of city-states or poleis with different governments and cultures that achieve notable developments in government, philosophy, science, mathematics, politics, sports, theatre and music.

After the North Magnetic Pole be locate in 1831, explorers and scientists begin look for the South Magnetic Pole. One of the explorers, James Clark Ross, a British naval officer, identify its approximate location, but be unable to reach it on his trip in 1841. Commanding the British ships Erebus and Terror, he brave the pack ice and approach what be now know as the Ross Ice Shelf, a massive floating ice shelf over 100 feet( 30 m) high. His expedition sail eastward along the southern Antarctic coast discovering mountains which be since name after his ships: Mount Erebus, the most active volcano on Antarctica, and Mount Terror.[ 10]

The bronzes of the Western Zhou Dynasty document large portions of history not find in the extant texts that be often compose by persons of vary rank and possibly even social class. Further, the medium of cast bronze lend the record they preserve a permanence not enjoy by manuscripts.[ 45] These inscriptions can commonly be subdivide into four parts: a reference to the date and place, the naming of the event commemorate, the list of gifts give to the artisan in exchange for the bronze, and a dedication.[ 46] The relative points of reference these vessels provide have enable historians to place most of the vessels within a certain time frame of the Western Zhou period, allow them to trace the evolution of the vessels and the events they record.[ 47]

Early medical traditions include those of Babylon, China, Egypt and India. The Greeks go even further, introduce the concepts of medical diagnosis, prognosis, and advance medical ethics. The Hippocratic Oath, still take( although significantly change from the original) by doctors up to today, be write in Greece in the 5th century BCE. In the medieval age, surgical practices inherit from the ancient masters be improve and then systematize in Rogerius's The Practice of Surgery. Universities begin systematic training of physicians around the years 1220 in Italy. During the Renaissance, understanding of anatomy improve, and the microscope be invent.

After the marriage in 1476 of King Matthias to Beatrice of Naples, Buda become one of the most important artistic centres of the Renaissance north of the Alps.[ 93] The most important humanists live in Matthias' court be Antonio Bonfini and the famous Hungarian poet Janus Pannonius.[ 93] András Hess set up a printing press in Buda in 1472. Matthias Corvinus's library, the Bibliotheca Corviniana, be Europe's greatest collections of secular books: historical chronicles, philosophic and scientific works in the 15th century. His library be second only in size to the Vatican Library.( However, the Vatican Library mainly contain Bibles and religious materials.)[ 94]

Around 1900 a number of architects around the world begin develop new architectural solutions to integrate traditional precedents with new social demands and technological possibilities. The work of Victor Horta and Henry van de Velde in Brussels, Antoni Gaudí in Barcelona, Otto Wagner in Vienna and Charles Rennie Mackintosh in Glasgow, among many others, can be see as a common struggle between old and new.

Resistance to the grow influence of molecular biology be especially evident in evolutionary biology. Protein sequence have great potential for the quantitative study of evolution( through the molecular clock hypothesis), but lead evolutionary biologists question the relevance of molecular biology for answer the big questions of evolutionary causation. Departments and disciplines fracture as organismic biologists assert their importance and independence: Theodosius Dobzhansky make the famous statement that `` nothing in biology make sense except in the light of evolution'' as a response to the molecular challenge. The issue become even more critical after 1968; Motoo Kimura's neutral theory of molecular evolution suggest that natural selection be not the ubiquitous cause of evolution, at least at the molecular level, and that molecular evolution might be a fundamentally different process from morphological evolution.( Resolving this `` molecular/morphological paradox'' have be a central focus of molecular evolution research since the 1960s.)[ 78]

Eventually the natives and the Spaniards interbreed, form a Mestizo class. Mestizos and the Native Americans be often force to pay unfair taxes to the Spanish government( although all subjects pay taxes) and be punish harshly for disobey their laws. Many native artworks be consider pagan idols and destroy by Spanish explorers. This include a great number of gold and silver sculptures, which be melt down before transport to Europe.[ citation need]
It was only in the late 19th century that the Neogrammarian approach of Karl Brugmann and others introduced a rigid notion of sound law.

As the Western Roman Empire fell into decay through the 4th and 5th centuries, the seat of Roman power shifted to Constantinople and the Eastern Roman Empire, today called the Byzantine Empire. While surviving evidence about Byzantine theatre is slight, existing records show that mime, pantomime, scenes or recitations from tragedies and comedies, dances, and other entertainments were very popular. Constantinople had two theatres that were in use as late as the 5th century.[32] However, the true importance of the Byzantines in theatrical history is their preservation of many classical Greek texts and the compilation of a massive encyclopedia called the Suda, from which is derived a large amount of contemporary information on Greek theatre.

In the early 15th century, the countries of the Iberian peninsula begin to sponsor exploration beyond the boundaries of Europe. Prince Henry the Navigator of Portugal( d. 1460) send expeditions that discover the Canary Islands, the Azores, and Cape Verde during his lifetime. After his death, exploration continue; Bartolomeu Dias( d. 1500) go around the Cape of Good Hope in 1486 and Vasco da Gama( d. 1524) sail around Africa to India in 1498.[ 308] The combined Spanish monarchies of Castile and Aragon sponsor the voyage of exploration by Christopher Columbus( d. 1506) in 1492 that discover the Americas.[ 309] The English crown under Henry VII sponsor the voyage of John Cabot( d. 1498) in 1497, which land on Cape Breton Island.[ 310]

In 1789 the Mutiny on the Bounty against William Bligh lead to several of the mutineers escape the Royal Navy and settle on Pitcairn Islands, which later become a British colony. Britain also establish colonies in Australia in 1788, New Zealand in 1840 and Fiji in 1872, with much of Oceania become part of the British Empire.

These bills could also be used as a form of payment by the seller to make additional purchases from his own suppliers. Thus, the bills – an early form of credit – became both a medium of exchange and a medium for storage of value. Like the loans made by the Egyptian grain banks, this trade credit became a significant source for the creation of new money. In England, bills of exchange became an important form of credit and money during last quarter of the 18th century and the first quarter of the 19th century before banknotes, checks and cash credit lines were widely available.[76]

Dance history be difficult to access because dance do not often leave behind clearly identifiable physical artifacts that last over millennia, such as stone tools, hunt implements or cave paintings. It be not possible to identify with exact precision when dance become part of human culture.

The early 1960s also signaled the start of major clashes between the Hutus and the Tutsis in Rwanda and Burundi. In 1994 this culminated in the Rwandan Genocide, a conflict in which over 800,000 people were murdered.[225]

Historian and political philosopher Quentin Skinner points out that Otto of Freising (c. 1114–1158), a German bishop visiting north Italy during the 12th century, noticed a widespread new form of political and social organization, observing that Italy appeared to have exited from Feudalism so that its society was based on merchants and commerce. Linked to this was anti-monarchical thinking, represented in the famous early Renaissance fresco cycle Allegory of Good and Bad Government in Siena by Ambrogio Lorenzetti (painted 1338–1340), whose strong message is about the virtues of fairness, justice, republicanism and good administration. Holding both Church and Empire at bay, these city republics were devoted to notions of liberty. Skinner reports that there were many defences of liberty such as the Matteo Palmieri (1406–1475) celebration of Florentine genius not only in art, sculpture and architecture, but "the remarkable efflorescence of moral, social and political philosophy that occurred in Florence at the same time".[31]

Alfred Marshall( 1842–1924) be also credit with an attempt to put economics on a more mathematical footing. The first professor of economics at the University of Cambridge, his 1890 work Principles of Economics[ 55] abandon the term `` political economy'' for his favorite `` economics''. He view math as a way to simplify economic reasoning, although he have reservations as reveal in a letter to his student Arthur Cecil Pigou:[ 40][ 56]

The construction of cathedrals and castles advanced building technology, leading to the development of large stone buildings. Ancillary structures included new town halls, houses, bridges, and tithe barns.[232] Shipbuilding improved with the use of the rib and plank method rather than the old Roman system of mortise and tenon. Other improvements to ships included the use of lateen sails and the stern-post rudder, both of which increased the speed at which ships could be sailed.[233]

The increased use of the English language globally has had an effect on other languages, leading to some English words being assimilated into the vocabularies of other languages. This influence of English has led to concerns about language death,[127] and to claims of linguistic imperialism,[128] and has provoked resistance to the spread of English; however the number of speakers continues to increase because many people around the world think that English provides them with opportunities for better employment and improved lives.[129]

Scientific thought in Classical Antiquity become tangible from the 6th century BC in pre-Socratic philosophy( Thales, Pythagoras). In c. 385 BC, Plato found the Academy. With Plato's student Aristotle begin the `` scientific revolution'' of the Hellenistic period culminate in the 3rd to 2nd centuries with scholars such as Eratosthenes, Euclid, Aristarchus of Samos, Hipparchus and Archimedes.

Passive constructions also use auxiliary verbs. A passive construction rephrase an active construction in such a way that the object of the active phrase become the subject of the passive phrase, and the subject of the active phrase be either omit or demote to a role as an oblique argument introduce in a prepositional phrase. They be form by use the past participle either with the auxiliary verb to be or to get, although not all varieties of English allow the use of passives with get. For example, put the sentence she see him into the passive becomes he be see( by her), or he get see( by her).[ 192]

Scholars have argue that warfare be absent throughout much of human's prehistoric past, and that it emerge after sedentism, farming, and more complex political systems arise.[ 12] However, the findings at the site of Nataruk in Turkana County, Kenya, where the remains of 27 individuals who die as the result of an intentional attack by another group 10,000 years ago, show that inter-group conflict have a much longer history.[ 13]

The Ghana Empire grew wealthy by taxing the trans-Saharan trade that linked Tiaret and Sijilmasa to Aoudaghost. Ghana controlled access to the goldfields of Bambouk, southeast of Koumbi Saleh. A percentage of salt and gold going through its territory was taken. The empire was not involved in production.[167]

As in ancient Greece, early Chinese thinkers be concern with the relationship between names and reality. Confucius( 6th century BCE) famously emphasize the moral commitment implicit in a name,( zhengming) state that the moral collapse of the pre-Qin be a result of the failure to rectify behaviour to meet the moral commitment inherent in names: `` Good government consist in the ruler be a ruler, the minister be a minister, the father be a father, and the son be a son ... If names be not correct, language be not in accordance with the truth of things.''( Analects 12.11,13.3).

In 1533, Pizarro invade Cuzco with indigenous troops and write to King Charles I: `` This city be the greatest and the finest ever see in this country or anywhere in the Indies ... it be so beautiful and have such fine buildings that it would be remarkable even in Spain.'' After the Spanish have seal the conquest of Peru, Jauja in fertile Mantaro Valley be establish as Peru's provisional capital, but it be too far up in the mountains, and Pizarro found the city of Lima on 18 January 1535, which Pizarro consider one of the most important acts in his life.

The Greeks and the Romans leave a legacy in Europe which be evident in European languages, think, visual arts and law. Ancient Greece be a collection of city-states, out of which the original form of democracy develop. Athens be the most powerful and developed city, and a cradle of learn from the time of Pericles. Citizens' forums debate and legislated policy of the state, and from here arose some of the most notable classical philosophers, such as Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle, the last of whom taught Alexander the Great.

In the Scottish Enlightenment, Scotland's major cities create an intellectual infrastructure of mutually support institutions such as universities, read societies, libraries, periodicals, museums and masonic lodges.[ 82] The Scottish network be `` predominantly liberal Calvinist, Newtonian, and'design' orient in character which play a major role in the further development of the transatlantic Enlightenment''.[ 83] In France, Voltaire say `` we look to Scotland for all our ideas of civilization. ``[ 84] The focus of the Scottish Enlightenment range from intellectual and economic matters to the specifically scientific as in the work of William Cullen, physician and chemist; James Anderson, an agronomist; Joseph Black, physicist and chemist; and James Hutton, the first modern geologist.[ 16][ 85]

Finally, cuneiform writing became a general purpose writing system for logograms, syllables, and numbers. By the 26th century BC, this script had been adapted to another Mesopotamian language, Akkadian, and from there to others such as Hurrian, and Hittite. Scripts similar in appearance to this writing system include those for Ugaritic and Old Persian.

Thales of Miletus be one of the first known philosophers know to have wonder about the shape of the world. He propose that the world be base on water, and that all things grow out of it. He also lay down many of the astronomical and mathematical rules that would allow geography to be study scientifically. His successor Anaximander be the first person know to have attempt to create a scale map of the know world and to have introduce the gnomon to Ancient Greece.

The next crucial breakthrough be in 1488, when Bartolomeu Dias round the southern tip of Africa, which he name `` Cape of Storms''( Cabo das Tormentas), anchor at Mossel Bay and then sail east as far as the mouth of the Great Fish River, prove that the Indian Ocean be accessible from the Atlantic. Simultaneously Pêro da Covilhã, send out travel secretly overland, have reach Ethiopia have collect important information about the Red Sea and Quenia coast, suggest that a sea route to the Indies would soon be forthcoming.[ 57] Soon the cape be rename by king John II of Portugal the `` Cape of Good Hope''( Cabo da Boa Esperança), because of the great optimism engender by the possibility of a sea route to India, prove false the view that have exist since Ptolemy that the Indian Ocean be land-locked.

The Chittorgarh Fort be the largest in India; it be a symbol for Rajput resistance. Chittorgarh Fort be sack three times during the 15th and 16th centuries by Muslim armies. In 1303 Allauddin Khilji defeat Rana Ratan Singh; in 1535 Bahadur Shah, the Sultanate of Gujarat defeat Bikramjeet Singh; and in 1567 Akbar defeat Maharana Udai Singh II, who leave the fort and found Udaipur. Each time the men fight bravely rush out of the fort walls charge the enemy, but lose. Following these defeats, Jauhar be commit thrice by many of the wives and children of the Rajput soldiers who give their lives in battles at Chittorgarh Fort. The first time, this be lead by Rani Padmini wife of Rana Rattan Singh who be kill in the battle in 1303, and later by Rani Karnavati in 1537.[ 272][ 273][ 274]

Blaise Pascal (1623–1662) invented the mechanical calculator in 1642.[98] The introduction of his Pascaline in 1645 launched the development of mechanical calculators first in Europe and then all over the world.[99][100] Gottfried Leibniz (1646–1716), building on Pascal's work, became one of the most prolific inventors in the field of mechanical calculators; he was the first to describe a pinwheel calculator, in 1685,[101] and invented the Leibniz wheel, used in the arithmometer, the first mass-produced mechanical calculator. He also refined the binary number system, foundation of virtually all modern computer architectures.[102]

The Western Chalukya Empire (Kannada: ಪಶ್ಚಿಮ ಚಾಲುಕ್ಯ ಸಾಮ್ರಾಜ್ಯ) ruled most of the western Deccan, South India, between the 10th and 12th centuries.[243] Vast areas between the Narmada River in the north and Kaveri River in the south came under Chalukya control.[243] During this period the other major ruling families of the Deccan, the Hoysalas, the Seuna Yadavas of Devagiri, the Kakatiya dynasty and the Southern Kalachuris, were subordinates of the Western Chalukyas and gained their independence only when the power of the Chalukya waned during the later half of the 12th century.[244] The Western Chalukyas developed an architectural style known today as a transitional style, an architectural link between the style of the early Chalukya dynasty and that of the later Hoysala empire. Most of its monuments are in the districts bordering the Tungabhadra River in central Karnataka. Well known examples are the Kasivisvesvara Temple at Lakkundi, the Mallikarjuna Temple at Kuruvatti, the Kallesvara Temple at Bagali and the Mahadeva Temple at Itagi.[245] This was an important period in the development of fine arts in Southern India, especially in literature as the Western Chalukya kings encouraged writers in the native language of Kannada, and Sanskrit like the philosopher and statesman Basava and the great mathematician Bhāskara II.[246][247]

During the colonial era, Western influences started to make an impact on Indian art. Some artists developed a style that used Western ideas of composition, perspective and realism to illustrate Indian themes. Others, like Jamini Roy, consciously drew inspiration from folk art.

Under Peter I (the Great), Russia was proclaimed an Empire in 1721 and became recognized as a world power. Ruling from 1682 to 1725, Peter defeated Sweden in the Great Northern War, forcing it to cede West Karelia and Ingria (two regions lost by Russia in the Time of Troubles),[62] as well as Estland and Livland, securing Russia's access to the sea and sea trade.[63] On the Baltic Sea Peter founded a new capital called Saint Petersburg, later known as Russia's Window to Europe. Peter the Great's reforms brought considerable Western European cultural influences to Russia. Catherine II (the Great), who ruled in 1762–96, extended Russian political control over the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and incorporated most of its territories into Russia during the Partitions of Poland, pushing the Russian frontier westward into Central Europe. In the south, after successful Russo-Turkish Wars against the Ottoman Empire, Catherine advanced Russia's boundary to the Black Sea, defeating the Crimean khanate.

Early Christian thought, in particular in the patristic period, tends to be intuitional and mystical, and is less reliant on reason and logical argument. It also places more emphasis on the sometimes-mystical doctrines of Plato, and less upon the systematic thinking of Aristotle. Much of the work of Aristotle was unknown in the West in this period. Scholars relied on translations by Boethius into Latin of Aristotle's Categories, the logical work On Interpretation, and his Latin translation of Porphyry's Isagoge, a commentary on Aristotle's Categories.

The major opponent of Freemasonry be the Roman Catholic Church, so that in countries with a large Catholic element, such as France, Italy, Spain, and Mexico, much of the ferocity of the political battles involve the confrontation between what Davies call the reactionary Church and enlighten Freemasonry.[ 223][ 224] Even in France, Masons do not act as a group.[ 225] American historians, while note that Benjamin Franklin and George Washington be indeed active Masons, have downplay the importance of Freemasonry in cause the American Revolution because the Masonic order be non-political and include both Patriots and their enemy the Loyalists.[ 226]

One common conception of modernity be the condition of Western history since the mid-15th century, or roughly the European development of movable type[ 24] and the printing press.[ 25] In this context the `` modern'' society be say to develop over many periods, and to be influence by important events that represent breaks in the continuity.[ 26][ 27][ 28]

The answer, provide by Arthur D. Little to the president of MIT, be to emphasize the approach chemical engineers take to the design and analysis of processes rather than a process or a product. The concept of Unit operations be develop to emphasize the underlying unity among seemingly different operations. For example, the principles be the same whether one be concern about separate alcohol from water in a fermenter, or separate gasoline from diesel in a refinery, as long as the basis of separation be generation of a vapor of a different composition from the liquid. Therefore, such separation processes can be study together as a unit operation( in this case call distillation). The concept have stand the profession in good stead in its phase of growth, and have even be use to understand the way the human body functions.

In Latin America in the 1970s, leftists acquire a significant political influence which prompt the right-wing, ecclesiastical authorities and a large portion of the individual country's upper class to support coups d'état to avoid what they perceive as a communist threat. This be further fuel by Cuban and United States intervention which lead to a political polarization. Most South American countries be in some periods rule by military dictatorships that be support by the United States of America. In the 1970s, the regimes of the Southern Cone collaborate in Operation Condor kill many leftist dissidents, include some urban guerrillas.[ 119] However, by the early 1990s all countries have restore their democracies.

The National Geographic Society was founded in the United States in 1888 and began publication of the National Geographic magazine which became and continues to be a great popularizer of geographic information. The society has long supported geographic research and education.

The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency be an agency of the United States Department of Defense responsible for the development of new technologies for use by the military. DARPA lead the development of military technology in the United States and today, have dozens of ongoing projects; everything from humanoid robots, to bullets that be able to change path before reach their target. China have a similar agency.

In 284 AD, Diocletian be hail as Imperator by the eastern army. Diocletian heal the empire from the crisis, by political and economic shifts. A new form of government be establish: the Tetrarchy. The Empire be divide among four emperors, two in the West and two in the East. The first tetrarchs be Diocletian( in the East), Maximian( in the West), and two junior emperors, Galerius( in the East) and Flavius Constantius( in the West). To adjust the economy, Diocletian make several tax reforms.[ 124]

Titus had a short-lived rule; he was emperor from 79–81 AD. He finished the Flavian Amphitheater, which was constructed with war spoils from the First Jewish-Roman War, and promoted games celebrating the victory over the Jews that lasted for a hundred days. These games included gladiatorial combats, chariot races and a sensational mock naval battle on the flooded grounds of the Colosseum.[90][91]
The Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration began at the end of the 19th century and closed with Ernest Shackleton's Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition in 1917.[13]

Some of the first geological thoughts be about the origin of the Earth. Ancient Greece develop some primary geological concepts concern the origin of the Earth. Additionally, in the 4th century BC Aristotle make critical observations of the slow rate of geological change. He observe the composition of the land and formulate a theory where the Earth changes at a slow rate and that these changes can not be observe during one person’s lifetime. Aristotle develop one of the first evidentially base concepts connect to the geological realm regard the rate at which the Earth physically change.[ 2][ 3]

Thus began Australia's involvement in the six-year global conflict. Australians were to fight in an extraordinary variety of locations, from withstanding the advance of Hitler's Panzers in the Siege of Tobruk; to turning back the advance of the Imperial Japanese Army in the New Guinea Campaign. From bomber missions over Europe and Mediterranean naval engagements, to facing Japanese mini-sub raids on Sydney Harbour and devastating air raids on the city of Darwin.[312]

The Classic Era be dominate by numerous independent city-states in the Maya region and also feature the beginnings of political unity in central Mexico and the Yucatán. Regional differences between cultures grow more manifest. The city-state of Teotihuacan dominate the Valley of Mexico until the early 8th century, but we know little of the political structure of the region because the Teotihuacanos leave no write records. The city-state of Monte Albán dominate the Valley of Oaxaca until the late Classic, leave limited records in their mostly undeciphered script. Highly sophisticated arts such as stuccowork, architecture, sculptural reliefs, mural painting, pottery, and lapidary developed and spread during the Classic era.
For over a century after Tasman's voyages, until the era of James Cook, Tasmania and New Zealand be not visit by Europeans – mainland Australia be visit, but usually only by accident.

In 1533, a fourteen-year-old Caterina de' Medici (1519–1589), born in Florence to Lorenzo II de' Medici and Madeleine de la Tour d'Auvergne, married Henry II of France, second son of King Francis I and Queen Claude. Though she became famous and infamous for her role in France's religious wars, she made a direct contribution in bringing arts, sciences and music (including the origins of ballet) to the French court from her native Florence.

In 1905 a young, 26-year-old German physicist( then a Bern patent clerk) name Albert Einstein( 1879–1955), show how measurements of time and space be affect by motion between an observer and what be be observe. To say that Einstein's radical theory of relativity revolutionize science be no exaggeration. Although Einstein make many other important contributions to science, the theory of relativity alone represent one of the greatest intellectual achievements of all time. Although the concept of relativity be not introduce by Einstein, his major contribution be the recognition that the speed of light in a vacuum be constant, i.e. the same for all observers, and an absolute physical boundary for motion. This do not impact a person's day-to-day life since most objects travel at speeds much slower than light speed. For objects travel near light speed, however, the theory of relativity shows that clocks associate with those objects will run more slowly and that the objects shorten in length accord to measurements of an observer on Earth. Einstein also derive the famous equation, E= mc2, which express the equivalence of mass and energy.

Further studies, e.g. Jerome Ravetz 1971 Scientific Knowledge and its Social Problems refer to the role of the scientific community, as a social construct, in accept or reject( objective) scientific knowledge.[ 128] The Science wars of the 1990 be about the influence of especially French philosophers, which deny the objectivity of science in general or seem to do so. They describe as well differences between the idealized model of a pure science and the actual scientific practice; while scientism, a revival of the positivism approach, saw in precise measurement and rigorous calculation the basis for finally settle endure metaphysical and moral controversies.[ 129][ 130] However, more recently some of the lead critical theorists have recognize that their postmodern deconstructions have at times be counter-productive, and be provide intellectual ammunition for reactionary interests. Bruno Latour note that `` dangerous extremists be use the very same argument of social construction to destroy hard-won evidence that could save our lives. Was I wrong to participate in the invention of this field know as science studies? Is it enough to say that we do not really mean what we mean? ``[ 131]

The city of Rome grow from settlements around a ford on the river Tiber, a crossroads of traffic and trade.[ 12] According to archaeological evidence, the village of Rome be probably found some time in the 8th century BC, though it may go back as far as the 10th century BC, by members of the Latin tribe of Italy, on the top of the Palatine Hill.[ 18][ 19]

The term theatre practitioner come to be use to describe someone who both create theatrical performances and who produce a theoretical discourse that inform their practical work.[ 80] A theatre practitioner may be a director, a dramatist, an actor, or—characteristically—often a combination of these traditionally separate roles. `` Theatre practice'' describe the collective work that various theatre practitioners do.[ 81] It be use to describe theatre praxis from Konstantin Stanislavski's development of his'system', through Vsevolod Meyerhold's biomechanics, Bertolt Brecht's epic and Jerzy Grotowski's poor theatre, down to the present day, with contemporary theatre practitioners include Augusto Boal with his Theatre of the Oppressed, Dario Fo's popular theatre, Eugenio Barba's theatre anthropology and Anne Bogart's viewpoints.[ 82]

Around 1.8 million years ago, Homo ergaster first appear in the fossil record in Africa. From Homo ergaster, Homo erectus evolve 1.5 million years ago. Some of the earlier representatives of this species be still fairly small-brained and used primitive stone tools, much like H. habilis. The brain later grow in size, and H. erectus eventually develop a more complex stone tool technology call the Acheulean. Possibly the first hunters, H. erectus master the art of make fire and be the first hominid to leave Africa, colonize most of Afro-Eurasia and perhaps later give rise to Homo floresiensis. Although some recent writers suggest that Homo georgicus be the first and most primitive hominid ever to live outside Africa, many scientists consider H. georgicus to be an early and primitive member of the H. erectus species.[ 7][ 8]

The first settlements in Fiji were started by voyaging traders and settlers from the west about 5000 years ago. Lapita pottery shards have been found at numerous excavations around the country. Aspects of Fijian culture are similar to the Melanesian culture of the western Pacific but have a stronger connection to the older Polynesian cultures. Across 1,000 kilometres (620 mi) from east to west, Fiji has been a nation of many languages. Fiji's history was one of settlement but also of mobility.

Unfortunately, Wegener provided no convincing mechanism for this drift, and his ideas were not generally accepted during his lifetime. Arthur Homes accepted Wegener’s theory and provided a mechanism: mantle convection, to cause the continents to move. [36] However, it was not until after the Second World War that new evidence started to accumulate that supported continental drift. There followed a period of 20 extremely exciting years where the Theory of Continental Drift developed from being believed by a few to being the cornerstone of modern Geology. Beginning in 1947 research found new evidence about the ocean floor, and in 1960 Bruce C. Heezen published the concept of mid-ocean ridges.Soon after this, Robert S. Dietz and Harry H. Hess proposed that the oceanic crust forms as the seafloor spreads apart along mid-ocean ridges in seafloor spreading.[37] This was seen as confirmation of mantle convection and so the major stumbling block to the theory was removed. Geophysical evidence suggested lateral motion of continents and that oceanic crust is younger than continental crust. This geophysical evidence also spurred the hypothesis of paleomagnetism, the record of the orientation of the Earth’s magnetic field recorded in magnetic minerals. British geophysicist S. K. Runcorn suggested the concept of paleomagnetism from his finding that the continents had moved relative to the Earth’s magnetic poles. Tuzo Wilson, who was a promoter of the sea floor spreading hypothesis and continental drift from the very beginning,[38] added the concept of transform faults to the model, completing the classes of fault types necessary to make the mobility of the plates on the globe function.[39] A symposium on continental drift[40] was held at the Royal Society of London in 1965 must be regarded as the official start of the acceptance of plate tectonics by the scientific community.The abstracts from the symposium are issued as Blacket, Bullard, Runcorn;1965.In this symposium, Edward Bullard and co-workers showed with a computer calculation how the continents along both sides of the Atlantic would best fit to close the ocean, which became known as the famous "Bullard's Fit". By the late 1960s the weight of the evidence available saw Continental Drift as the generally accepted theory.

The most immediate cause of the new adjustments appears to have been an increasing aridity in the region and consequent contraction of parkland savanna, interspersed with trees and groves, in favor of open grassland, dated 1.8–1.7 mya. During that transitional period the percentage of grazers among the fossil species increased from 15–25% to 45%, dispersing the food supply and requiring a facility among the hunters to travel longer distances comfortably, which H. erectus obviously had.[33] The ultimate proof is the "dispersal" of H. erectus "across much of Africa and Asia, substantially before the development of the Mode 2 technology and use of fire ...."[32] H. erectus carried Mode 1 tools over Eurasia.

There be also an increase awareness of foreign language cinema in America during this period. During the late 1950s and 1960s, the French New Wave directors such as François Truffaut and Jean-Luc Godard produce films such as Les quatre cents coups, Breathless and Jules et Jim which break the rules of Hollywood cinema's narrative structure. As well, audiences be become aware of Italian films like Federico Fellini's La Dolce Vita and the stark dramas of Sweden's Ingmar Bergman.

The rapid industrialisation of the English economy cost many craft workers their jobs. The movement start first with lace and hosiery workers near Nottingham and spread to other areas of the textile industry owe to early industrialisation. Many weavers also find themselves suddenly unemployed since they could no longer compete with machines which only require relatively limited( and unskilled) labour to produce more cloth than a single weaver. Many such unemployed workers, weavers and others, turn their animosity towards the machines that have take their jobs and begin destroy factories and machinery. These attackers become know as Luddites, supposedly followers of Ned Ludd, a folklore figure. The first attacks of the Luddite movement begin in 1811. The Luddites rapidly gain popularity, and the British government take drastic measures, use the militia or army to protect industry. Those rioters who be catch be try and hang, or transport for life.

The main method the unions used to effect change was strike action. Many strikes were painful events for both sides, the unions and the management. In Britain, the Combination Act 1799 forbade workers to form any kind of trade union until its repeal in 1824. Even after this, unions were still severely restricted.

Coal mining be very dangerous owe to the presence of firedamp in many coal seams. Some degree of safety be provide by the safety lamp which be invent in 1816 by Sir Humphry Davy and independently by George Stephenson. However, the lamps prove a false dawn because they become unsafe very quickly and provide a weak light. Firedamp explosions continue, often set off coal dust explosions, so casualties grow during the entire 19th century. Conditions of work be very poor, with a high casualty rate from rock falls.

Available methods of communication have improve tremendously over time. Instead of wait months or years for a hand-copied letter to arrive, today scientific communication can be practically instantaneous. Earlier, most natural philosophers work in relative isolation, due to the difficulty and slowness of communication. Still, there be a considerable amount of cross-fertilization between distant groups and individuals.
