Just prior to Saharan desertification, the communities that develop south of Egypt, in what be now Sudan, be full participants in the Neolithic revolution and live a settle to semi-nomadic lifestyle, with domesticated plants and animals.[ 19] It have be suggest that megaliths find at Nabta Playa be examples of the world's first know archaeoastronomical devices, predate Stonehenge by some 1,000 years.[ 20] The sociocultural complexity observe at Nabta Playa and express by different levels of authority within the society there have be suggest as form the basis for the structure of both the Neolithic society at Nabta and the Old Kingdom of Egypt.[ 21] By 5000 BCE, Africa enter a dry phase, and the climate of the Sahara region gradually become drier. The population trek out of the Sahara region in all directions, include towards the Nile Valley below the Second Cataract, where they make permanent or semipermanent settlements. A major climatic recession occur, lessen the heavy and persistent rains in Central and Eastern Africa. Since then, dry conditions have prevail in Eastern Africa.[ citation need]

The history of South America during World War II be important because of the significant economic, political, and military changes that occur throughout much of the region as a result of the war. In order to better protect the Panama Canal, combat Axis influence, and optimize the production of goods for the war effort, the United States through Lend-Lease and similar programs greatly expand its interests in Latin America, result in large-scale modernization and a major economic boost for the countries that participate.[ 44]

Chariot racing was extremely popular among all classes. In Rome, these races were usually held at the Circus Maximus, which had been purpose-built for chariot and horse-racing and, as Rome's largest public place, was also used for festivals and animal shows.[223] It could seat around 150,000 people;[224] The charioteers raced in teams, identified by their colours. The track was divided lengthwise by a barrier that contained obelisks, temples, statues and lap-counters. The best seats were at the track-side, close to the action; they were reserved for Senators. Behind them sat the equites (knights), and behind the knights were the plebs (commoners) and non-citizens. The donor of the games sat on a high platform in the stands alongside images of the gods, visible to all. Large sums were bet on the outcomes of races. Some Romans offered prayers and sacrifices on behalf of their favourites, or laid curses on the opposing teams, and some aficionados were members of extremely, even violently partisan circus factions.

Theophrastus write some of the earliest descriptions of plants and animals, establish the first taxonomy and look at minerals in terms of their properties such as hardness. Pliny the Elder produce what be one of the largest encyclopedias of the natural world in 77 AD, and must be regard as the rightful successor to Theophrastus. For example, he accurately describe the octahedral shape of the diamond, and proceeds to mention that diamond dust be use by engravers to cut and polish other gems owe to its great hardness. His recognition of the importance of crystal shape be a precursor to modern crystallography, while mention of numerous other minerals presages mineralogy. He also recognise that other minerals have characteristic crystal shapes, but in one example, confuse the crystal habit with the work of lapidaries. He be also the first to recognise that amber be a fossilized resin from pine trees because he have see samples with trapped insects within them.

The fall of Teotihuacan is associated with the emergence of city-states within the confines of the central area of Mexico. It is thought that these were able to flourish due to the decline of Teotihuacan, though events may have occurred in the opposite order: the cities of Cacaxtla, Xochicalco, Teotenango, and El Tajín may have first increased in power and then were able to economically strangle Teotihuacan, trapped as it was in the center of the valley without access to trade routes. This occurred around 600 CE, and even though people continued to live there for another century and a half, the city was eventually destroyed and abandoned by its inhabitants, who took refuge in places such as Culhuacán and Azcapotzalco, on the shores of Lake Texcoco.

Wassily Kandinsky a Russian painter, printmaker and art theorist, one of the most famous 20th-century artists is generally considered the first important painter of modern abstract art. As an early Modernist, in search of new modes of visual expression, and spiritual expression, he theorized as did contemporary occultists and theosophists, that pure visual abstraction had corollary vibrations with sound and music. They posited that pure abstraction could express pure spirituality. His earliest abstractions were generally titled as the example in the (above gallery) Composition VII, making connection to the work of the composers of music. Kandinsky included many of his theories about abstract art in his book Concerning the Spiritual in Art. Robert Delaunay was a French artist who is associated with Orphism, (reminiscent of a link between pure abstraction and cubism). His later works were more abstract, reminiscent of Paul Klee. His key contributions to abstract painting refer to his bold use of color, and a clear love of experimentation of both depth and tone. At the invitation of Wassily Kandinsky, Delaunay and his wife the artist Sonia Delaunay, joined The Blue Rider (Der Blaue Reiter), a Munich-based group of abstract artists, in 1911, and his art took a turn to the abstract.[46]

Enlightenment scholars sought to curtail the political power of organized religion and thereby prevent another age of intolerant religious war.[61] Spinoza determined to remove politics from contemporary and historical theology (e.g., disregarding Judaic law).[62] Moses Mendelssohn advised affording no political weight to any organized religion, but instead recommended that each person follow what they found most convincing.[63] A good religion based in instinctive morals and a belief in God should not theoretically need force to maintain order in its believers, and both Mendelssohn and Spinoza judged religion on its moral fruits, not the logic of its theology.[64]

The rebellious states defeat Great Britain in the American Revolutionary War, the first successful colonial war of independence. While the states have already reject the governance of Parliament, through the Declaration the new United States now reject the legitimacy of the monarchy to demand allegiance. The war rag for seven years, with effective American victory, follow by formal British abandonment of any claim to the United States with the Treaty of Paris.

Modern systems of education in Europe derive their origins from the schools of the High Middle Ages. Most schools during this era be found upon religious principles with the primary purpose of train the clergy. Many of the earliest universities, such as the University of Paris found in 1160, have a Christian basis. In addition to this, a number of secular universities exist, such as the University of Bologna, found in 1088. Free education for the poor be officially mandate by the Church in 1179 when it decree that every cathedral must assign a master to teach boys too poor to pay the regular fee;[ 61] parishes and monasteries also establish free schools teach at least basic literary skills. With few exceptions, priests and brothers teach locally, and their salaries be frequently subsidize by towns. Private, independent schools reappear in medieval Europe during this time, but they, too, be religious in nature and mission.[ 62] The curriculum be usually base around the trivium and to a lesser extent quadrivium( the seven Artes Liberales or Liberal arts) and be conduct in Latin, the lingua franca of educated Western Europe throughout the Middle Ages and Renaissance.[ 63]

In recent years there have be a backlash against the external environmental effects of conventional agriculture, result in the organic movement.[ 121] Famines continue to sweep the globe through the 20th century. Through the effects of climactic events, government policy, war and crop failure, millions of people die in each of at least ten famines between the 1920s and the 1990s.[ 122]

After the Peace of Westphalia, which end the war in favour of nations decide their own religious allegiance, absolutism become the norm of the continent, while parts of Europe experiment with constitutions foreshadow by the English Civil War and particularly the Glorious Revolution. European military conflict do not cease, but have less disruptive effects on the lives of Europeans. In the advanced northwest, the Enlightenment give a philosophical underpinning to the new outlook, and the continue spread of literacy, make possible by the printing press, create new secular forces in thought.

Various conjectures have been made as to the meaning these paintings had to the people that made them. Prehistoric men may have painted animals to "catch" their soul or spirit in order to hunt them more easily or the paintings may represent an animistic vision and homage to surrounding nature. They may be the result of a basic need of expression that is innate to human beings, or they could have been for the transmission of practical information.

In 2009, Barack Obama was inaugurated as the first African American to be President of the United States. Two years later, Osama Bin Laden, perpetrator of 9/11, was found and killed. In December 18, 2011, the Iraq War was declared formally over once the troops had pulled out. In turn so was the Afghanistan War on December 28, 2014 when troops pulled out from there as well but some stayed behind for phase two of the conflict.

This awkward period be fairly short-lived. 1929 be a watershed year: William Wellman with Chinatown Nights and The Man I Love, Rouben Mamoulian with Applause, Alfred Hitchcock with Blackmail( Britain's first sound feature), be among the directors to bring greater fluidity to talkies and experiment with the expressive use of sound( Eyman, 1997). In this, they both benefit from, and push further, technical advances in microphones and cameras, and capabilities for edit and post-synchronizing sound( rather than record all sound directly at the time of film).

The main authors of classical Indian mathematics( 400 CE to 1200 CE) be scholars like Aryabhata, Brahmagupta, and Bhaskara II. Indian mathematicians make early contributions to the study of the decimal number system, zero, negative numbers, arithmetic, and algebra. In addition, trigonometry, have evolve in the Hellenistic world and have be introduce into ancient India through the translation of Greek works, be further advanced in India, and, in particular, the modern definitions of sine and cosine be develop there. These mathematical concepts be transmit to the Middle East, China, and Europe and lead to further developments that now form the foundations of many areas of mathematics.

The Song dynasty be also a period of major innovation in the history of warfare. Gunpowder, while invent in the Tang Dynasty, be first put into use in battlefields by the Song army, inspire a succession of new firearms and siege engines designs. During the Southern Song Dynasty, as its survival hinge decisively on guard the Yangtze and Huai River against the cavalry forces from the north, the first stand navy in China be assemble in 1132, with its admiral's headquarters establish at Dinghai. Paddle-wheel warships equip with trebuchets could launch incendiary bombs make of gunpowder and lime, as record in Song's victory over the invading Jin forces at the Battle of Tangdao in the East China Sea, and the Battle of Caishi on the Yangtze River in 1161.
Roman architecture

A difference between Europe and most of the regions of Eurasia is that each of the latter regions has few obstructions internally even though it is ringed by mountains and deserts. This meant that it was easier to establish unified control over the entire region, and this did occur with massive empires consistently dominating the Middle East, China, and at times, much of India. Europe, however, is riddled with internal mountain ranges: The Carpathians, the Alps, the Pyrenees and many others. Throughout its history, Europe has thus usually been divided into many small states, much like the Middle East and Indian subcontinent for much of their history.

In France, Enlightenment be base in the salons and culminate in the great Encyclopédie( 1751–72) edit by Denis Diderot( 1713–1784) and( until 1759) Jean le Rond d'Alembert( 1717–1783) with contributions by hundreds of lead intellectuals who be call philosophes, notably Voltaire( 1694–1778), Rousseau( 1712–1778) and Montesquieu( 1689–1755). Some 25,000 copies of the 35 volume encyclopedia be sell, half of them outside France. These new intellectual strains would spread to urban centres across Europe, notably England, Scotland, the German states, the Netherlands, Poland, Russia, Italy, Austria, and Spain, as well as Britain's American colonies.

A culture's music be influence by all other aspects of that culture, include social and economic organization and experience, climate, and access to technology. The emotions and ideas that music express, the situations in which music be play and listen to, and the attitudes toward music players and composers all vary between regions and periods. `` Music history'' be the distinct subfield of musicology and history which studies music( particularly Western art music) from a chronological perspective.

Industrialization be the process of social and economic change whereby a human group be transform from a pre-industrial society into an industrial one. It be a subdivision of a more general modernization process, where social change and economic development be closely relate with technological innovation, particularly with the development of large-scale energy and metallurgy production. It be the extensive organization of an economy for the purpose of manufacturing. Industrialization also introduce a form of philosophical change, where people obtain a different attitude towards their perception of nature.

Late in the 20th century several prominent skeptical foundations be form to counter the growth of pseudosciences. In the USA, the most notable of these be, in chronological order, the Center for Inquiry( 1991), The Skeptics Society( 1992), the James Randi Educational Foundation( 1996), and the New England Skeptical Society( 1996). The Committee for Skeptical Inquiry, which have similar goals, have already be found in 1976. It become part of the Center for Inquiry as part of the foundation of the latter in 1991. In the Netherlands Stichting Skepsis be found in 1987.

Significant advances in ancient Egypt include astronomy, mathematics and medicine.[ 3] Their geometry be a necessary outgrowth of survey to preserve the layout and ownership of farmland, which be flood annually by the Nile river. The 3-4-5 right triangle and other rules of thumb serve to represent rectilinear structures include their post and lintel architecture. Egypt be also a centre of alchemical research for much of the western world.

Later, during the Ch'in dynasty (246-207 BC), a hierarchy of officials was set up to provide central control over the outlying areas of the empire. To enter this hierarchy, both literacy and knowledge of the increasing body of philosophy was required: "....the content of the educational process was designed not to engender functionally specific skills but rather to produce morally enlightened and cultivated generalists".[30]

The first historians used their works for the lauding of Roman culture and customs. By the end of Republic, some historians distorted their histories to flatter their patrons—especially at the time of Marius's and Sulla's clash.[236] Caesar wrote his own histories to make a complete account of his military campaigns in Gaul and during the Civil War.

The Tang dynasty be found by Emperor Gaozu on 18 June 618. It be a golden age of Chinese civilization and consider to be the most prosperous period of China with significant developments in culture, art, literature, particularly poetry, and technology. Buddhism become the predominant religion for the common people. Chang'an( modern Xi'an), the national capital, be the largest city in the world during its time.[ 36]
In Canada, education become a contentious issue after Confederation in 1867, especially regard the status of French schools outside Quebec.

The mid 20th century saw a series of studies relying to the role of science in a social context, starting from Thomas Kuhn's The Structure of Scientific Revolutions in 1962. It opened the study of science to new disciplines by suggesting that the evolution of science was in part sociologically determined and that positivism did not explain the actual interactions and strategies of the human participants in science. As Thomas Kuhn put it, the history of science may be seen in more nuanced terms, such as that of competing paradigms or conceptual systems in a wider matrix that includes intellectual, cultural, economic and political themes outside of science. "Partly by selection and partly by distortion, the scientists of earlier ages are implicitly presented as having worked upon the same set of fixed problems and in accordance with the same set of fixed canons that the most recent revolution in scientific theory and method made seem scientific."[127]

Peirce be one of the founders of statistics. He formulate modern statistics in `` Illustrations of the Logic of Science''( 1877–1878) and `` A Theory of Probable Inference''( 1883). With a repeated measures design, he introduce blind, control randomized experiments( before Fisher). He invent an optimal design for experiments on gravity, in which he `` correct the means''. He use logistic regression, correlation, and smoothing, and improve the treatment of outliers. He introduce terms `` confidence'' and `` likelihood''( before Neyman and Fisher).( See the historical books of Stephen Stigler.) Many of Peirce's ideas be later popularize and develop by Ronald A. Fisher, Jerzy Neyman, Frank P. Ramsey, Bruno de Finetti, and Karl Popper.

Chinese classical music be the traditional art or court music of China. It have a long history stretch for more than three thousand years. It have its own unique systems of musical notation, as well as musical tuning and pitch, musical instruments and styles or musical genres. Chinese music be pentatonic-diatonic, have a scale of twelve notes to an octave( 5+7= 12) as do European-influenced music.

During the 15th century, Henry the Navigator of Portugal support explorations of the African coast and become a leader in the promotion of geographic studies. Among the most notable accounts of voyages and discoveries publish during the 16th century be those by Giambattista Ramusio in Venice, by Richard Hakluyt in England, and by Theodore de Bry in what be now Belgium.

In West Africa, the wet phase ushered in an expanding rainforest and wooded savannah from Senegal to Cameroon. Between 9000 and 5000 BCE, Niger–Congo speakers domesticated the oil palm and raffia palm. Two seed plants, black-eyed peas and voandzeia (African groundnuts), were domesticated, followed by okra and kola nuts. Since most of the plants grew in the forest, the Niger–Congo speakers invented polished stone axes for clearing forest.[17]

Machines that compute with continuous values become know as the analog kind. They use machinery that represent continuous numeric quantities, like the angle of a shaft rotation or difference in electrical potential.[ citation need]

Many scientific advances were also achieved during this period. The Maya refined their calendar, script, and mathematics to their highest level of development. Writing came to be used throughout the Mayan area, although it was still regarded as a noble activity and practiced only by noble scribes, painters, and priests. Using a similar system of writing, other cultures developed their own scripts, the most notable examples being those of the Ñuiñe culture and the Zapotecs of Oaxaca, although the Mayan system was the only fully developed writing system in Precolumbian America. Astronomy remained a matter of vital significance because of its importance for agriculture, the economic basis of Mesoamerican society, and to predict events in the future such as lunar and solar eclipses, an important feature for the rulers, proving to the commoners their links with the heavenly world.

While the works of almost all earlier geographers have been lost, many of them are partially known through quotations found in Strabo (64/63 BC – ca. AD 24). Strabo's seventeen volume work of geography is almost completely extant, and is one of the most important sources of information on classical geography. Strabo accepted the narrow band of habitation theory, and rejected the accounts of Hanno and Pytheas as fables. None of Strabo's maps survive, but his detailed descriptions give a clear picture of the status of geographical knowledge of the time. Pliny the Elder's (AD 23 – 79) Natural History also has sections on geography. A century after Strabo Ptolemy (AD 90 – 168) launched a similar undertaking. By this time the Roman Empire had expanded through much of Europe, and previously unknown areas such as the British Isles had been explored. The Silk Road was also in operation, and for the first time knowledge of the far east began to be known. Ptolemy's Geographia opens with a theoretical discussion about the nature and techniques of geographical inquiry, and then moves to detailed descriptions of much the known world. Ptolemy lists a huge number of cities, tribes, and sites and places them in the world. It is uncertain what Ptolemy's names correspond to in the modern world, and a vast amount of scholarship has gone into trying to link Ptolemaic descriptions to known locations.

Some historians have speculated that lead pipes in the sewer and plumbing systems led to widespread lead poisoning, which contributed to the decline in birth rate and general decay of Roman society leading up to the fall of Rome. However, lead content would have been minimized because the flow of water from aqueducts could not be shut off; it ran continuously through public and private outlets into the drains, and only a few taps were in use.[228] Other authors have raised similar objections to this theory, also pointing out that Roman water pipes were thickly coated with deposits that would have prevented lead from leaching into the water.[229]

Early sources, from the Buddhist Pāli Canon, the Jain Agamas and the Hindu Puranas, mentions Magadha being ruled by the Haryanka dynasty for some 200 years, c. 600 BCE – 413 BCE. The Hindu epic Mahabharata calls Brihadratha the first ruler of Magadha. King Bimbisara of the Haryanka dynasty led an active and expansive policy, conquering Anga in what is now West Bengal. The death of King Bimbisara was at the hands of his son, Prince Ajatashatru. King Pasenadi, ruler of neighbouring Kosala and brother-in-law of King Bimbisara, promptly retook the gift of the Kashi province.

Due to its low population, Oceania be a popular location for atmospheric and underground nuclear tests. The inhabitants of Indus civilisation also tried to standardise measurement of length to a high degree of accuracy. They designed a ruler—the Mohenjo-daro ruler—whose unit of length (approximately 1.32 inches or 3.4 centimetres) was divided into ten equal parts. Bricks manufactured in ancient Mohenjo-daro often had dimensions that were integral multiples of this unit of length.[21][22]

All these theories imply that matter is a continuous substance. Two Greek philosophers, Leucippus (first half of the 5th century BC) and Democritus of Abdera (lived about 410 BC) came up with the notion that there were two real entities: atoms, which were small indivisible particles of matter, and the void, which was the empty space in which matter was located.[10] Although all the explanations from Thales to Democritus involve matter, what is more important is the fact that these rival explanations suggest an ongoing process of debate in which alternate theories were put forth and criticized.

In recent years human ecology have be a topic that have interested organizational researchers. Hannan and Freeman( Population Ecology of Organizations( 1977), American Journal of Sociology) argue that organizations do not only adapt to an environment. Instead it be also the environment that select or reject populations of organizations. In any give environment( in equilibrium) there will only be one form of organization( isomorphism). Organizational ecology have be a prominent theory in account for diversities of organizations and their changing composition over time.

A major change in the metal industries during the era of the Industrial Revolution be the replacement of wood and other bio-fuels with coal. For a give amount of heat, coal require much less labour to mine than cut wood and convert it to charcoal,[ 37] and coal be more abundant than wood.[ 22]

This work's importance was not noticed, as [Thaddeus J. Trenn] editor of the English edition published in 1979 writes, 'Fleck's pioneering monograph was published at almost the same time as Karl Popper's Logik der Forschung. But, developed in very different cognitive styles, the books met with contrasting response. In Popper's own words, his book "was surprisingly successful, far beyond Vienna. [...]" [...] It is perhaps most diagnostic that the book received no review notice at all in George Sarton's Isis, by then the leading international journal of the history of science.' By the 18th century ballet have migrate from the royal court to the Paris Opera, and the director Lully `` preserve the ballet du cour's basic concept of a composite form, in which the dance be an essential and important element.'' During this century the ballet be to develop throughout Europe, from a courtly arrangement of move images use as part of a larger spectacle, to a performance art in its own right, the ballet d'action. This new form sweep away much of the artificiality of the court dance and strove towards `` the concept that art should aspire to imitate nature.'' This ultimately result in costuming and choreography that be much more liberating to the dancer, and conducive to a fuller use of the expressive capacity of the body. It also open the door to pointework, for this acceptance of more naturalistic costuming allow the development of the heel-less shoe, which lead to the dancer be able to make more use of the rise onto demi-pointe.

Computers continued to become smaller and more powerful, to the point where they could be carried. Pagers existing since the 1950s, were largely replaced by mobile phones beginning in the late 1990s, providing mobile networking features to some computers. Starting in the late 1990s, tablets and then smartphones combined and extended these abilities of computing, mobility, and information sharing.

After World War I, Europe and the Soviet Union lay in ruins, and the British Empire was nearing its end, leaving the United States as the preeminent global economic power. Before World War II, American economists had played a minor role. During this time institutional economists had been largely critical of the "American Way" of life, especially the conspicuous consumption of the Roaring Twenties before the Wall Street Crash of 1929. The most important development in economic thought during the Great Depression was the Keynesian revolution, including the publication in 1936 of The General Theory of Employment, Interest, and Money by John Maynard Keynes. (See the discussion of Keynesianism below.) Subsequently, a more orthodox body of thought took root, reacting against the lucid debating style of Keynes, and remathematizing the profession. The orthodox center was also challenged by a more radical group of scholars based at the University of Chicago, who advocated "liberty" and "freedom", looking back to 19th century-style non-interventionist governments.[citation needed]

These forms include the komedya, the playlets, the sinakulo, the sarswela, and the drama. Child labour exist before the Industrial Revolution but with the increase in population and education it become more visible. Many children be force to work in relatively bad conditions for much lower pay than their elders,[ 105] 10–20% of an adult male's wage.[ 106] Children as young as four be employ.[ 106] Beatings and long hours be common, with some child coal miners and hurriers work from 4 be until 5 pm.[ 106] Conditions be dangerous, with some children kill when they doze off and fell into the path of the carts, while others die from gas explosions.[ 106] Many children develop lung cancer and other diseases and die before the age of 25.[ 106] Workhouses would sell orphans and abandon children as `` pauper apprentices'', work without wages for board and lodging.[ 106] Those who run away would be whip and return to their masters, with some masters shackle them to prevent escape.[ 106] Children employ as mule scavengers by cotton mills would crawl under machinery to pick up cotton, work 14 hours a day, six days a week. Some lost hands or limbs, others be crush under the machines, and some be decapitate.[ 106] Young girls work at match factories, where phosphorus fumes would cause many to develop phossy jaw.[ 106] Children employ at glassworks be regularly burn and blind, and those work at potteries be vulnerable to poisonous clay dust.[ 106]
