The desire for wartime propaganda create a renaissance in the film industry in Britain, with realistic war dramas. The onset of American involvement in World War II also bring a proliferation of films as both patriotism and propaganda. The House Un-American Activities Committee investigate Hollywood in the early 1950s. During the immediate post-war years the cinematic industry be also threaten by television, and the increase popularity of the medium mean that some film theatres would bankrupt and close. Following the end of World War II in the 1940s, the follow decade, the 1950s, mark a'Golden Age' for non-English world cinema.

Neoclassical economics develop in the 1870s. There be three main independent schools. The Cambridge School be found with the 1871 publication of Jevons' Theory of Political Economy, develop theories of partial equilibrium and focus on market failures. Its main representatives be Stanley Jevons, Alfred Marshall, and Arthur Pigou. The Austrian School of Economics be make up of Austrian economists Carl Menger, Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk, and Friedrich von Wieser, who develop the theory of capital and try to explain economic crises. It be found with the 1871 publication of Menger's Principles of Economics. The Lausanne School, lead by Léon Walras and Vilfredo Pareto, develop the theories of general equilibrium and Pareto efficiency. It be found with the 1874 publication of Walras' Elements of Pure Economics.
At the end of the Iron Age, Nubia become a major manufacturer and exporter of iron. This be after be expel from Egypt by Assyrians, who use iron weapons.[ 58]

The French organize their first expedition in 1903 under the leadership of Jean-Baptiste Charcot. Originally intend as a relief expedition for the stranded Nordenskiöld party, the main work of this expedition be the mapping and charting of islands and the western coasts of Graham Land, on the Antarctic peninsula. A section of the coast be explore, and name Loubet Land after the President of France.[ 41][ 42][ 43]
The history of rail transport also includes the history of rapid transit and arguably monorail history.

By the 17th century the influence of Renaissance paint result in Russian icons become slightly more realistic, while still follow most of the old icon painting canons, as see in the works of Bogdan Saltanov, Simon Ushakov, Gury Nikitin, Karp Zolotaryov and other Russian artists of the era. Gradually the new type of secular portrait painting appear, call parsúna( from `` persona'' – person), which be transitional style between abstract iconographics and real paintings.

The world's technological capacity to receive information through one-way broadcast networks be 432 exabytes of( optimally compress) information in 1986, 715( optimally compress) exabytes in 1993, 1.2( optimally compress) zettabytes in 2000, and 1.9 zettabytes in 2007( this be the information equivalent of 174 newspapers per person per day).[ 7] The world's effective capacity to exchange information through two-way telecommunication networks be 281 petabytes of( optimally compress) information in 1986, 471 petabytes in 1993, 2.2( optimally compress) exabytes in 2000, and 65( optimally compress) exabytes in 2007( this be the information equivalent of 6 newspapers per person per day).[ 7] In the 1990s, the spread of the Internet cause a sudden leap in access to and ability to share information in businesses and homes globally. Technology be develop so quickly that a computer cost$ 3000 in 1997 would cost$ 2000 two years later and$ 1000 the following year.

A problem with future history science fiction is that it will date and be overtaken by real historical events, for instance H. Beam Piper's future history, which included a nuclear war in 1973, and much of the future history of Star Trek. Jerry Pournelle's "CoDominium" future history assumed that the Cold War would end with the United States and Soviet Union establishing a co-rule of the world, the CoDominium of the title, which would last into the 22nd Century—rather than the Soviet Union collapsing in 1991.

Since historiographical debates regard the proper method for the study of the history of science be sometimes difficult to demarcate from historical controversies regard the very course of science, it be often( and rightly) the case that the early controversies of the latter kind be consider the inception of the sub-discipline. For example, such discussions permeate the historical writings of the great historian and philosopher of science William Whewell. He be thus often( and rightly) view as the grandfather of this discipline; other such distinguish grandfathers be Pierre Duhem and Alexandre Koyré.

The Iberian states (Spain and Portugal) were able to dominate New World (American) colonial activity in the 16th century. The Spanish constituted the first global empire and during the 16th century and the first half of the 17th century, Spain was the most powerful nation in the world, but was increasingly challenged by British, French, and the short-lived Dutch and Swedish colonial efforts of the 17th and 18th centuries. New forms of trade and expanding horizons made new forms of government, law and eco nomics necessary.

In 1974 American economist Arthur Laffer formulate the Laffer Curve, which postulate that no tax revenue will be raise at the extreme tax rates of 0% and 100%, and that there must be at least one rate where tax revenue would be a non-zero maximum. This concept be adopt by U.S. President Ronald Reagan in the early 1980s, become the cornerstone of Reaganomics, which be co-founded by American economist Paul Craig Roberts.

Japan isolate itself from the rest of the world in the year 1600 under the Tokugawa regime( 1600–1867). In 1600 very few common people be literate. By the period's end, learn have become widespread. Tokugawa education leave a valuable legacy: an increasingly literate populace, a meritocratic ideology, and an emphasis on discipline and competent performance. Traditional Samurai curricula for elites stress morality and the martial arts. Confucian classics be memorize, and reading and recitation of them be common methods of study. Arithmetic and calligraphy be also study. Education of commoners be generally practically orient, provide basic 3-Rs, calligraphy and use of the abacus. Much of this education be conduct in so-called temple schools( terakoya), derive from earlier Buddhist schools. These schools be no longer religious institutions, nor be they, by 1867, predominantly locate in temples. By the end of the Tokugawa period, there be more than 11,000 such schools, attend by 750,000 students. Teaching techniques include read from various textbooks, memorizing, abacus, and repeatedly copy Chinese characters and Japanese script. By the 1860s, 40-50% of Japanese boys, and 15% of the girls, have some schooling outside the home. These rates be comparable to major European nations at the time( apart from Germany, which have compulsory schooling).[ 72] Under subsequent Meiji leadership, this foundation would facilitate Japan's rapid transition from feudal society to modern nation which pay very close attention to Western science, technology and educational methods..

On 20 September 1792 the National Convention abolish the monarchy and declare France a republic. Due to the emergency of war the National Convention create the Committee of Public Safety, control by Maximilien de Robespierre of the Jacobin Club, to act as the country's executive. Under Robespierre the committee initiate the Reign of Terror, during which up to 40,000 people be execute in Paris, mainly nobles and those convict by the Revolutionary Tribunal, often on the flimsiest of evidence. Internal tensions at Paris drive the Committee towards increase assertions of radicalism and increase suspicions, fuel new terror: a few months into this phase, more and more prominent revolutionaries be be send to the guilloutine by Robespierre and his faction, for example Madame Roland and Georges Danton. Elsewhere in the country, counter-revolutionary insurrections be brutally suppress. The regime be overthrow in the coup of 9 Thermidor( 27 July 1794) and Robespierre be execute. The regime which follow end the Terror and relax Robespierre's more extreme policies.

The history of telecommunication- the transmission of signals over a distance for the purpose of communication- begin thousands of years ago with the use of smoke signals and drums in Africa, America and parts of Asia. In the 1790s the first fix semaphore systems emerge in Europe however it be not until the 1830s that electrical[ telecommunication] systems start to appear.

The policy of work with the Kuomintang and Chiang Kai-shek have be recommend by the Dutch Communist Henk Sneevliet, choose in 1923 to be the Comintern representative in China due to his revolutionary experience in the Dutch Indies, where he have a major role in found the Partai Komunis Indonesia( PKI) – and who felt that the Chinese party be too small and weak to undertake a major effort on its own( see Henk Sneevliet's work for the Comintern).

There be complex dialectal variation in words with the open front and open back vowels /æ ɑː ɒ ɔː/. These four vowels be only distinguish in RP, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa. In GA, these vowels merge to three /æ ɑ ɔ/,[ 156] and in Canadian English they merge to two /æ ɑ/.[ 157] In addition, the words that have each vowel vary by dialect. The table `` Dialects and open vowels'' show this variation with lexical sets in which these sounds occur.

Coffeehouses represent a turn point in history during which people discover that they could have enjoyable social lives within their communities. Coffeeshops become homes away from home for many who seek, for the first time, to engage in discourse with their neighbors and discuss intriguing and thought-provoking matters, especially those regard philosophy to politics. Coffeehouses be essential to the Enlightenment, for they be centers of free-thinking and self-discovery. Although many coffeehouse patrons be scholars, a great deal be not. Coffeehouses attract a diverse set of people, include not only the educate wealthy but also members of the bourgeoisie and the lower class. While it may seem positive that patrons, be doctors, lawyers, merchants, etc. represent almost all classes, the coffeeshop environment spark fear in those who seek to preserve class distinction. One of the most popular critiques of the coffeehouse claim that it `` allow promiscuous association among people from different rungs of the social ladder, from the artisan to the aristocrat'' and be therefore compare to Noah's Ark, receive all types of animals, clean or unclean.[ 196] This unique culture serve as a catalyst for journalism when Joseph Addison and Richard Steele recognize its potential as an audience. Together, Steele and Addison publish The Spectator( 1711), a daily publication which aim, through fictional narrator Mr. Spectator, both to entertain and to provoke discussion regard serious philosophical matters.

Impermanent buildings, which be often architecturally unique from region to region, continue to influence American architecture today. In his summary, `` The World of Textiles'', North Carolina State's Tushar Ghosh provide one example: the Denver International Airport's roof be a fabric structure that be influence by and/or resembles the tipis of local cultures. In write about Evergreen State College, Lloyd Vaughn list an example of very different native architecture that also influence contemporary building: the Native American Studies program be house in a modern-day longhouse derive from pre-Columbian Pacific Northwest architecture.

Olmec symbols find in 2002 and 2006 date to 650 BC[ 184] and 900 BC[ 185] respectively, precede the oldest Zapotec writing.[ 186][ 187] The Olmec symbols find in 2006, date to 900 BC, be know as the Cascajal Block.

In 1933 American economist Edward Chamberlin( 1899–1967) publish The Theory of Monopolistic Competition. The same year British economist Joan Robinson( 1903–1983) publish The Economics of Imperfect Competition. Together they found Industrial Organization Economics. Chamberlin also found Experimental Economics.
Hellenistic scholars frequently employ the principles develop in earlier Greek thought: the application of mathematics and deliberate empirical research, in their scientific investigations.[ 22]

In July his men take over Veracruz and he place himself under direct orders of new king Charles I of Spain.[ 110] There Cortés ask for a meeting with Aztec Emperor Montezuma II, who repeatedly refuse. They head to Tenochtitlan and on the way make alliances with several tribes. In October, accompany by about 3,000 Tlaxcaltec they march to Cholula, the second largest city in central Mexico. Either to instill fear upon the Aztecs wait for him or( as he later claim) wish to make an example when he fear native treachery, they massacre thousands of unarmed members of the nobility gather at the central plaza and partially burn the city.

Piye made various unsuccessful attempts to extend Egyptian influence in the Near East, then controlled by Assyria. In 720 BC, he sent an army in support of a rebellion against Assyria, which was taking place in Philistia and Gaza. However, Piye was defeated by Sargon II and the rebellion failed. In 711 BC, Piye again supported a revolt against Assyria by the Israelites of Ashdod and was once again defeated by the Assyrian king Sargon II. Subsequently, Piye was forced from the Near East.[67]

The fall of the Sassanid Empire to invading Islamic forces ironically led to the creation of remarkable religious buildings in Iran. Arts such as calligraphy, stucco work, mirror work, and mosaic work, became closely tied with architecture in Iran in the new era. Archaeological excavations have provided sufficient documents in support of the impacts of Sasanian architecture on the architecture of the Islamic world. Many experts believe the period of Persian architecture from the 15th through 17th Centuries to be the most brilliant of the post-Islamic era. Various structures such as mosques, mausoleums, bazaars, bridges, and different palaces have mainly survived from this period.

Charles Proteus Steinmetz helped foster the development of alternating current that made possible the expansion of the electric power industry in the United States, formulating mathematical theories for engineers.

The first schools in Ancient Rome arose by the middle of the 4th century BC.[33] These schools were concerned with the basic socialization and rudimentary education of young Roman children. The literacy rate in the 3rd century BC has been estimated as around one percent to two percent.[34] There are very few primary sources or accounts of Roman educational process until the 2nd century BC,[33] during which there was a proliferation of private schools in Rome.[34] At the height of the Roman Republic and later the Roman Empire, the Roman educational system gradually found its final form. Formal schools were established, which served paying students (very little in the way of free public education as we know it can be found).[35] Normally, both boys and girls were educated, though not necessarily together.[35] In a system much like the one that predominates in the modern world, the Roman education system that developed arranged schools in tiers. The educator Quintilian recognized the importance of starting education as early as possible, noting that "memory … not only exists even in small children, but is specially retentive at that age".[36] A Roman student would progress through schools just as a student today might go from elementary school to middle school, then to high school, and finally college. Progression depended more on ability than age[35] with great emphasis being placed upon a student's ingenium or inborn "gift" for learning,[37] and a more tacit emphasis on a student's ability to afford high-level education. Only the Roman elite would expect a complete formal education. A tradesman or farmer would expect to pick up most of his vocational skills on the job. Higher education in Rome was more of a status symbol than a practical concern.

As a result of the development of agriculture in the south, many important cultural advances were made there. For example, the Maya civilization developed a writing system, built huge pyramids, had a complex calendar, and developed the concept of zero 500 years before anyone in the Old World. The Mayan culture was still present when the Spanish arrived in Central America, but political dominance in the area had shifted to the Aztec Empire further north.

That year John Cabot, also a commissioned Italian, got letters patent from King Henry VII of England. Sailing from Bristol, probably backed by the local Society of Merchant Venturers, Cabot crossed the Atlantic from a northerly latitude hoping the voyage to the "West Indies" would be shorter[65] and made a landfall somewhere in North America, possibly Newfoundland. In 1499 João Fernandes Lavrador was licensed by the King of Portugal and together with Pêro de Barcelos they first sighted Labrador, which was granted and named after him. After returning he possibly went to Bristol to sail in the name of England.[66] Nearly at the same time, between 1499 and 1502 brothers Gaspar and Miguel Corte Real explored and named the coasts of Greenland and also Newfoundland.[67] Both explorations are noted in the 1502 Cantino planisphere.

The overall period be characterize by widespread use of bronze, though the place and time of the introduction and development of bronze technology be not universally synchronous.[ 2] Human-made tin bronze technology require set production techniques. Tin must be mine( mainly as the tin ore cassiterite) and smelt separately, then add to molten copper to make bronze alloy. The Bronze Age be a time of extensive use of metals and of develop trade networks( See Tin sources and trade in ancient times). A 2013 report suggest that the earliest tin-alloy bronze dates to the mid-5th millennium BC in a Vinča culture site in Pločnik( Serbia), although the civilization be not conventionally consider part of the Bronze Age.[ 3] The dating of the foil have be dispute.[ 4][ 5][ 6]

Toward the end of the early modern period, Europe be dominate by the evolve system of mercantile capitalism in its trade and the New Economy. European states and politics have the characteristic of Absolutism. The French power and English revolutions dominate the political scene. There eventually evolve an international balance of power that hold at bay a great conflagration until years later.
From roughly 1980 onwards, pragmatic, functional, and cognitive approaches have steadily gain ground, both in the United States and in Europe.

Adjectives be derive from nouns through a process that Egyptologists call nisbation because of its similarity with Arabic.[ 130] The word order be predicate–subject in verbal and adjectival sentences, and subject–predicate in nominal and adverbial sentences.[ 131] The subject can be move to the beginning of sentences if it be long and be follow by a resumptive pronoun.[ 132] Verbs and nouns be negate by the particle n, but nn be use for adverbial and adjectival sentences. Stress fall on the ultimate or penultimate syllable, which can be open( CV) or close( CVC).[ 133]

In 1453 the fall of Constantinople to the hands of the Ottomans was a blow to Christendom and the established business relations linking with the east. In 1455 Pope Nicholas V issued the bull Romanus Pontifex reinforcing the previous Dum Diversas (1452), granting all lands and seas discovered beyond Cape Bojador to King Afonso V of Portugal and his successors, as well as trade and conquest against Muslims and pagans, initiating a mare clausum policy in the Atlantic.[53] The king, who had been inquiring of Genoese experts about a seaway to India, commissioned the Fra Mauro world map, which arrived in Lisbon in 1459.[54]

The level of Hellenistic achievement in astronomy and engineering be impressively show by the Antikythera mechanism( 150–100 BC). It be a 37-gear mechanical computer which compute the motions of the Sun and Moon, include lunar and solar eclipses predict on the basis of astronomical periods believe to have be learn from the Babylonians.[ 25] Devices of this sort be not find again until the 10th century, when a simpler eight-geared luni-solar calculator incorporate into an astrolabe be describe by the Persian scholar, Al-Biruni.[ 26][ not in citation give] Similarly complex devices be also develop by other Muslim engineers and astronomers during the Middle Ages.[ 25]

During the Gilded Age, there be substantial growth in population in the United States and extravagant displays of wealth and excess of America's upper-class during the post-Civil War and post-Reconstruction era, in the late 19th century. The wealth polarization derive primarily from industrial and population expansion. The businessmen of the Second Industrial Revolution create industrial towns and cities in the Northeast with new factories, and contribute to the creation of an ethnically diverse industrial work class which produce the wealth own by rise super-rich industrialists and financiers call the `` robber barons''. An example be the company of John D. Rockefeller, who be an important figure in shape the new oil industry. Using highly effective tactics and aggressive practices, later widely criticize, Standard Oil absorb or destroy most of its competition.

Titus die of fever in 81 AD, and be succeed by his brother Domitian. As emperor, Domitian assume totalitarian characteristics,[ 93] thought he could be a new Augustus, and try to make a personal cult of himself.

The earliest archaeological site in the subcontinent is the Palaeolithic hominid site in the Soan River valley.[38][39][40] Soanian sites are found in the Sivalik region across what are now India, Pakistan, and Nepal.[41][42][43]

The Stone Age of Europe is characteristically in deficit of known transitions. The 19th and early 20th-century innovators of the modern three-age system recognized the problem of the initial transition, the "gap" between the Paleolithic and the Neolithic. Louis Leakey provided something of an answer by proving that man evolved in Africa. The Stone Age must have begun there to be carried repeatedly to Europe by migrant populations. The different phases of the Stone Age thus could appear there without transitions. The burden on African archaeologists became all the greater, because now they must find the missing transitions in Africa. The problem is difficult and ongoing.

Development of the scientific basis for electrical engineering, with the tools of modern research techniques, intensified during the 19th century. Notable developments early in this century include the work of Georg Ohm, who in 1827 quantified the relationship between the electric current and potential difference in a conductor, Michael Faraday, the discoverer of electromagnetic induction in 1831.[15] In the 1830s, Georg Ohm also constructed an early electrostatic machine. The homopolar generator was developed first by Michael Faraday during his memorable experiments in 1831. It was the beginning of modern dynamos — that is, electrical generators which operate using a magnetic field. The invention of the industrial generator, which didn't need external magnetic power in 1866 by Werner von Siemens made a large series of other inventions in the wake possible.

From this changing society emerged a common, unifying musical language, in particular the polyphonic style of the Franco-Flemish school. The development of printing made distribution of music possible on a wide scale. Demand for music as entertainment and as an activity for educated amateurs increased with the emergence of a bourgeois class. Dissemination of chansons, motets, and masses throughout Europe coincided with the unification of polyphonic practice into the fluid style that culminated in the second half of the sixteenth century in the work of composers such as Palestrina, Lassus, Victoria and William Byrd.

Post-classical cinema be the change methods of storytelling of the New Hollywood producers. The new methods of drama and characterization play upon audience expectations acquire during the classical/Golden Age period: story chronology may be scramble, storylines may feature unsettle `` twist endings'', main characters may behave in a morally ambiguous fashion, and the lines between the antagonist and protagonist may be blur. The beginnings of post-classical storytelling may be see in 1940s and 1950s film noir films, in films such as Rebel Without a Cause( 1955), and in Hitchcock's Psycho. 1971 mark the release of controversial films like Straw Dogs, A Clockwork Orange, The French Connection and Dirty Harry. This spark heated controversy over the perceived escalation of violence in cinema.

Settlement by the Spanish start the European colonization of the Americas.[ 23][ 24] They gain control of most of the largest islands in the Caribbean and conquer the Aztecs, gain control of present-day Mexico and Central America. This be the beginning of the Spanish Empire in the New World. The first successful Spanish settlement in continental North America be Veracruz in 1519, follow by many other settlements in colonial New Spain and Spanish Florida.

Around 16,000 BC, Europe witnessed the appearance of a new culture, known as Magdalenian, possibly rooted in the old Gravettian. This culture soon superseded the Solutrean area and the Gravettian of mainly France, Spain, Germany, Italy, Poland, Portugal and Ukraine. The Hamburg culture prevailed in Northern Europe in the 14th and the 13th millennium BC as the Creswellian (also termed the British Late Magdalenian) did shortly after in the British Islands. Around 12,500 BC, the Würm glaciation ended. Slowly, through the following millennia, temperatures and sea levels rose, changing the environment of prehistoric people. Nevertheless, Magdalenian culture persisted until c. 10,000 BC, when it quickly evolved into two microlithist cultures: Azilian (Federmesser), in Spain and southern France, and then Sauveterrian, in northern France and Central Europe, while in Northern Europe the Lyngby complex succeeded the Hamburg culture with the influence of the Federmesser group as well. Evidence of permanent settlement dates from the 8th millennium BC in the Balkans. Neolithic reached Central Europe in the 6th millennium BC and parts of Northern Europe in the 5th and 4th millennium BC.

Australian forces attacked German New Guinea in September 1914: 500 Australians encounter 300 Germans and native policemen at the Battle of Bita Paka; the Allies win the day and the Germans retreat to Toma. A company of Australians and a British warship besiege the Germans and their colonial subjects, end with a German surrender.[ 94]

The end of Oldowan in Africa be bring on by the appearance of Acheulean, or Mode 2, stone tools. The earliest known instances be in the 1.7–1.6 mya layer at Kokiselei, West Turkana, Kenya.[ 31] At Sterkfontein, South Africa, they be in Member 5 West, 1.7–1.4 mya.[ 29] The 1.7 be a fairly certain, fairly standard date. Mode 2 be often find in association with H. erectus. It make sense that the most advanced tools should have be innovate by the most advanced Hominan; consequently, they be typically give credit for the innovation.

The Senate agree with the succession, and grant to Tiberius the same titles and honors once grant to Augustus: the title of princeps and Pater patriae, and the Civic Crown. However, Tiberius be not an enthusiast of political affairs: after agreement with the Senate, he retire to Capri in 26 AD,[ 73] and leave control of the city of Rome in the hands of the praetorian prefect Sejanus( until 31 AD) and Macro( from 31 to 37 AD). Tiberius be regard as an evil and melancholic man, who may have order the murder of his relatives, the popular general Germanicus in 19 AD,[ 74] and his own son Drusus Julius Caesar in 23 AD.[ 74]

In the western Sahel the rise of settled communities occurred largely as a result of the domestication of millet and of sorghum. Archaeology points to sizable urban populations in West Africa beginning in the 2nd millennium BCE. Symbiotic trade relations developed before the trans-Saharan trade, in response to the opportunities afforded by north-south diversity in ecosystems across deserts, grasslands, and forests. The agriculturists received salt from the desert nomads. The desert nomads acquired meat and other foods from pastoralists and farmers of the grasslands and from fishermen on the Niger River. The forest-dwellers provided furs and meat.[56]

All of this correspond with the usual dynastic decline of China see before, as well as the grow foreign threats. In the mid-16th century, Japanese and ethnic Chinese pirates begin to raid the southern coast, and neither the bureaucracy nor the military be able to stop them.[ 32] The threat of the northern Manchu people also grow. The Manchu be an already large state north of China, when in the early 17th century a local leader name Nurhaci suddenly unite them under the Eight Banners—armies that the oppose families be organize into. The Manchus adopt many Chinese customs, specifically take after their bureaucracy. Nevertheless, the Manchus still remain a Chinese vassal. In 1644 Chinese administration become so weak, the 16th and last emperor, the Chongzhen Emperor, do not respond to the severity of an ensue rebellion by local dissenters until the enemy have invade the Forbidden City( his personal estate). He soon hang himself in the imperial gardens.[ 32] For a brief amount of time, the Shun Dynasty be claim, until a loyalist Ming official call support from the Manchus to put down the new dynasty. The Shun Dynasty end within a year and the Manchu be now within the Great Wall. Taking advantage of the situation, the Manchus march on the Chinese capital of Beijing. Within two decades all of China belong to the Manchu and the Qing Dynasty be establish.

Henry wished to know how far Muslim territories in Africa extended, hoping to bypass them and trade directly with West Africa by sea, find allies in legendary Christian lands to the south[44] like the long-lost Christian kingdom of Prester John[45] and to probe whether it was possible to reach the Indies by sea, the source of the lucrative spice trade. He invested in sponsoring voyages down the coast of Mauritania, gathering a group of merchants, shipowners and stakeholders interested in new sea lanes. Soon the Atlantic islands of Madeira (1419) and the Azores (1427) were reached. In particular, they were discovered by voyages launched by the command of Prince Henry the Navigator. The expedition leader himself, who established settlements on the island of Madeira, was João Gonçalves Zarco.[46]

The Labor Party( the spelling `` Labour'' be drop in 1912) have be establish in the 1890s, after the failure of the Maritime and Shearer's strikes. Its strength be in the Australian Trade Union movement `` which grow from a membership of just under 100,000 in 1901 to more than half a million in 1914. ``[ 225] The platform of the ALP be democratic socialist. As note by the historian Ross McMullin, `` In the national sphere Labor have take the Protectionists as far in the direction of progressive legislation as possible.'' In New South Wales, Frank McDonnell dominate the agitation for the early closing of shops, which be achieve with the passage of the Factories and Shops Act of 1900, while also secure the extension of the grammar school scholarship system. In Western Australia, Forrest introduce a conciliation and arbitration bill in 1900 which bring trade unions into the state's social fabric for the first time. In addition, WA Labor score another victory with the passage of legislation which extend workers' compensation. Under the premierships of Storey and Dooley in New South Wales, various reforms be carry out such as the establishment of the Rural Bank and the elimination of high school fees.[ 226]

The Renaissance spread to France in the late 15th century, when Charles VIII return in 1496 with several Italian artists from his conquest of Naples. Renaissance chateaux be build in the Loire Valley, the earliest example be the Château d'Amboise, and the style become dominant under Francis I( 1515–47).( See Châteaux of the Loire Valley). Computer science, build upon a foundation of theoretical linguistics, discrete mathematics, and electrical engineering, studies the nature and limits of computation. Subfields include computability, computational complexity, database design, computer networking, artificial intelligence, and the design of computer hardware. One area in which advances in compute have contribute to more general scientific development be by facilitate large-scale archiving of scientific data. Contemporary computer science typically distinguish itself by emphasise mathematical'theory' in contrast to the practical emphasis of software engineering.

Some scenes of the Mesolithic, however, can be type and therefore, judge from their various modifications, be fairly clear. One of these be the battle scene between organize bands of archers. For example, `` the marching Warriors'', a rock painting at Cingle de la Mola, Castellón in Spain, date to about 7,000–4,000 BCE, depict about 50 bowmen in two groups march or run in step toward each other, each man carry a bow in one hand and a fistful of arrows in the other. Claudius conquer Lycia and Thrace; his most important deed be the beginning of the conquest of Britain.[ 80]

During the same time that the stratigraphic column be be complete, imperialism drive several countries in the early to mid 19th century to explore distant lands to expand their empires. This give naturalists the opportunity to collect data on these voyages. In 1831 Captain Robert FitzRoy, give charge of the coastal survey expedition of HMS Beagle, seek a suitable naturalist to examine the land and give geological advice. This fell to Charles Darwin, who have just complete his BA degree and have accompany Sedgwick on a two-week Welsh mapping expedition after take his Spring course on geology. Fitzroy give Darwin Lyell’s Principles of Geology, and Darwin become Lyell's first disciple, inventively theorise on uniformitarian principles about the geological processes he saw, and challenge some of Lyell's ideas. He speculate about the Earth expand to explain uplift, then on the basis of the idea that ocean areas sink as land be uplift, theorise that coral atolls grow from fringe coral reefs round sink volcanic islands. This idea be confirm when the Beagle survey the Cocos( Keeling) Islands, and in 1842 he publish his theory on The Structure and Distribution of Coral Reefs. Darwin's discovery of giant fossils help to establish his reputation as a geologist, and his theorise about the causes of their extinction lead to his theory of evolution by natural selection publish in On the Origin of Species in 1859.[ 25][ 27][ 28]

The Assyrians be credit with the introduction of horse cavalry in warfare and the extensive use of iron weapons by 1100 BCE. Assyrians be also the first to use iron-tipped arrows.[ 4]

The mixed character of Greek anthropos and Latin -logia marks it as New Latin.[ 2] There be no independent noun, logia, however, of that meaning in classical Greek. The word λόγος( logos) have that mean.[ 3] James Hunt attempt to rescue the etymology in his first address to the Anthropological Society of London as president and founder, 1863. He do find an anthropologos from Aristotle in the standard ancient Greek Lexicon, which he say define the word as “speaking or treat of man.”[ 4] This view be entirely wishful thinking, as Liddell and Scott go on to explain the meaning: “i.e. fond of personal conversation.”[ 5] If Aristotle, the very philosopher of the logos, could produce such a word without serious intent, there probably be at that time no anthropology identifiable under that name.

Putative origins for the term software engineering include a 1965 letter from ACM president Anthony Oettinger,[2][3] lectures by Douglas T. Ross at MIT in the 1950s,[4] or use by Margaret Hamilton while working on the Apollo guidance software.[5]

The Arabic and the Persian world under Islam had become highly cultured, and many important works of knowledge from Greek astronomy and Indian astronomy and Persian astronomy were translated into Arabic, used and stored in libraries throughout the area. An important contribution by Islamic astronomers was their emphasis on observational astronomy[37] This led to the emergence of the first astronomical observatories in the Muslim world by the early 9th century.[38][39] Zij star catalogues were produced at these observatories.

During the height of the Roman Empire, famous historians such as Polybius, Livy and Plutarch document the rise of the Roman Republic, and the organization and histories of other nations, while statesmen like Julius Caesar, Cicero and others provide us with examples of the politics of the republic and Rome's empire and wars. The study of politics during this age be orient toward understand history, understand methods of governing, and describe the operation of governments. Nearly a thousand years elapse, from the foundation of the city of Rome in 753 BC to the fall of the Western Roman Empire or the beginning of the Middle Ages. In the interim, there be a manifest translation of Hellenic culture into the Roman sphere. The Greek gods become Romans and Greek philosophy in one way or another turn into Roman law e.g. Stoicism. The Stoic be commit to preserve proper hierarchical roles and duties in the state so that the state as a whole would remain stable. Among the best known Roman Stoics be philosopher Seneca and the emperor Marcus Aurelius. Seneca, a wealthy Roman patrician, be often criticize by some modern commentators/historians for fail to adequately live by his own precepts. The Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, on the other hand, can be best thought of as the philosophical reflections of an emperor divide between his philosophical aspirations and the duty he felt to defend the Roman Empire from its external enemies through his various military campaigns. According to Polybius, Roman institutions be the backbone of the empire but Roman law be the medulla.[ 1]
In China, three oral texts be use to teach children by rote memorization the write characters of their language and the basics of Confucian thought.

Around the same time, Eratosthenes of Cyrene( c. 276–194 BC) devise the Sieve of Eratosthenes for find prime numbers.[ 68] The 3rd century BC be generally regard as the `` Golden Age'' of Greek mathematics, with advances in pure mathematics henceforth in relative decline.[ 69] Nevertheless, in the centuries that follow significant advances be make in applied mathematics, most notably trigonometry, largely to address the needs of astronomers.[ 69] Hipparchus of Nicaea( c. 190–120 BC) be consider the founder of trigonometry for compile the first know trigonometric table, and to him be also due the systematic use of the 360 degree circle.[ 70] Heron of Alexandria( c. 10–70 AD) be credit with Heron's formula for find the area of a scalene triangle and with be the first to recognize the possibility of negative numbers possess square roots.[ 71] Menelaus of Alexandria( c. 100 AD) pioneer spherical trigonometry through Menelaus' theorem.[ 72] The most complete and influential trigonometric work of antiquity be the Almagest of Ptolemy( c. AD 90–168), a landmark astronomical treatise whose trigonometric tables would be use by astronomers for the next thousand years.[ 73] Ptolemy be also credit with Ptolemy's theorem for derive trigonometric quantities, and the most accurate value of π outside of China until the medieval period, 3.1416.[ 74]

In 1921 Koffka publish a Gestalt-oriented text on developmental psychology, Growth of the Mind. With the help of American psychologist Robert Ogden, Koffka introduce the Gestalt point of view to an American audience in 1922 by way of a paper in Psychological Bulletin. It contain criticisms of then-current explanations of a number of problems of perception, and the alternatives offer by the Gestalt school. Koffka move to the United States in 1924, eventually settle at Smith College in 1927. In 1935 Koffka publish his Principles of Gestalt Psychology. This textbook lay out the Gestalt vision of the scientific enterprise as a whole. Science, he say, be not the simple accumulation of facts. What make research scientific be the incorporation of facts into a theoretical structure. The goal of the Gestaltists be to integrate the facts of inanimate nature, life, and mind into a single scientific structure. This meant that science would have to swallow not only what Koffka call the quantitative facts of physical science but the facts of two other `` scientific categories'': questions of order and questions of Sinn, a German word which have be variously translate as significance, value, and meaning. Without incorporate the meaning of experience and behavior, Koffka believe that science would doom itself to trivialities in its investigation of human beings.

The Greeks develop astronomy, which they treat as a branch of mathematics, to a highly sophisticated level. The first geometrical, three-dimensional models to explain the apparent motion of the planets be develop in the 4th century BC by Eudoxus of Cnidus and Callippus of Cyzicus. Their younger contemporary Heraclides Ponticus propose that the Earth rotate around its axis. In the 3rd century BC Aristarchus of Samos be the first to suggest a heliocentric system. Archimedes in his treatise The Sand Reckoner revive Aristarchus' hypothesis that `` the fixed stars and the Sun remain unmoved, while the Earth revolve about the Sun on the circumference of a circle''. Otherwise, only fragmentary descriptions of Aristarchus' idea survive.[ 31] Eratosthenes, use the angles of shadows create at widely separate regions, estimate the circumference of the Earth with great accuracy.[ 32] In the 2nd century BC Hipparchus of Nicea make a number of contributions, include the first measurement of precession and the compilation of the first star catalog in which he propose the modern system of apparent magnitudes.

In 1702, German chemist Georg Stahl coin the name `` phlogiston'' for the substance believe to be release in the process of burning. Around 1735, Swedish chemist Georg Brandt analyze a dark blue pigment find in copper ore. Brandt demonstrate that the pigment contain a new element, later name cobalt. In 1751, a Swedish chemist and pupil of Stahl's name Axel Fredrik Cronstedt, identify an impurity in copper ore as a separate metallic element, which he name nickel. Cronstedt be one of the founders of modern mineralogy.[ 42] Cronstedt also discover the mineral scheelite in 1751, which he name tungsten, mean `` heavy stone'' in Swedish.

The field of genetic engineering remain a heated topic of discussion in today's society with the advent of gene therapy, stem cell research, cloning, and genetically modify food. While it seem only natural nowadays to link pharmaceutical drugs as solutions to health and societal problems, this relationship of biotechnology serve social needs begin centuries ago.

Immanuel Kant (1724–1804) tried to reconcile rationalism and religious belief, individual freedom and political authority, as well as map out a view of the public sphere through private and public reason.[17] Kant's work continued to shape German thought, and indeed all of European philosophy, well into the 20th century.[18] Mary Wollstonecraft was one of England's earliest feminist philosophers.[19] She argued for a society based on reason, and that women, as well as men, should be treated as rational beings. She is best known for her work A Vindication of the Rights of Woman (1791).[20]

Political science as a separate field be a rather late arrival in terms of social sciences. However, the term `` political science'' be not always distinguish from political philosophy, and the modern discipline have a clear set of antecedents include also moral philosophy, political economy, political theology, history, and other fields concern with normative determinations of what ought to be and with deduce the characteristics and functions of the ideal state.

Over the 19th century, botanical geography and zoogeography combined to form the basis of biogeography. This science, which deals with habitats of species, seeks to explain the reasons for the presence of certain species in a given location.

Wallonia exemplify the radical evolution of industrial expansion. Thanks to coal( the French word `` houille'' be coin in Wallonia),[ 120] the region gear up to become the 2nd industrial power in the world after Britain. But it be also point out by many researchers, with its Sillon industriel,'Especially in the Haine, Sambre and Meuse valleys, between the Borinage and Liège,( ...) there be a huge industrial development base on coal-mining and iron-making ...'.[ 121] Philippe Raxhon write about the period after 1830: `` It be not propaganda but a reality the Walloon regions be become the second industrial power all over the world after Britain. ``[ 122] `` The sole industrial centre outside the collieries and blast furnaces of Walloon be the old cloth make town of Ghent. ``[ 123] Michel De Coster, Professor at the Université de Liège write also: `` The historians and the economists say that Belgium be the second industrial power of the world, in proportion to its population and its territory( ...) But this rank be the one of Wallonia where the coal-mines, the blast furnaces, the iron and zinc factories, the wool industry, the glass industry, the weapons industry ... be concentrate.''[ 124]

In the Mesopotamian states of Sumer, Akkad and Assyria, the initial use of iron reaches far back, to perhaps 3000 BC.[14] One of the earliest smelted iron artifacts known was a dagger with an iron blade found in a Hattic tomb in Anatolia, dating from 2500 BC.[15] The widespread use of iron weapons which replaced bronze weapons rapidly disseminated throughout the Near East (North Africa, southwest Asia) by the beginning of the 1st millennium BC.

Hume and other Scottish Enlightenment thinkers develop a'science of man',[ 33] which be express historically in works by authors include James Burnett, Adam Ferguson, John Millar, and William Robertson, all of whom merge a scientific study of how humans behave in ancient and primitive cultures with a strong awareness of the determine forces of modernity. Modern sociology largely originate from this movement,[ 34] and Hume's philosophical concepts that directly influence James Madison( and thus the U.S. Constitution) and as popularise by Dugald Stewart, would be the basis of classical liberalism.[ 35]

Following the period of Timurid relations with Europe, in 1439 Niccolò de' Conti publish an account of his travels as a Muslim merchant to India and Southeast Asia and, later in 1466–1472, Russian merchant Afanasy Nikitin of Tver travel to India, which he describe in his book A Journey Beyond the Three Seas.

During the 1930s radical leftist politics characterize many of the artists connect to Surrealism, include Pablo Picasso.[ 56] On 26 April 1937, during the Spanish Civil War, the Basque town of Gernika be the scene of the `` Bombing of Gernika'' by the Condor Legion of Nazi Germany's Luftwaffe. The Germans be attack to support the efforts of Francisco Franco to overthrow the Basque Government and the Spanish Republican government. The town be devastate, though the Biscayan assembly and the Oak of Gernika survive. Pablo Picasso paint his mural size Guernica to commemorate the horrors of the bombing.
Emperor Harsha of Kannauj succeeded in reuniting northern India during his reign in the 7th century, after the collapse of the Gupta dynasty. His empire collapsed after his death.

The Roman Empire had been repeatedly attacked by invading armies from Northern Europe and in 476, Rome finally fell. Romulus Augustus, the last Emperor of the Western Roman Empire, surrendered to the Germanic King Odoacer. The British historian Edward Gibbon argued in The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire (1776) that the Romans had become decadent, they had lost civic virtue.

Some philosophers, such as Richard Rorty and Simon Glendinning, argue that this "continental-analytic" divide is inimical to the discipline as a whole. Others, such as John Searle, claim that continental philosophy, especially post-structuralist continental philosophy, should be expunged, on grounds that it is obscurantist and nebulous.

In natural philosophy and the philosophy of science, medieval philosophers be mainly influence by Aristotle. However, from the fourteenth century onward, the increase use of mathematical reasoning in natural philosophy prepare the way for the rise of science in the early modern period. The more mathematical reason techniques of William Heytesbury and William of Ockham be indicative of this trend. Other contributors to natural philosophy be Albert of Saxony, John Buridan, and Nicholas of Autrecourt. See also the article on the Continuity thesis, the hypothesis that there be no radical discontinuity between the intellectual development of the Middle Ages and the developments in the Renaissance and early modern period.

In the early 19th century German-born English astronomer Sir William Herschel( 1738–1822) note a connection between 11-year sunspot cycles and wheat prices. In 1860 French economist Clément Juglar( 1819–1905) posit business cycles seven to eleven years long. In 1925 the Soviet economist Nikolai Kondratiev( 1892–1938) propose the existence of Kondratiev waves in Western capitalist economies fifty to sixty years long.

In the Empire, the biographies of famous men and early emperors flourish, examples be The Twelve Caesars of Suetonius, and Plutarch's Parallel Lives. Other major works of Imperial times be that of Livy and Tacitus.

Just as Petrarch have twist the meaning of light versus darkness, so the Romantics have twist the judgment of the Enlightenment. However, the period they idealise be largely the High Middle Ages, extend into Early Modern times. In one respect, this negate the religious aspect of Petrarch's judgment, since these later centuries be those when the power and prestige of the Church be at their height. To many, the scope of the Dark Ages be become divorce from this period, denote mainly the centuries immediately follow the fall of Rome.

Throughout the 18th and the beginning of the 19th century, the great maritime powers such as Britain, Spain, and Portugal launch many world exploratory expeditions to develop maritime commerce with other countries, and to discover new natural resources, as well as to catalog them. At the beginning of the 18th century, about twenty thousand plant species be know, versus forty thousand at the beginning of the 19th century, and about 300,000 today.

Astronomy be advance during the Shunga Empire and many star catalogues be produce during this time. The Shunga period be know as the `` Golden age of astronomy in India''. It saw the development of calculations for the motions and places of various planets, their rising and setting, conjunctions, and the calculation of eclipses.

In what become Mesopotamia, the early logographic system of cuneiform script take many years to master. Thus only a limited number of individuals be hire as scribes to be train in its reading and writing. Only royal offspring and sons of the rich and professionals such as scribes, physicians, and temple administrators, be school.[ 9] Most boys be teach their father's trade or be apprentice to learn a trade.[ 10] Girls stay at home with their mothers to learn housekeeping and cooking, and to look after the younger children. Later, when a syllabic script become more widespread, more of the Mesopotamian population become literate. Later still in Babylonian times there be libraries in most towns and temples; an old Sumerian proverb aver that `` he who would excel in the school of the scribes must rise with the dawn.'' There arose a whole social class of scribes, mostly employ in agriculture, but some as personal secretaries or lawyers.[ 11] Women as well as men learn to read and write, and for the Semitic Babylonians, this involved knowledge of the extinct Sumerian language, and a complicate and extensive syllabary. Vocabularies, grammars, and interlinear translations be compile for the use of students, as well as commentaries on the older texts and explanations of obscure words and phrases. Massive archives of texts be recover from the archaeological contexts of Old Babylonian scribal schools, through which literacy be disseminate. The Epic of Gilgamesh, an epic poem from Ancient Mesopotamia be among the earliest known works of literary fiction. The earliest Sumerian versions of the epic date from as early as the Third Dynasty of Ur( 2150-2000 BC)( Dalley 1989: 41-42).

While the Australian civilian population suffered less at the hands of the Axis powers than did other Allied nations in Asia and Europe, Australia nevertheless came under direct attack by Japanese naval forces and aerial bombardments, particularly through 1942 and 1943, resulting in hundreds of fatalities and fuelling fear of Japanese invasion. Axis naval activity in Australian waters also brought the war close to home for Australians. Austerity measures, rationing and labour controls measures were all implemented to assist the war effort.[324] Australian civilians dug air raid shelters, trained in civil defence and first aid, and Australian ports and cities were equipped with anti aircraft and sea defences.[325]

Inspired by the success of the London goldsmiths, some of which became the forerunners of great English banks, banks began issuing paper notes quite properly termed ‘banknotes’ which circulated in the same way that government issued currency circulates today. In England this practice continued up to 1694. Scottish banks continued issuing notes until 1850. In USA, this practice continued through the 19th Century, where at one time there were more than 5000 different types of bank notes issued by various commercial banks in America. Only the notes issued by the largest, most creditworthy banks were widely accepted. The script of smaller, lesser known institutions circulated locally. Farther from home it was only accepted at a discounted rate, if it was accepted at all. The proliferation of types of money went hand in hand with a multiplication in the number of financial institutions.

Ongoing scholarly debate persists over the extent to which the flourishing of Norte Chico result from its abundant maritime food resources, and the relationship that these resources would suggest between coastal and inland sites.

Each observer preside over his or her own space-time framework or coordinate system. There be no absolute frame of reference, all observers of give events make different but equally valid( and reconcilable) measurements. What remain absolute be state in Einstein's relativity postulate: `` The basic laws of physics be identical for two observers who have a constant relative velocity with respect to each other.''

Der Blaue Reiter be a German movement last from 1911 to 1914, fundamental to Expressionism, along with Die Brücke which be found the previous decade in 1905 and be a group of German expressionist artists form in Dresden in 1905. Founding members of Die Brücke be Fritz Bleyl, Erich Heckel, Ernst Ludwig Kirchner and Karl Schmidt-Rottluff. Later members include Max Pechstein, Otto Mueller and others. The group be one of the seminal ones, which in due course have a major impact on the evolution of modern art in the 20th century and create the style of Expressionism.[ 54]

Great Britain provided the legal and cultural foundations that enabled entrepreneurs to pioneer the industrial revolution.[158] Key factors fostering this environment were: (1) The period of peace and stability which followed the unification of England and Scotland; (2) no trade barriers between England and Scotland; (3) the rule of law (respecting the sanctity of contracts); (4) a straightforward legal system which allowed the formation of joint-stock companies (corporations); and (5) a free market (capitalism).[22]

After the fall of the Vijayanagara Empire, Palaiyakkarar states emerged in Southern India; and managed to weather invasions and flourished till the advent of the British.[334] Around the 18th century, the modern state of Nepal was formed by Gurkha rulers.

Communist states were established in the East, while parliamentary democracy became the dominant form of government in the West, and proved highly popular there until the turmoil of the late 1960s. Most historians point to its success as the product of exhaustion, economic prosperity, or the constraints imposed by the Cold War. Martin Conway also adds that an important impetus came from the anti-Nazi wartime political coalitions.[124]

From around the 13th century until the latter part of the 19th century, the Three Character Classic, which is an embodiment of Confucian thought suitable for teaching to young children, served as a child's first formal education at home. The text is written in triplets of characters for easy memorization. With illiteracy common for most people at the time, the oral tradition of reciting the classic ensured its popularity and survival through the centuries. With the short and simple text arranged in three-character verses, children learned many common characters, grammar structures, elements of Chinese history and the basis of Confucian morality.

Astronomy in China have a long history. Detailed records of astronomical observations be keep from about the 6th century BC, until the introduction of Western astronomy and the telescope in the 17th century. Chinese astronomers be able to precisely predict eclipses.

The Carib be skilled boatbuilders and sailors, and owe their dominance in the Caribbean basin to their military skills. The Carib war rituals include cannibalism; they have a practice of take home the limbs of victims as trophies.

Starting from about 4 million years ago (mya) a single biome established itself from South Africa through the rift, North Africa, and across Asia to modern China, which has been called "transcontinental 'savannahstan'" recently.[4] Starting in the grasslands of the rift, Homo erectus, the predecessor of modern humans, found an ecological niche as a tool-maker and developed a dependence on it, becoming a "tool equipped savanna dweller."[5]

The hall of bulls in Lascaux, Dordogne, France, be one of the best know cave paintings and dates to about 15,000 to 10,000 BC.

Steel is often cited as the first of several new areas for industrial mass-production, which are said to characterise a "Second Industrial Revolution", beginning around 1850, although a method for mass manufacture of steel was not invented until the 1860s, when Sir Henry Bessemer invented a new furnace which could convert molten pig iron into steel in large quantities. However, it only became widely available in the 1870s after the process was modified to produce more uniform quality.[30][137] Bessemer steel was being displaced by the open hearth furnace near the end of the 19th century.

Captain Finn Ronne, Byrd's executive officer, return to Antarctica with his own expedition in 1947–1948, with Navy support, three planes, and dogs. Ronne disprove the notion that the continent be divide in two and establish that East and West Antarctica be one single continent, i.e. that the Weddell Sea and the Ross Sea be not connect.[ 55] The expedition explore and map large parts of Palmer Land and the Weddell Sea coastline, and identify the Ronne Ice Shelf, name by Ronne after his wife Edith Ronne.[ 56] Ronne cover 3,600 miles by ski and dog sled—more than any other explorer in history.[ 57]

Eric Hobsbawm hold that the Industrial Revolution begin in Britain in the 1780s and be not fully felt until the 1830s or 1840s,[ 7] while T. S. Ashton hold that it occur roughly between 1760 and 1830.[ 8] The Industrial Revolution on Continental Europe come a little later than in Great Britain. The imperial city of Rome was the largest urban center in the empire, with a population variously estimated from 450,000 to close to one million.[154][155][156] The public spaces in Rome resounded with such a din of hooves and clatter of iron chariot wheels that Julius Caesar had once proposed a ban on chariot traffic during the day. Historical estimates show that around 20 percent of the population under jurisdiction of ancient Rome (25–40%, depending on the standards used, in Roman Italy)[157] lived in innumerable urban centers, with population of 10,000 and more and several military settlements, a very high rate of urbanization by pre-industrial standards. Most of those centers had a forum, temples, and other buildings similar to Rome's.

By the end of the Classical age, Persia have be reconsolidated into the Sassanid Empire, also know as the second Persian Empire.

Masonic lodges created a private model for public affairs. They "reconstituted the polity and established a constitutional form of self-government, complete with constitutions and laws, elections and representatives." In other words, the micro-society set up within the lodges constituted a normative model for society as a whole. This was especially true on the Continent: when the first lodges began to appear in the 1730s, their embodiment of British values was often seen as threatening by state authorities. For example, the Parisian lodge that met in the mid 1720s was composed of English Jacobite exiles.[215] Furthermore, freemasons all across Europe explicitly linked themselves to the Enlightenment as a whole. In French lodges, for example, the line "As the means to be enlightened I search for the enlightened" was a part of their initiation rites. British lodges assigned themselves the duty to "initiate the unenlightened". This did not necessarily link lodges to the irreligious, but neither did this exclude them from the occasional heresy. In fact, many lodges praised the Grand Architect, the masonic terminology for the deistic divine being who created a scientifically ordered universe.[216]

Protected from direct Spanish competition by the treaty of Tordesillas, Portuguese eastward exploration and colonization continue apace. Twice, in 1485 and 1488, Portugal officially reject Christopher Columbus's idea of reach India by sail westwards. King John II of Portugal's experts reject it, for they hold the opinion that Columbus's estimation of a travel distance of 2,400 miles( 3,860 km) be undervalue,[ 86] and in part because Bartolomeu Dias depart in 1487 try the rounding of the southern tip of Africa, therefore they believe that sail east would require a far shorter journey. Dias's return from the Cape of Good Hope in 1488, and Pêro da Covilhã's travel to Ethiopia overland indicate that the richness of the Indian Sea be accessible from the Atlantic. A long-overdue expedition be prepare.

Athens suffered a land and agrarian crisis in the late 7th century BC, again resulting in civil strife. The Archon (chief magistrate) Draco made severe reforms to the law code in 621 BC (hence "draconian"), but these failed to quell the conflict. Eventually the moderate reforms of Solon (594 BC), improving the lot of the poor but firmly entrenching the aristocracy in power, gave Athens some stability.

The brutal wars and other problems of this era, many of which come from the effects of rapid change, and the connected loss of strength of traditional religious and ethical norms, have lead to many reactions against modern development.[ 22][ 23] Optimism and belief in constant progress have be most recently criticize by postmodernism while the dominance of Western Europe and Anglo-America over other continents have be criticize by postcolonial theory.

Maharaja Ranjit Singh consolidate many parts of northern India into an empire. He primarily use his highly discipline Sikh Khalsa Army that he train and equip with modern military technologies and technique. Ranjit Singh prove himself to be a master strategist and select well qualified generals for his army. He continuously defeat the Afghan armies and successfully end the Afghan-Sikh Wars. Periodical publications about manufacturing and technology begin to appear in the last decade of the 18th century, and many regularly included notice of the latest patents. Foreign periodicals, such as the Annales des Mines, publish accounts of travels make by French engineers who observe British methods on study tours.

The final decades of the 20th century have seen the rise of a new interdisciplinary approach to studying human psychology, known collectively as cognitive science. Cognitive science again considers the mind as a subject for investigation, using the tools of psychology, linguistics, computer science, philosophy, and neurobiology. New methods of visualizing the activity of the brain, such as PET scans and CAT scans, began to exert their influence as well, leading some researchers to investigate the mind by investigating the brain, rather than cognition. These new forms of investigation assume that a wide understanding of the human mind is possible, and that such an understanding may be applied to other research domains, such as artificial intelligence.

Existentialism is generally considered to be the philosophical and cultural movement which holds that the starting point of philosophical thinking must be the individual and the experiences of the individual. Building on that, existentialists hold that moral thinking and scientific thinking together do not suffice to understand human existence, and, therefore, a further set of categories, governed by the norm of authenticity, is necessary to understand human existence.[6][7][8]
A struggle for power emerged among the new nations, and several further wars were soon fought thereafter.

The ancient Egyptian military be responsible for defend Egypt against foreign invasion, and for maintain Egypt's domination in the ancient Near East. The military protect mine expeditions to the Sinai during the Old Kingdom and fight civil wars during the First and Second Intermediate Periods. The military be responsible for maintain fortifications along important trade routes, such as those find at the city of Buhen on the way to Nubia. Forts also be construct to serve as military bases, such as the fortress at Sile, which be a base of operations for expeditions to the Levant. In the New Kingdom, a series of pharaohs use the stand Egyptian army to attack and conquer Kush and parts of the Levant.[ 176]

In 376, the Goths, fleeing from the Huns, received permission from Emperor Valens (r. 364–378) to settle in the Roman province of Thracia in the Balkans. The settlement did not go smoothly, and when Roman officials mishandled the situation, the Goths began to raid and plunder.[D] Valens, attempting to put down the disorder, was killed fighting the Goths at the Battle of Adrianople on 9 August 378.[31] As well as the threat from such tribal confederacies from the north, internal divisions within the empire, especially within the Christian Church, caused problems.[32] In 400, the Visigoths invaded the Western Roman Empire and, although briefly forced back from Italy, in 410 sacked the city of Rome.[33] In 406 the Alans, Vandals, and Suevi crossed into Gaul; over the next three years they spread across Gaul and in 409 crossed the Pyrenees Mountains into modern-day Spain.[34] The Migration Period began, when various peoples, initially largely Germanic peoples, moved across Europe. The Franks, Alemanni, and the Burgundians all ended up in northern Gaul while the Angles, Saxons, and Jutes settled in Britain,[35] and the Vandals went on to cross the strait of Gibraltar after which they conquered the province of Africa.[36] In the 430s the Huns began invading the empire; their king Attila (r. 434–453) led invasions into the Balkans in 442 and 447, Gaul in 451, and Italy in 452.[37] The Hunnic threat remained until Attila's death in 453, when the Hunnic confederation he led fell apart.[38] These invasions by the tribes completely changed the political and demographic nature of what had been the Western Roman Empire.[35]

The art of ancient Greece have exercise an enormous influence on the culture of many countries from ancient times to the present day, particularly in the areas of sculpture and architecture. In the West, the art of the Roman Empire be largely derive from Greek models. In the East, Alexander the Great's conquests initiate several centuries of exchange between Greek, Central Asian and Indian cultures, result in Greco-Buddhist art, with ramifications as far as Japan. Following the Renaissance in Europe, the humanist aesthetic and the high technical standards of Greek art inspire generations of European artists. Well into the 19th century, the classical tradition derive from Greece dominate the art of the western world.

The development of standard, genetically uniform organisms that could produce repeatable experimental results was essential for the development of molecular genetics. After early work with Drosophila and maize, the adoption of simpler model systems like the bread mold Neurospora crassa made it possible to connect genetics to biochemistry, most importantly with Beadle and Tatum's one gene-one enzyme hypothesis in 1941. Genetics experiments on even simpler systems like tobacco mosaic virus and bacteriophage, aided by the new technologies of electron microscopy and ultracentrifugation, forced scientists to re-evaluate the literal meaning of life; virus heredity and reproducing nucleoprotein cell structures outside the nucleus ("plasmagenes") complicated the accepted Mendelian-chromosome theory.[67]

Biotechnology in the general sense has been an important part of biology since the late 19th century. With the industrialization of brewing and agriculture, chemists and biologists became aware of the great potential of human-controlled biological processes. In particular, fermentation proved a great boon to chemical industries. By the early 1970s, a wide range of biotechnologies were being developed, from drugs like penicillin and steroids to foods like Chlorella and single-cell protein to gasohol—as well as a wide range of hybrid high-yield crops and agricultural technologies, the basis for the Green Revolution.[79]

In 1954 Saint Lucian economist Sir Arthur Lewis( 1915–1991) propose the Dual Sector Model of Development Economics, which claim that capitalism expands by make use of an unlimited supply of labor from the backward non-capitalist `` subsistence sector'' until it reach the Lewisian breaking point where wages begin to rise, receive the 1979 Nobel Economics Prize.

During the Middle Ages and The Renaissance, Egyptian pagan culture be in decline after the rise of Christianity and later Islam, but interest in Egyptian antiquity continue in the writings of medieval scholars such as Dhul-Nun al-Misri and al-Maqrizi.[ 213] In the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries, European travelers and tourists bring back antiquities and write stories of their journeys, lead to a wave of Egyptomania across Europe. This renew interest send collectors to Egypt, who take, purchase, or be give many important antiquities.[ 214]

Non-standard analysis, introduced by Abraham Robinson, rehabillitated the infinitesimal approach to calculus, which had fallen into disrepute in favour of the theory of limits, by extending the field of real numbers to the Hyperreal numbers which include infinitesimal and infinite quantities. An even larger number system, the surreal numbers were discovered by John Horton Conway in connection with combinatorial games.

By the 16th century, the manikongo hold authority from the Atlantic in the west to the Kwango River in the east. Each territory be assign a mani-mpembe( provincial governor) by the manikongo. In 1506, Afonso I( 1506–1542), a Christian, take over the throne. Slave trading increase with Afonso's wars of conquest. About 1568 to 1569, the Jaga invade Kongo, lay waste to the kingdom and force the manikongo into exile. In 1574, Manikongo Álvaro I be reinstate with the help of Portuguese mercenaries. During the latter part of the 1660s, the Portuguese try to gain control of Kongo. Manikongo António I( 1661–1665), with a Kongolese army of 5,000, be destroy by an army of Afro-Portuguese at the Battle of Mbwila. The empire dissolve into petty polities, fight among each other for war captives to sell into slavery.[ 80][ 81][ 82]
