After a century of hiatus, the idea of the Persian Empire be revive by the Parthians in the 3rd century BC—and continue by their successors, the Sassanids from the 3rd century AD. This empire dominate sizable parts of what be now the Asian part of the Middle East and continue to influence the rest of the Asiatic and African Middle East region, until the Arab Muslim conquest of Persia in the mid-7th century CE. Between the 1st century BC and the early 7th century AD, the region be completely dominate by the Romans and the Parthians and Sassanids on the other hand, which often culminate in various Roman-Persian Wars over the seven centuries. Eastern Rite, Church of the East Christianity take hold in Persian-ruled Mesopotamia, particularly in Assyria from the 1st century AD onwards, and the region become a center of a flourishing Syriac–Assyrian literary tradition.

The Greeks develop an alphabet base on a system previously use by the Phoenicians, add signs for vowels and for extra consonants appropriate to their idiom( see Robins, 1997). As a result of the introduction of writing, poetry such as the Homeric poems become write and several editions be create and comment on, form the basis of philology and criticism.

In Palestine, conflicting forces of Arab nationalism and Zionism created a situation the British could neither resolve nor extricate themselves from. The rise to power of German dictator Adolf Hitler had created a new urgency in the Zionist quest to immigrate to Palestine and create a Jewish state. A Palestinian state was also an attractive alternative to the Arab and Persian leaders, instead of the de facto British, French, and perceived Jewish colonialism or imperialism, under the logic of "the enemy of my enemy is my friend".[23]

The Great War spur the usage of Roentgen's X-ray, and the electrocardiograph, for the monitoring of internal bodily functions. This be follow in the inter-war period by the development of the first anti-bacterial agents such as the sulpha antibiotics.

In the 15th and 16th centuries, panel paintings which could be hung on walls and moved around at will, became increasingly popular for both churches and private houses, rather than fresco wall-paintings or paintings incorporated into on permanent structures, such as altarpieces. The High Renaissance gave rise to a stylized art known as Mannerism. In place of the balanced compositions and rational approach to perspective that characterized art at the dawn of the 16th century, the Mannerists sought instability, artifice, and doubt. The unperturbed faces and gestures of Piero della Francesca and the calm Virgins of Raphael are replaced by the troubled expressions of Pontormo and the emotional intensity of El Greco. Some decades later Northern Mannerism dominated Netherlandish and German art until the arrival of the Baroque.

Babylonian astronomy was the basis for much of what was done in Greek and Hellenistic astronomy, in classical Indian astronomy, in Sassanian Iran, in Byzantium, in Syria, in Islamic astronomy, in Central Asia, and in Western Europe.[17]

Much of Greek learning be assimilate by the nascent Roman state as it expand outward from Italy, take advantage of its enemies' inability to unite: the only challenge to Roman ascent come from the Phoenician colony of Carthage, and its defeats in the three Punic Wars mark the start of Roman hegemony. First govern by kings, then as a senatorial republic( the Roman Republic), Rome finally become an empire at the end of the 1st century BC, under Augustus and his authoritarian successors.

The extraction of iron from its ore into a workable metal be much more difficult than copper or tin. It appear to have be invent by the Hittites in about 1200 BC, begin the Iron Age. The secret of extract and work iron be a key factor in the success of the Philistines.[ 4][ 8]

With the division of the Roman Empire, the Western Roman Empire lose contact with much of its past. In the Middle East, Greek philosophy be able to find some support under the newly create Arab Empire. With the spread of Islam in the 7th and 8th centuries, a period of Muslim scholarship, know as the Islamic Golden Age, last until the 13th century. This scholarship be aid by several factors. The use of a single language, Arabic, allow communication without need of a translator. Access to Greek texts from the Byzantine Empire, along with Indian sources of learning, provide Muslim scholars a knowledge base to build upon.

Although the destructive effects of gunpowder be describe in the earlier Tang dynasty by a Daoist alchemist, The earliest developments of the gun barrel and the projectile-fire cannon be find in late Song China. The first art depiction of the Chinese'fire lance'( a combination of a temporary-fire flamethrower and gun) be from a Buddhist mural painting of Dunhuang, date circa 950.[ 7] These'fire-lances' be widespread in use by the early 12th century, feature hollow bamboo poles as tubes to fire sand particles( to blind and choke), lead pellets, bits of sharp metal and pottery shards, and finally large gunpowder-propelled arrows and rocket weaponry.[ 6] :220–221 Eventually, perishable bamboo be replace with hollow tubes of cast iron, and so too do the terminology of this new weapon change, from'fire-spear' `` huo qiang'' to'fire-tube' `` huo tong''.[ 6] :221 This ancestor to the gun be complement by the ancestor to the cannon, what the Chinese refer to since the 13th century as the'multiple bullets magazine erupter' `` bai zu lian zhu pao'', a tube of bronze or cast iron that be fill with about 100 lead balls.[ 6] :263–264

He reasoned that the trade winds of the Pacific might move in a gyre as the Atlantic winds did. If in the Atlantic, ships made the Volta do mar to pick up winds that would bring them back from Madeira, then, he reasoned, by sailing far to the north before heading east, he would pick up trade winds to bring him back to North America. His hunch paid off, and he hit the coast near Cape Mendocino, California, then followed the coast south. The ship reached the port of Acapulco, on October 8, 1565, having traveled 12,000 miles (19,312 kilometres) in 130 days. Fourteen of his crew died; only Urdaneta and Felipe de Salcedo, nephew of López de Legazpi, had strength enough to cast the anchors.

To avoid this fate, Caesar cross the Rubicon River and invade Rome in 49 BC. Pompey and his party flee from Italy, pursue by Caesar. The Battle of Pharsalus be a brilliant victory for Caesar and in this and other campaigns he destroy all of the optimates' leaders: Metellus Scipio, Cato the Younger, and Pompey's son, Gnaeus Pompeius. Pompey be murder in Egypt in 48 BC. Caesar be now pre-eminent over Rome, attract the bitter enmity of many aristocrats. He be grant many offices and honours. In just five years, he hold four consulships, two ordinary dictatorships, and two special dictatorships: one for ten years and another for perpetuity. He be murder in 44 BC, on the Ides of March by the Liberatores.[ 52]

During the Age of Enlightenment, the 18th-century, science be hold in high esteem and physicians upgrade their social status by become more scientific. The health field be crowd with self-trained barber-surgeons, apothecaries, midwives, drug peddlers, and charlatans.

In 712, Arab Muslim general Muhammad bin Qasim conquered most of the Indus region in modern-day Pakistan for the Umayyad Empire, incorporating it as the "As-Sindh" province with its capital at Al-Mansurah, 72 km (45 mi) north of modern Hyderabad in Sindh, Pakistan. After several incursions, the Hindu kings east of Indus defeated the Arabs during the Caliphate campaigns in India, halting their expansion and containing them at Sindh in Pakistan. The south Indian Chalukya empire under Vikramaditya II, Nagabhata I of the Pratihara dynasty and Bappa Rawal of the Guhilot dynasty repulsed the Arab invaders in the early 8th century.[249]

John Monash was appointed corps commander of the Australian forces in May 1918 and led some significant attacks in the final stages of the war. British Field Marshal Montgomery later called him "the best general on the western front in Europe". Monash made the protection of infantry a priority and sought to fully integrate all the new technologies of warfare in both the planning and execution of battles, thus he wrote that infantry should not be sacrificed needlessly to enemy bayonets and machine guns—but rather should "advance under the maximum possible protection of the maximum possible array of mechanical resources, in the form of guns, machine-guns, tanks, mortars and aeroplanes". His first operation at the relatively small Battle of Hamel demonstrated the validity of his approach and later actions before the Hindenburg Line in 1918 confirmed it. Monash was knighted in the field of battle by King George V following the 8 August advance during the Battle of Amiens.[252] General Erich Ludendorff, the German commander, later wrote of 8 August 1918 as "the black day of the German Army... The 8th of August put the decline of [German] fighting power beyond all doubt".[253] Amiens, fought between 8 and 11 August 1918, marked the beginning of the allied advance that culminated in the 11 November Armistice ended the war.[253]

In the 8th century BC, power became decentralized during the Spring and Autumn period (春秋時代), named after the influential Spring and Autumn Annals. In this period, local military leaders used by the Zhou began to assert their power and vie for hegemony. The situation was aggravated by the invasion of other peoples from the northwest, such as the Quanrong, forcing the Zhou to move their capital east to Luoyang. This marks the second large phase of the Zhou dynasty: the Eastern Zhou. In each of the hundreds of states that eventually arose, local strongmen held most of the political power and continued their subservience to the Zhou kings in name only. Local leaders for instance started using royal titles for themselves. The Hundred Schools of Thought (諸子百家) of Chinese philosophy blossomed during this period, and such influential intellectual movements as Confucianism (儒家), Taoism (道家), Legalism (法家) and Mohism (墨家) were founded, partly in response to the changing political world. The Spring and Autumn period is marked by a falling apart of the central Zhou power. China now consists of hundreds of states, some only as large as a village with a fort.

1931 marked a year when several Surrealist painters produced works which marked turning points in their stylistic evolution: in one example (see gallery above) liquid shapes become the trademark of Dalí, particularly in his The Persistence of Memory, which features the image of watches that sag as if they are melting. Evocations of time and its compelling mystery and absurdity.[52]

The oldest known world maps date back to ancient Babylon from the 9th century BC.[3] The best known Babylonian world map, however, is the Imago Mundi of 600 BC.[4] The map as reconstructed by Eckhard Unger shows Babylon on the Euphrates, surrounded by a circular landmass showing Assyria, Urartu[5] and several cities, in turn surrounded by a "bitter river" (Oceanus), with seven islands arranged around it so as to form a seven-pointed star. The accompanying text mentions seven outer regions beyond the encircling ocean. The descriptions of five of them have survived.[6]

In 1498, during his third voyage to the Americas, Christopher Columbus sail near the Orinoco Delta and then land in the Gulf of Paria( Actual Venezuela). Amazed by the great offshore current of freshwater which deflect his course eastward, Columbus express in his move letter to Isabella I and Ferdinand II that he must have reach heaven on Earth( terrestrial paradise):

In Australia, the costs of major investment have traditionally be meet by state and Federal governments and heavy borrowing from overseas be make by the governments in the 1920s. A Loan Council be set up in 1928 to co-ordinate loans, three-quarters of which come from overseas.[ 272] Despite Imperial Preference, a balance of trade be not successfully achieve with Britain. `` In the five years from 1924..to..1928, Australia buy 43.4% of its imports from Britain and sell 38.7% of its exports. Wheat and wool make up more than two-thirds of all Australian exports'', a dangerous reliance on just two export commodities.[ 273]

During the Middle Ages issues of what is now termed science began to be addressed. There was greater emphasis on combining theory with practice in the Islamic world than there had been in Classical times, and it was common for those studying the sciences to be artisans as well, something that had been "considered an aberration in the ancient world." Islamic experts in the sciences were often expert instrument makers who enhanced their powers of observation and calculation with them.[24] Muslim scientists used experiment and quantification to distinguish between competing scientific theories, set within a generically empirical orientation, as can be seen in the works of Jābir ibn Hayyān (721–815)[25] and Alkindus (801–873)[26] as early examples. Several scientific methods thus emerged from the medieval Muslim world by the early 11th century, all of which emphasized experimentation as well as quantification to varying degrees.

In terms of social structure, the Industrial Revolution witnessed the triumph of a middle class of industrialists and businessmen over a landed class of nobility and gentry. Ordinary working people found increased opportunities for employment in the new mills and factories, but these were often under strict working conditions with long hours of labour dominated by a pace set by machines. As late as the year 1900, most industrial workers in the United States still worked a 10-hour day (12 hours in the steel industry), yet earned from 20% to 40% less than the minimum deemed necessary for a decent life.[97] However, harsh working conditions were prevalent long before the Industrial Revolution took place. Pre-industrial society was very static and often cruel—child labour, dirty living conditions, and long working hours were just as prevalent before the Industrial Revolution.[98]

In Italy, parts of society also dramatically change during the Enlightenment, with rulers such as Leopold II of Tuscany abolish the death penalty in Tuscany. The significant reduction in the Church's power lead to a period of great thought and invention, with scientists such as Alessandro Volta and Luigi Galvani make new discoveries and greatly contribute to science.[ 38]

The use in typography of the point, which be one twelfth of a ligne in the customary French measures of the Ancien Régime, as a unit for measure print type predate the metric system. Various typographic points be define, include the Truchet point by Sébastien Truchet( 1657–1729),[ 4] the Fournier point by Pierre Simon Fournier in 1737[ 5] and the Didot point by the Didot brothers, Francois Ambroise and Pierre Francois, in 1755[ citation need] or 1767[ citation need] or 1783,[ 6] which be exactly two Truchet points. The point be first use in the United States in 1878[ citation need] or 1872[ 6] by a Chicago type foundry( Marder, Luse,& Co.).

The English word scientist is relatively recent—first coined by William Whewell in the 19th century.[1] Previously, people investigating nature called themselves "natural philosophers". While empirical investigations of the natural world have been described since classical antiquity (for example, by Thales and Aristotle), and scientific method has been employed since the Middle Ages (for example, by Ibn al-Haytham and Roger Bacon), modern science began to develop in the early modern period, and in particular in the scientific revolution of 16th- and 17th-century Europe.[2] Traditionally, historians of science have defined science sufficiently broadly to include those earlier inquiries.[3]
For most of the 19th century, the Ashante Empire remained powerful. It was later destroyed in 1900 by British superior weaponry and organization following the four Anglo-Ashanti wars.[185]

The youth of Rome had several forms of athletic play and exercise, such as jumping, wrestling, boxing, and racing.[220] In the countryside, pastimes for the wealthy also included fishing and hunting.[221] The Romans also had several forms of ball playing, including one resembling handball.[220] Dice games, board games, and gamble games were popular pastimes.[220] Women did not take part in these activities. For the wealthy, dinner parties presented an opportunity for entertainment, sometimes featuring music, dancing, and poetry readings.[222] Plebeians sometimes enjoyed similar parties through clubs or associations, but for most Romans, recreational dining usually meant patronizing taverns.[222] Children entertained themselves with toys and such games as leapfrog.[221][222]

English chemist Robert Boyle (1627–1691) is considered to have refined the modern scientific method for alchemy and to have separated chemistry further from alchemy.[84] Although his research clearly has its roots in the alchemical tradition, Boyle is largely regarded today as the first modern chemist, and therefore one of the founders of modern chemistry, and one of the pioneers of modern experimental scientific method. Although Boyle was not the original discover, he is best known for Boyle's law, which he presented in 1662:[85] the law describes the inversely proportional relationship between the absolute pressure and volume of a gas, if the temperature is kept constant within a closed system.[86]

New film techniques were introduced in this period including the use of artificial lighting, fire effects and low-key lighting (i.e. lighting in which most of the frame is dark) for enhanced atmosphere during sinister scenes. As films grew longer, specialist writers were employed to simplify more complex stories derived from novels or plays into a form that could be contained on one reel and be easier to be understood by the audience –  an audience that was new to this form of storytelling. Genres began to be used as categories; the main division was into comedy and drama, but these categories were further subdivided. During the First World War there was a complex transition for the film industry. The exhibition of films changed from short one-reel programs to feature films. Exhibition venues became larger and began charging higher prices. By 1914, continuity cinema was the established mode of commercial cinema. One of the advanced continuity techniques involved an accurate and smooth transition from one shot to another.

Even greater expectations of biotechnology were raised during the 1960s by a process that grew single-cell protein. When the so-called protein gap threatened world hunger, producing food locally by growing it from waste seemed to offer a solution. It was the possibilities of growing microorganisms on oil that captured the imagination of scientists, policy makers, and commerce.[1] Major companies such as British Petroleum (BP) staked their futures on it. In 1962, BP built a pilot plant at Cap de Lavera in Southern France to publicize its product, Toprina.[1] Initial research work at Lavera was done by Alfred Champagnat,[11] In 1963, construction started on BP's second pilot plant at Grangemouth Oil Refinery in Britain.[11]

These views on religious tolerance and the importance of individual conscience, along with the social contract, became particularly influential in the American colonies and the drafting of the United States Constitution.[76] Thomas Jefferson called for a "wall of separation between church and state" at the federal level. He previously had supported successful efforts to disestablish the Church of England in Virginia,[77] and authored the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom.[78] Jefferson's political ideals were greatly influenced by the writings of John Locke, Francis Bacon, and Isaac Newton[79] whom he considered the three greatest men that ever lived.[80]

The Venetian playwright Carlo Goldoni write a few scenarios start in 1734, but since he consider the genre too vulgar, he refine the topics of his own to be more sophisticated. Mode 2 is first known out of Africa at 'Ubeidiya, Israel, a site now on the Jordan River, then frequented over the long term (hundreds of thousands of years) by Homo on the shore of a variable-level palaeo-lake, long since vanished. The geology was created by successive "transgression and regression" of the lake[44] resulting in four cycles of layers. The tools are located in the first two, Cycles Li (Limnic Inferior) and Fi (Fluviatile Inferior), but mostly in Fi. The cycles represent different ecologies and therefore different cross-sections of fauna, which makes it possible to date them. They appear to be the same faunal assemblages as the Ferenta Faunal Unit in Italy, known from excavations at Selvella and Pieterfitta, dated to 1.6–1.2 mya.[45]

Alexandrian grammarians also study speech sounds and prosody; they define parts of speech with notions such as `` noun'', `` verb'', etc. There be also a discussion about the role of analogy in language, in this discussion the grammatici in Alexandria support the view that language and especially morphology be base on analogy or paradigm, whereas the grammatic in schools in Asia Minor consider that language be not base on analogical bases but rather on exceptions.

On 14 January 1939, five days prior to the German arrival, Queen Maud Land was annexed by Norway,[67] after a royal decree announced that the land bordering the Falkland Islands Dependencies in the west and the Australian Antarctic Dependency in the east was to be brought under Norwegian sovereignty.[68] The primary basis for the annexation was to secure the Norwegian whaling industry's access to the region.[67][72] In 1948, Norway and the United Kingdom agreed to limit Queen Maud Land to from 20°W to 45°E, and that the Bruce Coast and Coats Land were to be incorporated into Norwegian territory.[68]

Most scholars date the arrival of humans in Australia at 40,000 to 50,000 years ago, with a possible range of up to 125,000 years ago. The earliest anatomically modern human remain find in Australia( and outside of Africa) be those of Mungo Man; they have be date at 42,000 years old.[ 55][ 56]

In 1954, fallout from the American Castle Bravo hydrogen bomb test in the Marshall Islands be such that the inhabitants of the Rongelap Atoll be force to abandon their island. Three years later the islanders be allow to return, but suffer abnormally high levels of cancer. They be evacuate again in 1985 and in 1996 give$ 45 million in compensation.

In Ancient Egypt the Bronze Age begin in the Protodynastic period, c. 3150 BC. The archaic early Bronze Age of Egypt, know as the Early Dynastic Period of Egypt,[ 23][ 24] immediately follow the unification of Lower and Upper Egypt, c. 3100 BC. It be generally take to include the First and Second Dynasties, last from the Protodynastic Period of Egypt until about 2686 BC, or the beginning of the Old Kingdom. With the First Dynasty, the capital move from Abydos to Memphis with a unified Egypt rule by an Egyptian god-king. Abydos remain the major holy land in the south. The hallmarks of ancient Egyptian civilization, such as art, architecture and many aspects of religion, take shape during the Early Dynastic period. Memphis in the Early Bronze Age be the largest city of the time. The Old Kingdom of the regional Bronze Age[ 23] be the name give to the period in the 3rd millennium BC when Egypt attain its first continuous peak of civilization in complexity and achievement – the first of three `` Kingdom'' periods, which mark the high points of civilization in the lower Nile Valley( the others be Middle Kingdom and the New Kingdom).

In Britain, melodramas, light comedies, operas, Shakespeare and classic English drama, Victorian burlesque, pantomimes, translations of French farces and, from the 1860s, French operettas, continue to be popular. So successful be the comic operas of Gilbert and Sullivan, such as H.M.S. Pinafore( 1878) and The Mikado( 1885), that they greatly expand the audience for musical theatre.[ 78] This, together with much improve street lighting and transportation in London and New York lead to a late Victorian and Edwardian theatre building boom in the West End and on Broadway. Later, the work of Henry Arthur Jones and Arthur Wing Pinero initiate a new direction on the English stage. While their work pave the way, the development of more significant drama owe itself most to the playwright Henrik Ibsen.

In 2005, following the September 11 attacks, the 2002 Bali Bombings and the Benbrika Plot, the Government introduced new counter-terrorism laws which, among other things, allowed for preventative detention and control orders, prohibited incitement of terrorist acts, and prohibited reckless provision of funding to terrorists. Egyptian hieroglyphs, a phonetic writing system, have serve as the basis for the Egyptian Phoenician alphabet from which the later Hebrew, Greek, Latin, Arabic, and Cyrillic alphabets be derive. The city of Alexandria retain preeminence with its library, which be damage by fire when it fell under Roman rule,[ 4] be completely destroy before 642.[ 5][ 6] With it a huge amount of antique literature and knowledge be lose.

Plato's dialogue The Republic( c. 380–360 BC) describe an ideal city-state run by philosopher-kings contain references to specialization of labor and to production. Plato be the first to advocate the credit theory of money, that be, money as a unit of account for debt.[ citation need]

After its introduction from South America to Spain in the late 1500s, the potato become a staple crop throughout Europe by the late 1700s. The potato allow farmers to produce more food, and initially add variety to the European diet. The increased supply of food reduce disease, increase births and reduced mortality, cause a population boom throughout the British Empire, the US and Europe.[ 101] The introduction of the potato also bring about the first intensive use of fertilizer, in the form of guano import to Europe from Peru, and the first artificial pesticide, in the form of an arsenic compound use to fight Colorado potato beetles. Before the adoption of the potato as a major crop, the dependence on grain have cause repetitive regional and national famines when the crops fail, include 17 major famines in England between 1523 and 1623. The result dependence on the potato however cause the European Potato Failure, a disastrous crop failure from disease that result in widespread famine and the death of over one million people in Ireland alone.[ 102]

Legally, indigenous Australian males generally gained the right to vote during this period when Victoria, New South Wales, Tasmania and South Australia gave voting rights to all male British subjects over 21. Only Queensland and Western Australia barred Aboriginal people from voting. Thus, Aboriginal men and women voted in some jurisdictions for the first Commonwealth Parliament in 1901. Early federal parliamentary reform and judicial interpretation however sought to limit Aboriginal voting in practice—a situation which endured until rights activists began campaigning in the 1940s.[207]

Scientific academies and societies grow out of the Scientific Revolution as the creators of scientific knowledge in contrast to the scholasticism of the university.[ 26] During the Enlightenment, some societies create or retain links to universities. However, contemporary sources distinguish universities from scientific societies by claim that the university's utility be in the transmission of knowledge, while societies function to create knowledge.[ 27] As the role of universities in institutionalized science begin to diminish, learned societies become the cornerstone of organize science. Official scientific societies be charter by the state in order to provide technical expertise.[ 28] Most societies be grant permission to oversee their own publications, control the election of new members, and the administration of the society.[ 29] After 1700, a tremendous number of official academies and societies be found in Europe, and by 1789 there be over seventy official scientific societies. In reference to this growth, Bernard de Fontenelle coin the term `` the Age of Academies'' to describe the 18th century.[ 30]

The High Middle Ages was the formative period in the history of the modern Western state. Kings in France, England, and Spain consolidated their power, and set up lasting governing institutions.[180] New kingdoms such as Hungary and Poland, after their conversion to Christianity, became Central European powers.[181] The Magyars settled Hungary around 900 under King Árpád (d. c. 907) after a series of invasions in the 9th century.[182] The papacy, long attached to an ideology of independence from secular kings, first asserted its claim to temporal authority over the entire Christian world; the Papal Monarchy reached its apogee in the early 13th century under the pontificate of Innocent III (pope 1198–1216).[183] Northern Crusades and the advance of Christian kingdoms and military orders into previously pagan regions in the Baltic and Finnic north-east brought the forced assimilation of numerous native peoples into European culture.[184]

A long detour to 47° 50′ S serve to show that there be no land connection between New Zealand and Tierra del Fuego. Turning south again, Cook cross the Antarctic Circle for the third time at 109° 30′ W before his progress be once again block by ice four days later at 71° 10′ S by 106° 54′ W. This point, reach on 30 January 1774, be the farthest south attain in the 18th century. With a great detour to the east, almost to the coast of South America, the expedition regain Tahiti for refreshment. In November 1774, Cook start from New Zealand and cross the South Pacific without sight land between 53° and 57° S to Tierra del Fuego; then, pass Cape Horn on 29 December, he rediscover Roché Island rename it Isle of Georgia, and discover the South Sandwich Islands( name Sandwich Land by him), the only ice-clad land he have see, before cross the South Atlantic to the Cape of Good Hope between 55° and 60°. He thereby lay open the way for future Antarctic exploration by explode the myth of a habitable southern continent. Cook's most southerly discovery of land lay on the temperate side of the 60th parallel, and he convince himself that if land lay farther south it be practically inaccessible and of no economic value.[ 4]

The discovery of the Americas at the close of the 15th century show the scholars of Europe that new discoveries could be find outside of the authoritative works of Aristotle, Pliny, Galen, and other ancient writers.

During the 15th century, Funj herders migrated north to Alodia and occupied it. Between 1504 and 1505, the kingdom expanded, reaching its peak and establishing its capital at Sennar under Badi II Abu Daqn (c. 1644–1680). By the end of the 16th century, the Funj had converted to Islam. They pushed their empire westward to Kordofan. They expanded eastward, but were halted by Ethiopia. They controlled Nubia down to the 3rd Cataract. The economy depended on captured enemies to fill the army and on merchants travelling through Sennar. Under Badi IV (1724–1762), the army turned on the king, making him nothing but a figurehead. In 1821, the Funj were conquered by Muhammad Ali (1805–1849), Pasha of Egypt.[124][125]

Initially serve utilitarian purpose, follow by imperial, private, civic, and religious patronage, Eastern and Western painting later find audiences in the aristocracy and the middle class. From the Modern era, the Middle Ages through the Renaissance painters work for the church and a wealthy aristocracy.[ 6] Beginning with the Baroque era artists received private commissions from a more educated and prosperous middle class.[ 7] Finally in the West the idea of `` art for art's sake''[ 8] begin to find expression in the work of the Romantic painters like Francisco de Goya, John Constable, and J.M.W. Turner.[ 9] The 19th century saw the rise of the commercial art gallery, which provide patronage in the 20th century.[ 10]

From their beginnings in Sumer( now Iraq) around 3500 BC, the Mesopotamian peoples begin to attempt to record some observations of the world with extremely thorough numerical data. But their observations and measurements be seemingly take for purposes other than for scientific laws. A concrete instance of Pythagoras' law be record as early as the 18th century BC—the Mesopotamian cuneiform tablet Plimpton 322 records a number of Pythagorean triplets( 3,4,5)( 5,12,13) ..., dated 1900 BC, possibly millennia before Pythagoras,[ 1] —but an abstract formulation of the Pythagorean theorem be not.[ 1]

Influenced by the German tradition, Boas argue that the world be full of distinct cultures, rather than societies whose evolution could be measure by how much or how little `` civilization'' they have. He believe that each culture have to be study in its particularity, and argue that cross-cultural generalizations, like those make in the natural sciences, be not possible.

In 1873 James Clerk Maxwell published a unified treatment of electricity and magnetism in A Treatise on Electricity and Magnetism which stimulated several theorists to think in terms of fields described by Maxwell's equations. In 1878, the British inventor James Wimshurst developed an apparatus that had two glass disks mounted on two shafts. It was not till 1883 that the Wimshurst machine was more fully reported to the scientific community.

One recurring observation in the history of science involves the struggle for recognition of first-rate scientists working on the periphery of the scientific establishment. For instance, the great physicist Lord Rayleigh looked back (cited here) on John James Waterston's seminal paper on the kinetic theory of gases. The history of the neglect of Waterston's path-breaking article, Rayleigh felt, suggests that "a young author who believes himself capable of great things would usually do well to secure favourable recognition of the scientific world . . . before embarking upon higher flights."

There be publications describe technology. Encyclopaedias such as Harris's Lexicon Technicum( 1704) and Abraham Rees's Cyclopaedia( 1802–1819) contain much of value. Cyclopaedia contain an enormous amount of information about the science and technology of the first half of the Industrial Revolution, very well illustrate by fine engravings. Foreign print sources such as the Descriptions des Arts et Métiers and Diderot's Encyclopédie explain foreign methods with fine engrave plates.

The Hindu Shahis under Jayapala, be know for his struggles in defend his kingdom against the Ghaznavids in the modern-day eastern Afghanistan and Pakistan region. Jayapala saw a danger in the consolidation of the Ghaznavids and invade their capital city of Ghazni both in the reign of Sebuktigin and in that of his son Mahmud, which initiate the Muslim Ghaznavid and Hindu Shahi struggle.[ 256] Sebuk Tigin, however, defeat him, and he be force to pay an indemnity.[ 256] Jayapala default on the payment and take to the battlefield once more.[ 256] Jayapala however, lose control of the entire region between the Kabul Valley and Indus River.[ 257]

In 2006, Money Magazine and Salary.com rated software engineering as the best job in America in terms of growth, pay, stress levels, flexibility in hours and working environment, creativity, and how easy it is to enter and advance in the field.[14]

Two new forms of architecture were developed in medieval Japan in response to the militaristic climate of the times: the castle, a defensive structure built to house a feudal lord and his soldiers in times of trouble; and the shoin, a reception hall and private study area designed to reflect the relationships of lord and vassal within a feudal society.

Archaeologists contend that Paleo-Indian migration out of Beringia( eastern Alaska), range from 40,000 to around 16,500 years ago.[ 7][ 8][ 9][ 10] This time range be a hot source of debate and promises to continue as such for years to come. The few agreements achieve to date be the origin from Central Asia, with widespread habitation of the Americas during the end of the last glacial period, or more specifically what be know as the late glacial maximum, around 16,000 – 13,000 years before present.[ 10][ 11] However, older alternative theories exist, include migration from Europe.[ 12]

Although the British have the first scholarly journal dedicate to the topic of psychology – Mind, found in 1876 by Alexander Bain and edit by George Croom Robertson – it be quite a long while before experimental psychology develop there to challenge the strong tradition of `` mental philosophy.'' The experimental reports that appear in Mind in the first two decades of its existence be almost entirely author by Americans, especially G. Stanley Hall and his students( notably Henry Herbert Donaldson) and James McKeen Cattell.

Since 1029 BCE, the Zhou Dynasty (Chinese: 周朝; pinyin: Zhōu Cháo; Wade–Giles: Chou Ch'ao [tʂóʊ tʂʰɑ̌ʊ]), had existed in China and it would continue to until 258 BCE.[7] The Zhou dynasty had been using a feudal system by giving power to local nobility and relying on their loyalty in order to control its large territory.[7] As a result, the Chinese government at this time tended to be very decentralized and weak, and there was often little the emperor could do to resolve national issues. Nonetheless, the government was able to retain its position with the creation of the Mandate of Heaven, which could establish an emperor as divinely chosen to rule. The Zhou additionally discouraged the human sacrifice of the preceding eras and unified the Chinese language. Finally, the Zhou government encouraged settlers to move into the Yangtze River valley, thus creating the Chinese Middle Kingdom.

Although written records found at Anyang confirm the existence of the Shang dynasty,[citation needed] Western scholars are often hesitant to associate settlements that are contemporaneous with the Anyang settlement with the Shang dynasty. For example, archaeological findings at Sanxingdui suggest a technologically advanced civilization culturally unlike Anyang. The evidence is inconclusive in proving how far the Shang realm extended from Anyang. The leading hypothesis is that Anyang, ruled by the same Shang in the official history, coexisted and traded with numerous other culturally diverse settlements in the area that is now referred to as China proper.[citation needed]

Felix Weil be one of the students who receive their doctorate on the concept of socialization from the University of Frankfurt. He, along with Max Horkheimer and Kurt Albert Gerlach, develop the Institute of Social Research and it be establish in 1923. Kurt Albert Gerlach would serve as the institute’s first director. Their goal in create the institute be to produce a place that people could discover and be inform of social life as a whole. Weil, Horkheimer, and Gerlach want to focus on interactions between economics, politics, legal matters, as well as scholarly interactions in the community and society. The main research that get the institute known be its revival of scientific Marxism. Many benefactors contribute money, supplies, and buildings to keep this area of research go. When Gerlach, become ill and have to step down as director, Max Horkheimer take his place. He encourage the students of the institute to question everything they study. If the students study a theory, he not only want them to discover its truth themselves, but also to discover how, and why it be true and the theories relation to society. The National Socialist regime exile many of the members of the Institute of Social Research. The regime also force many students and staff from the entire Frankfurt University, and most flee to America. Many people force from the institute also leave the war path, but unlike the university, the institute lose too many people and be force to close. In 1950, the institute be reopen as a private establishment. From this point on the Institute of Social Research would have a close connection to sociology studies in the United States.[ 39]

Alfred Russel Wallace, contemporary and colleague of Darwin, was first to propose a "geography" of animal species. Several authors recognized at the time that species were not independent of each other, and grouped them into plant species, animal species, and later into communities of living beings or biocoenosis. The first use of this term is usually attributed to Karl Möbius in 1877, but already in 1825, the French naturalist Adolphe Dureau de la Malle used the term societé about an assemblage of plant individuals of different species.

In the earliest days of the Triple Alliance, the Mexica initiate an expansionist phase that lead them to control a good part of Mesoamerica. During this time only a few regions retain their independence: Tlaxcala( Nahua), Meztitlán( Otomí), Teotitlán del Camino( Cuicatec), Tututepec( Mixtec), Tehuantepec( Zapotec), and the northwest( rule at that time by their rivals, the Tarascans). The provinces control by the Triple Alliance be force to pay a tribute to Tenochtitlan; these payments be record in another codex know as the Matrícula de los tributos( Registry of Tribute). This document specify the quantity and type of every item that each province have to pay to the Mexicas.

A notable current within classical economics was underconsumption theory, as advanced by the Birmingham School and Thomas Robert Malthus in the early 19th century. These argued for government action to mitigate unemployment and economic downturns, and were an intellectual predecessor of what later became Keynesian economics in the 1930s. Another notable school was Manchester capitalism, which advocated free trade, against the previous policy of mercantilism.

The earliest form of Indian theatre be the Sanskrit theatre.[ 95] It emerge sometime between the 2nd century BC and the 1st century and flourish between the 1st century and the 10th, which be a period of relative peace in the history of India during which hundreds of plays be write.[ 96] With the Islamic conquests that begin in the 10th and 11th centuries, theatre be discourage or forbid entirely.[ 97] Later, in an attempt to re-assert indigenous values and ideas, village theatre be encourage across the subcontinent, develop in a large number of regional languages from the 15th to the 19th centuries.[ 98] Modern Indian theatre develop during the period of colonial rule under the British Empire, from the mid-19th century until the mid-20th.[ 99]

Lewis Paul patent the roller spinning frame and the flyer-and-bobbin system for draw wool to a more even thickness. The technology be develop with the help of John Wyatt of Birmingham. Paul and Wyatt open a mill in Birmingham which use their new roll machine power by a donkey. In 1743 a factory open in Northampton with 50 spindles on each of five of Paul and Wyatt's machines. This operate until about 1764. A similar mill be build by Daniel Bourn in Leominster, but this burn down. Both Lewis Paul and Daniel Bourn patent card machines in 1748. Based on two sets of rollers that travel at different speeds, it be later use in the first cotton spinning mill. Lewis's invention be later develop and improve by Richard Arkwright in his water frame and Samuel Crompton in his spinning mule.

British Malaya quickly collapsed, shocking the Australian nation. British, Indian and Australian troops made a disorganised last stand at Singapore, before surrendering on 15 February 1942. Around 15,000 Australian soldiers became prisoners of war. Curtin predicted that the "battle for Australia" would now follow. On 19 February, Darwin suffered a devastating air raid, the first time the Australian mainland had ever been attacked by enemy forces. Over the following 19 months, Australia was attacked from the air almost 100 times.

Further aspectual distinctions be encode by the use of auxiliary verbs, primarily have and be, which encode the contrast between a perfect and non-perfect past tense( I have run vs. I be run), and compound tenses such as preterite perfect( I have be run) and present perfect( I have be run).[ 181]

The common cubit be the length of the forearm from the elbow to the tip of the middle finger. It be divide into the span of the hand or the length between the tip of little finger to the tip of the thumb( one-half cubit), the palm or width of the hand( one sixth), and the digit or width of the middle finger( one twenty-fourth). The Royal Cubit, which be a standard cubit enhance by an extra palm—thus 7 palms or 28 digits long—was use in construct buildings and monuments and in survey in ancient Egypt. The inch, foot, and yard evolve from these units through a complicate transformation not yet fully understood. Some believe they evolve from cubic measures; others believe they be simple proportions or multiples of the cubit. In whichever case, the Greeks and Romans inherit the foot from the Egyptians. The Roman foot( ~296 mm) be divide into both 12 unciae( inches)( ~24.7 mm) and 16 digits( ~18.5 mm). The Romans also introduce the mille passus( 1000 paces) or double steps, the pace be equal to five Roman feet( ~1480 mm). The Roman mile of 5000 feet( 1480 m) be introduce into England during the occupation. Queen Elizabeth I( reign from 1558 to 1603) change, by statute, the mile to 5280 feet( ~1609 m) or 8 furlongs, a furlong be 40 rod( unit) s( ~201 m) of 5.5 yards( ~5.03 m) each.

Teotihuacan was completely dependent on agricultural activity, primarily the cultivation of maize, beans, and squash, the Mesoamerican agricultural trinity. However, its political and economic hegemony was based on outside goods for which it enjoyed a monopoly: Anaranjado ceramics, produced in the Poblano-Tlaxcalteca valley, and the mineral deposits of the Hidalgan mountains. Both were highly valued throughout Mesoamerica and were exchanged for luxury merchandise of the highest caliber, from places as far away as New Mexico and Guatemala. Because of this, Teotihuacan became the hub of the Mesoamerican trade network. Its partners were Monte Albán and Tikal in the southeast, Matacapan on the Gulf coast, Altavista in the north, and Tingambato in the west.

As a part of the British Empire Canada immediately enter World War I. Canada bore the brunt of several major battles during the early stages of the war include the use of poison gas attacks at Ypres. Losses become grave, and the government eventually bring in conscription, despite the fact this be against the wishes of the majority of French Canadians. In the ensue Conscription Crisis of 1917, riots break out on the streets of Montreal. In neighbor Newfoundland, the new dominion suffer a devastating loss on July 1, 1916, the First day on the Somme.

The Olmecs, on the other hand, have enter into an expansionist phase that lead them to construct their first works of monumental architecture at San Lorenzo and La Venta. The Olmecs exchange goods within their own core area and with sites as far away as Guerrero and Morelos and present day Guatemala and Costa Rica. San José Mogote, a site that also show Olmec influences, cede dominance of the Oaxacan plateau to Monte Albán toward the end of the middle Preclassic Era. During this same time, the Chupícuaro culture flourish in Bajío, while along the Gulf the Olmecs enter a period of decline.

In 1920 a department be set up in Poland by Florian Znaniecki( 1882–1958) .William I. Thomas be an early graduation from the sociology department of the University of Chicago. His build upon his teachings and his work change sociology in many ways. In 1918, William I. Thomas and Florian Znaniecki give the world the publication of The Polish Peasant in Europe and America. This publication combine sociological theory with in depth experiential research and thus launch methodical sociological research as a whole. This change sociologist’s methods and enable them to see new patterns and connect new theories. This publication also give sociologists a new way to found their research and prove it on a new level. All their research would be more solid, and harder for society to not pay attention to it. In 1920, Znaniecki develop a sociology department in Poland to expand research and teachings there.[ 2]

Aristotle discard Plato's credit theory of money for metallism, the theory that money derive its value from the purchase power of the commodity upon which it be base, and be only an `` instrument'', its sole purpose be a medium of exchange, which mean on its own `` it be worthless ... not useful as a means to any of the necessities of life''.[ 11]

In Italy, during the first half of the 16th century, Scipione del Ferro and Niccolò Fontana Tartaglia discover solutions for cubic equations. Gerolamo Cardano publish them in his 1545 book Ars Magna, together with a solution for the quartic equations, discover by his student Lodovico Ferrari. In 1572 Rafael Bombelli publish his L'Algebra in which he show how to deal with the imaginary quantities that could appear in Cardano's formula for solve cubic equations.

The Romans expand from Arabia to Britannia. In 44 BC as it approach its height, its dictator Julius Caesar be murder by senators in an attempt to restore the Republic. In the ensuing turmoil, Octavian( rule as Augustus; and as divi filius, or Son of God, as Julius have adopt him as an heir) usurp the reins of power and fight the Roman Senate. While proclaim the rebirth of the Republic, he have usher in the transfer of the Roman state from a republic to an empire, the Roman Empire, which last for more than four centuries until the fall of the Western Roman Empire.

In 1498, a Portuguese fleet under Vasco da Gama successfully discovered a new sea route from Europe to India, which paved the way for direct Indo-European commerce. The Portuguese soon set up trading posts in Goa, Daman, Diu and Bombay. Goa became the main Portuguese base until it was annexed by India in 1961.[335]

Around 3500 BCE, one of the first sacral kingdoms to arise in the Nile be Ta-Seti, locate in northern Nubia. Ta-Seti be a powerful sacral kingdom in the Nile Valley at the 1st and 2nd cataracts that exert an influence over nearby chiefdoms base on pictorial representation ruling over Upper Egypt. Ta-Seti trade as far as Syro-Palestine, as well as with Egypt. Ta-Seti export gold, copper, ostrich feathers, ebony and ivory to the Old Kingdom. By the 32nd century BCE, Ta-Seti be in decline. After the unification of Egypt by Narmer in 3100 BCE, Ta-Seti be invade by the Pharaoh Hor-Aha of the First Dynasty, destroy the final remnants of the kingdom. Ta-Seti be affiliate with the A-Group Culture know to archaeology.[ 41]

It can also refer to a period in which fragmentary or external historical documents, not necessarily including a developed writing system, have been found. For instance, the Proto–Three Kingdoms of Korea, the Yayoi[1] and the Mississippian groups recorded by early European explorers are protohistoric.
The destruction of Europe wrought by the war vault all North American countries to more important roles in world affairs. The United States especially emerge as a `` superpower''.
At first, astronomical thought in America was based on Aristotelian philosophy,[72] but interest in the new astronomy began to appear in Almanacs as early as 1659.[73]

Korean painting, as an independent form, begin around 108 B.C., around the fall of Gojoseon, make it one of the oldest in the world. The artwork of that time period evolve into the various styles that characterize the Three Kingdoms of Korea period, most notably the paintings and frescoes that adorn the tombs of Goguryeo's royalty. During the Three Kingdoms period and through the Goryeo dynasty, Korean painting be characterize primarily by a combination of Korean-style landscapes, facial features, Buddhist-centered themes, and an emphasis on celestial observation that be facilitate by the rapid development of Korean astronomy. It be n't until the Joseon dynasty that Confucian themes begin to take root in Korean paintings, use in harmony with indigenous aspects.

A third approach take the term `` Renaissance'' literally as a `` rebirth''. A closer study of Greek Philosophy and Greek Mathematics demonstrate that nearly all of the so-called revolutionary results of the so-called scientific revolution be in actuality restatements of ideas that be in many cases older than those of Aristotle and in nearly all cases at least as old as Archimedes. Aristotle even explicitly argue against some of the ideas that be espouse during the scientific revolution, such as heliocentrism. The basic ideas of the scientific method be well know to Archimedes and his contemporaries, as demonstrate in the well-known discovery of buoyancy. Atomism be first thought of by Leucippus and Democritus. This view of the scientific revolution reduce it to a period of relearn classical ideas that be very much an extension of the Renaissance. This view of the scientific revolution do not deny that a change occur but argue that it be a reassertion of previous knowledge( a renaissance) and not the creation of new knowledge. It cite statements from Newton, Copernicus and others in favour of the Pythagorean worldview as evidence.[ 129][ 130]

A written reference, Herodotus's account (written c. 440 BC) refers to a memory from 800 years earlier, which may be subject to question in the fullness of genetic results. (History, I:1). This is a legendary introduction to Herodotus' brief retelling of some mythical Hellene-Phoenician interactions. Though few modern archaeologists would confuse this myth with history, a grain of truth may yet lie therein.

During the Preclassic Era, or Formative Period, large-scale ceremonial architecture, write, cities, and states develop. Many of the distinctive elements of Mesoamerican civilization can be trace back to this period, include the dominance of corn, the building of pyramids, human sacrifice, jaguar-worship, the complex calendar, and many of the gods.[ 1]

American Gothic be a painting by Grant Wood from 1930. Portraying a pitchfork-holding farmer and a younger woman in front of a house of Carpenter Gothic style, it be one of the most familiar images in 20th-century American art. Art critics have favorable opinions about the painting, like Gertrude Stein and Christopher Morley, they assume the painting be mean to be a satire of rural small-town life. It be thus see as part of the trend towards increasingly critical depictions of rural America, along the lines of Sherwood Anderson's 1919 Winesburg, Ohio, Sinclair Lewis' 1920 Main Street, and Carl Van Vechten's The Tattooed Countess in literature.[ 55] However, with the onset of the Great Depression, the painting come to be see as a depiction of steadfast American pioneer spirit.

An analysis of early Chinese mathematics has demonstrated its unique development compared to other parts of the world, leading scholars to assume an entirely independent development.[80] The oldest extant mathematical text from China is the Zhoubi Suanjing, variously dated to between 1200 BC and 100 BC, though a date of about 300 BC appears reasonable.[81] However, the Tsinghua Bamboo Slips, containing the earliest known decimal multiplication table (although ancient Babylonians had ones with a base of 60), is dated around 305 BC and is perhaps the oldest surviving mathematical text of China.[43]

Since the 1990s, the ROC go from a one-party rule to a multi party system thanks to a series of democratic and governmental reforms that be implement in Taiwan. Additional Articles of the Constitution be pass to grant full civil and political rights to Taiwanese people( officially the people of the Free area of the Republic of China). Under the Additional Articles, the President and the national legislators shall be directly elect. The first congressional elections on Taiwan be hold in 1991 for National Assembly and 1992 for Legislative Yuan. The first election for provincial Governors and municipality Mayors be in 1994. Most importantly, Taiwan hold the first direct election of the President and Vice President in 1996.

Innovation of the technique of smelting ore ended the Stone Age and began the Bronze Age. The first most significant metal manufactured was bronze, an alloy of copper and tin, each of which was smelted separately. The transition from the Stone Age to the Bronze Age was a period during which modern people could smelt copper, but did not yet manufacture bronze, a time known as the Copper Age, or more technically the Chalcolithic, "copper-stone" age. The Chalcolithic by convention is the initial period of the Bronze Age. The Bronze Age was followed by the Iron Age.

The end of medieval drama come about due to a number of factors, include the weaken power of the Catholic Church, the Protestant Reformation and the banning of religious plays in many countries. Elizabeth I forbid all religious plays in 1558 and the great cycle plays have be silence by the 1580s. Similarly, religious plays be ban in the Netherlands in 1539, the Papal States in 1547 and in Paris in 1548. The abandonment of these plays destroy the international theatre that have thereto exist and force each country to develop its own form of drama. It also allow dramatists to turn to secular subjects and the revive interest in Greek and Roman theatre provide them with the perfect opportunity.[ 42]

A system of companion planting called the Three Sisters was developed in North America. Three crops that complemented each other were planted together: winter squash, maize (corn), and climbing beans (typically tepary beans or common beans). The maize provides a structure for the beans to climb, eliminating the need for poles. The beans provide the nitrogen to the soil that the other plants use, and the squash spreads along the ground, blocking the sunlight, helping prevent the establishment of weeds. The squash leaves also act as a "living mulch".[79][80]

By the 1850s, the East India Company control most of the Indian subcontinent. Their policy be sometimes sum up as Divide and Rule, take advantage of the enmity fester between various princely states and social and religious groups.[ 347]

The Howard Government expanded immigration overall,[419] but instituted often controversial tough immigration policies and laws to discourage people arriving by boat without authorisation. These policies included the Pacific Solution, which involved detaining asylum seekers in detention centres in Naru and Papua New Guinea while their refugee status was determined, as well as a policy of turning back vessels intercepted at sea. Two significant controversies involving asylum seekers were the Children Overboard affair and the Tampa Affair.
In 1986, Fred Brooks publish his No Silver Bullet article, argue that no individual technology or practice would ever make a 10-fold improvement in productivity within 10 years.[ citation need]

Ewuare's grandson Oba Esigie( 1504–1550) erode the power of the uzama( state council) and increase contact and trade with Europeans, especially with the Portuguese who provide a new source of copper for court art. The oba rule with the advice of the uzama, a council consist of chiefs of powerful families and town chiefs of different guilds. Later its authority be diminish by the establishment of administrative dignitaries. Women wield power. The queen mother who produce the future oba wield immense influence.[ 191]

Peter G. Neumann has kept a contemporary list of software problems and disasters.[10] The software crisis has been fading from view, because it is psychologically extremely difficult to remain in crisis mode for a protracted period (more than 20 years). Nevertheless, software – especially real-time embedded software – remains risky and is pervasive, and it is crucial not to give in to complacency. Over the last 10–15 years Michael A. Jackson has written extensively about the nature of software engineering, has identified the main source of its difficulties as lack of specialization, and has suggested that his problem frames provide the basis for a "normal practice" of software engineering, a prerequisite if software engineering is to become an engineering science.[11]

In sight of Port Moresby itself, the Japanese began to run out of momentum against the Australians who began to receive further reinforcements. Having outrun their supply lines and following the reverses suffered by the Japanese at Guadalcanal, the Japanese were now on the defensive, marking the limit of the Japanese advance southwards. The Japanese subsequently withdrew to establish a defensive position on the north coast, but they were followed by the Australians who recaptured Kokoda on 2 November. Further fighting continued into November and December as the Australian and United States forces assaulted the Japanese beachheads, in what later became known as the Battle of Buna–Gona.

Indian classical music( marga) be monophonic, and base on a single melody line or raga rhythmically organize through talas. Carnatic music be largely devotional; the majority of the songs be address to the Hindu deities. There be a lot of songs emphasise love and other social issues. In contrast to Carnatic music, Hindustani music be not only influence by ancient Hindu musical traditions, Vedic philosophy and native Indian sounds but also by the Persian performance practices of the Afghan Mughals. The origins of Indian classical music can be find from the oldest of scriptures, part of the Hindu tradition, the Vedas. Samaveda, one of the four vedas describes music at length.

In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, European colonization of Africa developed rapidly in the Scramble for Africa. It is widely believed that Africa had up to 10,000 different states and autonomous groups with distinct languages and customs before it was colonized.[3] Following struggles for independence in many parts of the continent, as well as a weakened Europe after the Second World War, decolonization took place, culminating in the 1960 Year of Africa.

From their beginnings in Sumer (now Iraq) around 3500 BC, the Mesopotamian people began to attempt to record some observations of the world with numerical data. But their observations and measurements were seemingly taken for purposes other than for elucidating scientific laws. There was also no agreed-upon scientific method for making experiments reproducible. Indeed, many alchemists included in their methods irrelevant information such as the timing of the tides or the phases of the moon. The esoteric nature and codified vocabulary of alchemy appeared to be more useful in concealing the fact that they could not be sure of very much at all. As early as the 14th century, cracks seemed to grow in the facade of alchemy; and people became sceptical.[citation needed] Clearly, there needed to be a scientific method where experiments can be repeated by other people, and results needed to be reported in a clear language that laid out both what is known and unknown.

Peasant society be much less documented than the nobility. Most of the survive information available to historians come from archaeology; few detailed write records document peasant life remain from before the 9th century. Most the descriptions of the lower classes come from either law codes or writers from the upper classes.[ 71] Landholding patterns in the West be not uniform; some areas have greatly fragment landholding patterns, but in other areas large contiguous blocks of land be the norm. These differences allow for a wide variety of peasant societies, some dominate by aristocratic landholders and others have a great deal of autonomy.[ 72] Land settlement also vary greatly. Some peasants live in large settlements that number as many as 700 inhabitants. Others live in small groups of a few families and still others live on isolated farms spread over the countryside. There be also areas where the pattern be a mix of two or more of those systems.[ 73] Unlike in the late Roman period, there be no sharp break between the legal status of the free peasant and the aristocrat, and it be possible for a free peasant's family to rise into the aristocracy over several generations through military service to a powerful lord.[ 74]

In the 20th century, the Egyptian Government and archaeologists alike recognized the importance of cultural respect and integrity in excavations. The Supreme Council of Antiquities now approves and oversees all excavations, which are aimed at finding information rather than treasure. The council also supervises museums and monument reconstruction programs designed to preserve the historical legacy of Egypt.

Historians have analyse the Vedas to posit a Vedic culture in the Punjab region and the upper Gangetic Plain.[ 77] Most historians also consider this period to have encompass several waves of Indo-Aryan migration into the subcontinent from the north-west.[ 78][ 79] The peepal tree and cow be sanctify by the time of the Atharva Veda.[ 80] Many of the concepts of Indian philosophy espouse later like Dharma, Karma etc. trace their root to the Vedas.[ 81]

He publish `` Cybernetics'' in 1948, which influence artificial intelligence. Wiener also compare computation, compute machinery, memory devices, and other cognitive similarities with his analysis of brain waves.[ citation need]

European diseases (smallpox, influenza, measles and typhus) to which the native populations had no resistance were the overwhelming cause of the depopulation of the Native American population.[42] Cruel systems of forced labor (such as encomiendas and mining industry's mita) under Spanish control also contributed to depopulation. Lower bound estimates speak of a decline in the population of around 20–50 per cent, whereas high estimates arrive at 90 per cent.[43] Following this, African slaves, who had developed immunity to these diseases, were quickly brought in to replace them.[citation needed]

A contemporary of Spencer, Lester Frank Ward is often described as a father of American sociology[30] and served as the first president of the American Sociological Association in 1905 and served as such until 1907. He published Dynamic Sociology in 1883; Outlines of Sociology in 1898; Pure Sociology in 1903; and Applied Sociology in 1906. Also in 1906, at the age of 65 he was appointed to professor of sociology at Brown University.[31]

In 1847, Hungarian physician Ignác Fülöp Semmelweis dramatically reduce the occurrency of puerperal fever by simply require physicians to wash their hands before attend to women in childbirth. This discovery predate the germ theory of disease. However, Semmelweis' findings be not appreciate by his contemporaries and come into use only with discoveries by British surgeon Joseph Lister, who in 1865 prove the principles of antisepsis. Lister's work be base on the important findings by French biologist Louis Pasteur. Pasteur be able to link microorganisms with disease, revolutionize medicine. He also devise one of the most important methods in preventive medicine, when in 1880 he produce a vaccine against rabies. Pasteur invent the process of pasteurization, to help prevent the spread of disease through milk and other foods.[ 110]

It was in this context that the so-called American School of Anthropology thrived as the champion of polygenism or the doctrine of multiple origins—sparking a debate between those influenced by the Bible who believed in the unity of humanity and those who argued from a scientific standpoint for the plurality of origins and the antiquity of distinct types. Like the monogenists, these theories were not monolithic and often used words like races, species, hybrid, and mongrel interchangeably. A scientific consensus began to emerge during this period "that there exists a Genus Homo, embracing many primordial types of ‘species’." Charles Caldwell, Samuel George Morton, Samuel A. Cartwright, George Gliddon, Josiah C. Nott, and Louis Agassiz, and even South Carolina Governor James Henry Hammond were all influential proponents of this school. While some were disinterested scientists, others were passionate advocates who used science to promote slavery in a period of increasing sectional strife. All were complicit in establishing the putative science that justified slavery, informed the Dred Scott decision, underpinned miscegenation laws, and eventually fueled Jim Crow. Samuel G. Morton, for example, claimed to be just a scientist but he did not hesitate to provide evidence of Negro inferiority to John C. Calhoun, the prominent pro-slavery Secretary of State to help him negotiate the annexation of Texas as a slave state.

In addition to the necessity of public leadership in certain sectors Smith argued, secondly, that cartels were undesirable because of their potential to limit production and quality of goods and services.[35] Thirdly, Smith criticised government support of any kind of monopoly which always charges the highest price "which can be squeezed out of the buyers".[36] The existence of monopoly and the potential for cartels, which would later form the core of competition law policy, could distort the benefits of free markets to the advantage of businesses at the expense of consumer sovereignty.

The First Viennese School of Medicine, 1750–1800, be lead by the Dutchman Gerard van Swieten( 1700–1772), who aim to put medicine on new scientific foundations- promoting unprejudiced clinical observation, botanical and chemical research, and introduce simple but powerful remedies. When the Vienna General Hospital open in 1784, it at once become the world's largest hospital and physicians acquire a facility that gradually develop into the most important research centre.[ 106] Progress end with the Napoleonic wars and the government shutdown in 1819 of all liberal journals and schools; this cause a general return to traditionalism and eclecticism in medicine.[ 107]

Up to and during the 1930s, electrical engineers were able to build electronic circuits to solve mathematical and logic problems, but most did so in an ad hoc manner, lacking any theoretical rigor. This changed with Claude Elwood Shannon's publication of his 1937 master's thesis, A Symbolic Analysis of Relay and Switching Circuits. While taking an undergraduate philosophy class, Shannon had been exposed to Boole's work, and recognized that it could be used to arrange electromechanical relays (then used in telephone routing switches) to solve logic problems. This concept, of utilizing the properties of electrical switches to do logic, is the basic concept that underlies all electronic digital computers, and his thesis became the foundation of practical digital circuit design when it became widely known among the electrical engineering community during and after World War II .[citation needed]
In 1959 the non-contiguous US territories of Alaska and Hawaii become US states.

A Mode 2 tool be a biface consist of two concave surfaces intersect to form a cutting edge all the way around, except in the case of tools intend to feature a point. More work and planning go into the manufacture of a Mode 2 tool. The manufacturer hit a slab off a larger rock to use as a blank. Then large flakes be strike off the blank and work into bifaces by hard-hammer percussion on an anvil stone. Finally the edge be retouch: small flakes be hit off with a bone or wood soft hammer to sharpen or resharpen it. The core can be either the blank or another flake. Blanks be port for manufacture supply in places where nature have provide no suitable stone.

In present-day Australia these groups be further divide into local communities.[ 57]

The elemental system use in Medieval alchemy be develop primarily by the Arabian alchemist Jābir ibn Hayyān and root in the classical elements of Greek tradition.[ 14] His system consist of the four Aristotelian elements of air, earth, fire, and water in addition to two philosophical elements: sulphur, characterize the principle of combustibility; `` the stone which burns'', and mercury, characterize the principle of metallic properties. The League try to enforce economic sanctions upon Italy, but to no avail.
