Although there is disagreement as to whether the dynasty actually existed, there is some archaeological evidence pointing to its possible existence. Writing in the late 2nd century BC, Sima Qian dated the founding of the Xia dynasty to around 2200 BC, but this date has not been corroborated. Most archaeologists now connect the Xia to excavations at Erlitou in central Henan province,[23] where a bronze smelter from around 2000 BC was unearthed. Early markings from this period found on pottery and shells are thought to be ancestral to modern Chinese characters.[24] With few clear records matching the Shang oracle bones or the Zhou bronze vessel writings, the Xia era remains poorly understood.

The Greek drive for independence from the Ottoman Empire inspire supporters across Christian Europe, especially in Britain. France, Russia and Britain intervene to make this nationalist dream become reality.[ 95]

Students in the twelfth-century were very proud of the master whom they studied under. They were not very concerned with telling others the place or region where they received their education. Even now when scholars cite schools with distinctive doctrines, they use group names to describe the school rather than its geographical location. Those who studied under Robert of Melun were called the Meludinenses. These people did not study in Melun, but in Paris, and were given the group name of their master. Citizens in the twelfth-century became very interested in learning the rare and difficult skills masters could provide.[41]

In parallel Hillary's team have set up Scott Base – which be to be Fuchs' final destination – on the opposite side of the continent at McMurdo Sound on the Ross Sea. Using three convert Massey Ferguson TE20 tractors[ 58] and one Weasel( abandon part-way), Hillary and his three men( Ron Balham, Peter Mulgrew and Murray Ellis), be responsible for route-finding and lay a line of supply depots up the Skelton Glacier and across the Polar Plateau on towards the South Pole, for the use of Fuchs on the final leg of his journey. Other members of Hillary's team carry out geological surveys around the Ross Sea and Victoria Land areas.

In the Eastern Empire the slow infiltration of the Balkans by the Slavs added a further difficulty for Justinian's successors. It began gradually, but by the late 540s Slavic tribes were in Thrace and Illyrium, and had defeated an imperial army near Adrianople in 551. In the 560s the Avars began to expand from their base on the north bank of the Danube; by the end of the 6th century they were the dominant power in Central Europe and routinely able to force the eastern emperors to pay tribute. They remained a strong power until 796.[62]

The Roman Empire underwent considerable social, cultural and organizational change starting with reign of Diocletian, who began the custom of splitting the Empire into Eastern and Western halves ruled by multiple emperors. Beginning with Constantine the Great the Empire was Christianized, and a new capital founded at Constantinople. Migrations of Germanic tribes disrupted Roman rule from the late 4th century onwards, culminating in the eventual collapse of the Empire in the West in 476, replaced by the so-called barbarian kingdoms. The resultant cultural fusion of Greco-Roman, Germanic and Christian traditions formed the cultural foundations of Europe.

The Viking voyages did not become common knowledge in the Old World, and Europeans remained ignorant of the existence of the Americas, until 1492. As part of a general age of discovery, Genoese sailor Christopher Columbus proposed a voyage west from Europe to find a shorter route to Asia. He eventually received the backing of Isabella I and Ferdinand II, Queen and King of newly united Spain. In 1492 Columbus reached land in the Bahamas.

Deng Xiaoping was the Paramount Leader of China from 1978 to 1992, although he never became the head of the party or state, and his influence within the Party led the country to significant economic reforms. The Communist Party subsequently loosened governmental control over citizens' personal lives and the communes were disbanded with many peasants receiving multiple land leases, which greatly increased incentives and agricultural production. This turn of events marked China's transition from a planned economy to a mixed economy with an increasingly open market environment, a system termed by some[55] as "market socialism", and officially by the Communist Party of China as "Socialism with Chinese characteristics". The PRC adopted its current constitution on 4 December 1982.

Mendeleev had such faith in the validity of the periodic law that he proposed changes to the generally accepted values for the atomic weight of a few elements and, in his version of the periodic table of 1871, predicted the locations within the table of unknown elements together with their properties. He even predicted the likely properties of three yet-to-be-discovered elements, which he called ekaboron (Eb), ekaaluminium (Ea), and ekasilicon (Es), which proved to be good predictors of the properties of scandium, gallium, and germanium, respectively, which each fill the spot in the periodic table assigned by Mendeleev.

Classical antiquity be a broad term for a long period of cultural history center around the Mediterranean Sea, which begin roughly with the earliest-recorded Greek poetry of Homer( 9th century BC), and continue through the rise of Christianity and the fall of the Western Roman Empire( 5th century AD), end in the dissolution of classical culture with the close of Late Antiquity.

Military technology be the application of technology for use in warfare. It comprise the kinds of technology that be distinctly military in nature and not civilian in application, usually because they lack useful or legal civilian applications, or be dangerous to use without appropriate military training.

Among the earliest inventions be the abacus, the public toilet, and the `` shadow clock''.[ 29] Joseph Needham note the `` Four Great Inventions'' of China as among some of the most important technological advances; these be the compass, gunpowder, papermaking, and printing, which be later know in Europe by the end of the Middle Ages. The Tang dynasty( AD 618- 906) in particular be a time of great innovation.[ 29] A good deal of exchange occur between Western and Chinese discoveries up to the Qing dynasty.

In the 5th to 15th centuries, scientific progress occurred in the Muslim world. Many classic works in Latin and Greek were translated into Arabic. Ibn Sīnā (980–1037), known as "Avicenna", was a polymath from Bukhara (now in present-day Uzbekistan) responsible for important contributions to physics, optics, philosophy and medicine. He is most famous for writing The Canon of Medicine, a text that was used to teach student doctors in Europe until the 1600s.

The struggle between the Arabs and the Jews in Palestine culminated in the 1947 United Nations plan to partition Palestine. This plan attempted to create an Arab state and a Jewish state in the narrow space between the Jordan River and the Mediterranean. While the Jewish leaders accepted it, the Arab leaders rejected this plan.

From 613 to 630, Muhammad spread the faith of Islam in the Arabian desert, culminating in his victory at Mecca. He then unified the tribes into an Islamic Empire, ruled by a religious and political leader, the caliph. They would proceed to conquer the Sassanids, and modern-day Syria, Palestine, Egypt, and Libya.[12] An Arabic navy was created that soon dominated the Mediterranean, crippled the Byzantine Empire, and put it under siege for centuries to come.[13] Issues in deciding the caliphs to succeed Muhammad led to the Ridda wars and eventually the Sunni-Shia split, two different sects of Islam; the Sunni eventually became dominant and established the Umayyad Caliphate.[13]

By 1942, neighbouring Burma was invaded by Japan, which by then had already captured the Indian territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Japan gave nominal control of the islands to the Provisional Government of Free India on 21 October 1943, and in the following March, the Indian National Army with the help of Japan crossed into India and advanced as far as Kohima in Nagaland. This advance on the mainland of South Asia reached its farthest point on India territory, retreating from the Battle of Kohima in June and from that of Imphal on 3 July 1944.

With Pierre-Simon Laplace, Lavoisier use a calorimeter to estimate the heat evolve per unit of carbon dioxide produce. They find the same ratio for a flame and animals, indicate that animals produce energy by a type of combustion. Lavoisier believe in the radical theory, believe that radicals, which function as a single group in a chemical reaction, would combine with oxygen in reactions. He believe all acids contain oxygen. He also discover that diamond be a crystalline form of carbon.
The transition to industrialisation be not without difficulty. For example, a group of English workers know as Luddites form to protest against industrialisation and sometimes sabotaged factories.

The oldest legislative body in Australia, the New South Wales Legislative Council, be create in 1825 as an appoint body to advise the Governor of New South Wales. William Wentworth establish the Australian Patriotic Association( Australia's first political party) in 1835 to demand democratic government for New South Wales. The reformist attorney general, John Plunkett, seek to apply Enlightenment principles to governance in the colony, pursue the establishment of equality before the law, first by extend jury rights to emancipists, then by extend legal protections to convicts, assign servants and Aborigines. Plunkett twice charge the colonist perpetrators of the Myall Creek massacre of Aborigines with murder, result in a conviction and his landmark Church Act of 1836 disestablish the Church of England and establish legal equality between Anglicans, Catholics, Presbyterians and later Methodists.[ 202]

The geographers of ancient India put forward theories regarding the origin of the earth. They theorized that the earth was formed by the solidification of gaseous matter and that the earth's crust is composed of hard rocks (sila), clay (bhumih) and sand (asma).[18] Theories were also propounded to explain earthquakes (bhukamp) and it was assumed that earth, air and water combined to cause earthquakes.[18] The Arthashastra, a compendium by Kautilya (also known as Chanakya) contains a range of geographical and statistical information about the various regions of India.[16] The composers of the Puranas divided the known world into seven continents of dwipas, Jambu Dwipa, Krauncha Dwipa, Kusha Dwipa, Plaksha Dwipa, Pushkara Dwipa, Shaka Dwipa and Shalmali Dwipa. Descriptions were provided for the climate and geography of each of the dwipas.[18]

The Olmec civilization develop and flourish at such sites as La Venta and San Lorenzo Tenochtitlán. The Zapotec civilization arose in the Valley of Oaxaca, the Teotihuacan civilization arose in the Valley of Mexico, and the Maya civilization begin to develop in the Isthmus of Tehuantepec in modern-day Chiapas, later expand into Guatemala and the Yucatán Peninsula.[ 2][ 3][ 4]

Among the best-known expressions of Olmec culture be giant stone heads, sculpture monoliths up to three metres in height and several tons in weight. These feats of Olmec stonecutting be especially impressive when one consider that Mesoamericans lack iron tools and that the heads be at sites dozens of kilometers from the quarries where their basalt be mine. The function of these monuments be unknown. Some authors propose that they be commemorative monuments for notable players of the ballgame, and others that they be images of the Olmec govern elite.

Around 1785 BC, as the power of the Middle Kingdom pharaohs weaken, a Western Asian people call the Hyksos have already settle in the Eastern Delta town of Avaris, seize control of Egypt, and force the central government to retreat to Thebes. The pharaoh be treat as a vassal and expect to pay tribute.[ 42] The Hyksos( `` foreign rulers'') retain Egyptian models of government and identify as pharaohs, thus integrate Egyptian elements into their culture. They and other invaders introduce new tools of warfare into Egypt, most notably the composite bow and the horse-drawn chariot.[ 43]

English be a pluricentric language, which mean that no one national authority set the standard for use of the language.[ 87][ 88][ 89][ 90] But English be not a divided language,[ 91] despite a long-standing joke originally attribute to George Bernard Shaw that the United Kingdom and the United States be `` two countries separate by a common language''.[ 92] Spoken English, for example English use in broadcasting, generally follow national pronunciation standards that be also establish by custom rather than by regulation. International broadcasters be usually identifiable as come from one country rather than another through their accents,[ 93] but newsreader scripts be also compose largely in international standard write English. The norms of standard write English be maintain purely by the consensus of educate English-speakers around the world, without any oversight by any government or international organisation.[ 94] American listeners generally readily understand most British broadcasting, and British listeners readily understand most American broadcasting. Most English speakers around the world can understand radio programmes, television programmes, and films from many parts of the English-speaking world.[ 95] Both standard and nonstandard varieties of English can include both formal or informal styles, distinguish by word choice and syntax and use both technical and non-technical registers.[ 96]
Sculpture, paintings and stained glass windows were vital educational media through which Biblical themes and the lives of the saints were taught to illiterate viewers.[45]

The problem of the transitions in archaeology is a branch of the general philosophic continuity problem, which examines how discrete objects of any sort that are contiguous in any way can be presumed to have a relationship of any sort. In archaeology, the relationship is one of causality. If Period B can be presumed to descend from Period A, there must be a boundary between A and B, the A–B boundary. The problem is in the nature of this boundary. If there is no distinct boundary, then the population of A suddenly stopped using the customs characteristic of A and suddenly started using those of B, an unlikely scenario in the process of evolution. More realistically, a distinct border period, the A/B transition, existed, in which the customs of A were gradually dropped and those of B acquired. If transitions do not exist, then there is no proof of any continuity between A and B.[citation needed]

The multiple names result from multiple recognitions of the period. Originally, the term `` Bronze Age'' meant that either copper or bronze be be use as the chief hard substance for the manufacture of tools and weapons. In 1881, John Evans, recognize that the use of copper often precede the use of bronze, distinguish between a transitional Copper Age and the Bronze Age proper. He do not include the transitional period in the tripartite system of Early, Middle and Late Bronze Age but place it at the begin outside of it. He do not, however, present it as a fourth age but instead choose to retain the traditional three-age system.[ citation need]

Most parts of Europe have active and well-differentiated musical traditions by late in the century. In England, composers such as Thomas Tallis and William Byrd write sacred music in a style similar to that write on the continent, while an active group of home-grown madrigalists adapt the Italian form for English tastes: famous composers include Thomas Morley, John Wilbye and Thomas Weelkes. Spain develop instrumental and vocal styles of its own, with Tomás Luis de Victoria write refine music similar to that of Palestrina, and numerous other composers write for the new guitar. Germany cultivate polyphonic forms build on the Protestant chorales, which replace the Roman Catholic Gregorian Chant as a basis for sacred music, and import the style of the Venetian school( the appearance of which define the start of the Baroque era there). In addition, German composers write enormous amounts of organ music, establish the basis for the later Baroque organ style which culminate in the work of J.S. Bach. France develop a unique style of musical diction know as musique mesurée, use in secular chansons, with composers such as Guillaume Costeley and Claude Le Jeune prominent in the movement.
Unlike the Bengal School where'copying' be the norm of teaching, the Madras School flourishes on'creating' new styles, arguments and trends.

Once again Canada found itself at war before her neighbors, however even Canadian contributions were slight before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The entry of the United States into the war helped to tip the balance in favor of the allies. On August 19, 1942, a force of some 6000, largely Canadian, infantry was landed near the French channel port of Dieppe. The German defenders under General von Rundstedt destroyed the invaders. 907 Canadians were killed and almost 2,500 captured (many wounded). Lessons learned in this abortive raid were put to good use 2 years later in the successful Normandy invasion.

From the mid-first century AD, Christianity take root in Egypt and it be originally see as another cult that could be accept. However, it be an uncompromising religion that seek to win converts from Egyptian Religion and Greco-Roman religion and threaten popular religious traditions. This lead to the persecution of converts to Christianity, culminate in the great purges of Diocletian start in 303, but eventually Christianity win out.[ 84] In 391 the Christian Emperor Theodosius introduce legislation that ban pagan rites and close temples.[ 85] Alexandria become the scene of great anti-pagan riots with public and private religious imagery destroyed.[ 86] As a consequence, Egypt's native religious culture be continually in decline. While the native population certainly continue to speak their language, the ability to read hieroglyphic write slowly disappear as the role of the Egyptian temple priests and priestesses diminish. The temples themselves be sometimes convert to churches or abandon to the desert.[ 87]

The European economic center shifted from the Mediterranean to Western Europe. The city of Antwerp, part of the Duchy of Brabant, became "the center of the entire international economy,[153] and the richest city in Europe at this time.[154] Centered in Antwerp first and then in Amsterdam, "Dutch Golden Age" was tightly linked to the Age of Discovery. Francesco Guicciardini, a Venetian envoy, stated that hundreds of ships would pass Antwerp in a day, and 2,000 carts entered the city each week. Portuguese ships laden with pepper and cinnamon would unload their cargo. With many foreign merchants resident in the city and governed by an oligarchy of banker-aristocrats forbidden to engage in trade, the economy of Antwerp was foreigner-controlled, which made the city very international, with merchants and traders from Venice, Ragusa, Spain and Portugal and a policy of toleration, which attracted a large Orthodox Jewish community. The city experienced three booms during its golden age, the first based on the pepper market, a second launched by New World silver coming from Seville (ending with the bankruptcy of Spain in 1557), and a third boom, after the Treaty of Cateau-Cambresis, in 1559, based on the textiles industry.

The Castellieri culture develop in Istria during the Middle Bronze Age. It last for more than a millennium, from the 15th century BC until the Roman conquest in the 3rd century BC. It take its name from the fortify boroughs( Castellieri, Friulian cjastelir) that characterize the culture.

The early Roman army (c. 500 BC) was, like those of other contemporary city-states influenced by Greek civilization, a citizen militia that practiced hoplite tactics. It was small (the population of free men of military age was then about 9,000) and organized in five classes (in parallel to the comitia centuriata, the body of citizens organized politically), with three providing hoplites and two providing light infantry. The early Roman army was tactically limited and its stance during this period was essentially defensive.[184]

The consequence of this complex orthographic history be that learn to read can be challenge in English. It can take longer for school pupils to become independently fluent readers of English than of many other languages, include Italian, Spanish, or German.[ 227] Nonetheless, there be an advantage for learners of English reading in learn the specific sound-symbol regularities that occur in the standard English spellings of commonly use words.[ 222] Such instruction greatly reduce the risk of children experience read difficulties in English.[ 228][ 229] Making primary school teachers more aware of the primacy of morpheme representation in English may help learners learn more efficiently to read and write English.[ 230]

Initially, Rome was ruled by kings, who were elected from each of Rome's major tribes in turn.[179] The exact nature of the king's power is uncertain. He may have held near-absolute power, or may also have merely been the chief executive of the Senate and the people. At least in military matters, the king's authority (Imperium) was likely absolute. He was also the head of the state religion. In addition to the authority of the King, there were three administrative assemblies: the Senate, which acted as an advisory body for the King; the Comitia Curiata, which could endorse and ratify laws suggested by the King; and the Comitia Calata, which was an assembly of the priestly college that could assemble the people to bear witness to certain acts, hear proclamations, and declare the feast and holiday schedule for the next month.

The causes of World War I include many factors, include the conflicts and antagonisms of the four decades lead up to the war. The Triple Entente be the name give to the loose alignment between the United Kingdom, France, and Russia after the signing of the Anglo-Russian Entente in 1907. The alignment of the three powers, supplement by various agreements with Japan, the United States, and Spain, constitute a powerful counterweight to the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Italy, the third have conclude an additional secret agreement with France effectively nullify her Alliance commitments. Militarism, alliances, imperialism, and nationalism play major roles in the conflict. The immediate origins of the war lay in the decisions take by statesmen and generals during the July Crisis of 1914, the spark( or casus belli) for which be the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria.

On top of the supply of money, Keynes identify the propensity to consume, inducement to invest, marginal efficiency of capital, liquidity preference, and multiplier effect as variables which determine the level of the economy's output, employment, and price levels. Much of this esoteric terminology be invent by Keynes especially for his General Theory. Keynes argue that if savings be be withhold from investment in financial markets, total spending falls, lead to reduce incomes and unemployment, which reduce savings again. This continue until the desire to save becomes equal to the desire to invest, which mean a new `` equilibrium'' be reach and the spending decline halts. This new `` equilibrium'' be a depression, where people be invest less, have less to save and less to spend.

Software product lines, aka product family engineering, be a systematic way to produce families of software systems, instead of create a succession of completely individual products. This method emphasize extensive, systematic, formal code reuse, to try to industrialize the software development process.

Egypt reached the pinnacle of its power in the New Kingdom, during the Ramesside period, where it rivalled the Hittite Empire, Assyrian Empire and Mitanni Empire, after which it entered a period of slow decline. Egypt was invaded or conquered by a succession of foreign powers, such as the Canaanites/Hyksos, Libyans, the Nubians, the Assyrians, Babylonians, the Achaemenid Persians, and the Macedonians in the Third Intermediate Period and the Late Period of Egypt. In the aftermath of Alexander the Great's death, one of his generals, Ptolemy Soter, established himself as the new ruler of Egypt. This Greek Ptolemaic Kingdom ruled Egypt until 30 BC, when, under Cleopatra, it fell to the Roman Empire and became a Roman province.[3]

Spain sponsor a major exploration lead by Christopher Columbus in 1492; it quickly lead to extensive European colonization of the Americas. The Europeans bring Old World diseases which be think to have cause catastrophic epidemics and a huge decrease of the native population. Columbus come at a time in which many technical developments in sail techniques and communication make it possible to report his voyages easily and to spread word of them throughout western Europe. It be also a time of grow religious, imperial and economic rivalries that lead to a competition for the establishment of colonies.

Before the Muslim expeditions into the Indian subcontinent, much of North and West India be rule by Rajput dynasties. The Rajputs and the south Indian Chalukya dynasty be successful in contain Arab Muslim expansion during the Caliphate campaigns in India; but later, Central Asian Muslim Turks be able to break through the Rajput defence into the Northern Indian heartland. However, the Rajputs hold out against the Muslim Turkic empires for several centuries. They earn a reputation of fight battles obey a code of chivalrous conduct root in a strong adherence to tradition and Chi.[ 267]

Western Europe enter the Middle Ages with great difficulties that affect the continent's intellectual production. The advanced astronomical treatises of classical antiquity be write in Greek, and with the decline of knowledge of that language, only simplified summaries and practical texts be available for study. The most influential writers to pass on this ancient tradition in Latin be Macrobius, Pliny, Martianus Capella, and Calcidius.[ 53] In the 6th century Bishop Gregory of Tours note that he have learn his astronomy from read Martianus Capella, and go on to employ this rudimentary astronomy to describe a method by which monks could determine the time of prayer at night by watch the stars.[ 54]

During the 1980s, audiences begin increasingly watch films on their home VCRs. In the early part of that decade, the film studios try legal action to ban home ownership of VCRs as a violation of copyright, which prove unsuccessful. Eventually, the sale and rental of films on home video become a significant `` second venue'' for exhibition of films, and an additional source of revenue for the film industries.

Islamic science began its decline in the 12th or 13th century, before the Renaissance in Europe, and due in part to the 11th–13th century Mongol conquests, during which libraries, observatories, hospitals and universities were destroyed.[82] The end of the Islamic Golden Age is marked by the destruction of the intellectual center of Baghdad, the capital of the Abbasid caliphate in 1258.[82]
Fortifications be military constructions and buildings design for defense in warfare. They range in size and age from the Great Wall of China to a Sangar.

Arzawa in Western Anatolia during the second half of the second millennium BC likely extend along southern Anatolia in a belt that reach from near the Turkish Lakes Region to the Aegean coast. Arzawa be the western neighbor—sometimes a rival and sometimes a vassal—of the Middle and New Hittite Kingdoms.

Yet the formation of a new field, genetic engineering, would soon bring biotechnology to the forefront of science in society, and the intimate relationship between the scientific community, the public, and the government would ensue. These debates gained exposure in 1975 at the Asilomar Conference, where Joshua Lederberg was the most outspoken supporter for this emerging field in biotechnology. By as early as 1978, with the development of synthetic human insulin, Lederberg's claims would prove valid, and the biotechnology industry grew rapidly. Each new scientific advance became a media event designed to capture public support, and by the 1980s, biotechnology grew into a promising real industry. In 1988, only five proteins from genetically engineered cells had been approved as drugs by the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA), but this number would skyrocket to over 125 by the end of the 1990s.
Roman domes permitted construction of vaulted ceilings and enabled huge covered public spaces such as the public baths like Baths of Diocletian or the monumental Pantheon in the city of Rome.

John Maynard Keynes( 1883–1946) be bear in Cambridge, educate at Eton, and supervise by both A. C. Pigou and Alfred Marshall at Cambridge University. He begin his career as a lecturer before work for the British government during the Great War, rise to be the British government's financial representative at the Versailles Conference, where he profoundly disagree with the decisions make. His observations be lay out in his book The Economic Consequences of the Peace[ 76]( 1919), where he document his outrage at the collapse of American adherence to the Fourteen Points[ 77] and the mood of vindictiveness that prevail towards Germany.,[ 78] and he resign from the conference, use extensive economic data provide by the conference records to argue that if the victors force war reparations to be pay by the defeated Axis, then a world financial crisis would ensue, lead to a second world war.[ 79] Keynes finish his treatise by advocate, first, a reduction in reparation payments by Germany to a realistically manageable level, increase intra-governmental management of continental coal production and a free trade union through the League of Nations;[ 80] second, an arrangement to set off debt repayments between the Allied countries;[ 81] third, complete reform of international currency exchange and an international loan fund;[ 82] and fourth, a reconciliation of trade relations with Russia and Eastern Europe.[ 83]

The notion of `` prehistory'' begin to surface during the Enlightenment in the work of antiquarians who use the word'primitive' to describe societies that exist before write records.[ 5] The first use of the word prehistory in English, however, occur in the Foreign Quarterly Review in 1836.[ 6]

The three metallic principles: sulphur to flammability or combustion, mercury to volatility and stability, and salt to solidity. become the tria prima of the Swiss alchemist Paracelsus. He reason that Aristotle's four-element theory appear in bodies as three principles. Paracelsus saw these principles as fundamental and justify them by recourse to the description of how wood burns in fire. Mercury include the cohesive principle, so that when it leave in smoke the wood fell apart. Smoke describe the volatility( the mercurial principle), the heat-giving flames describe flammability( sulphur), and the remnant ash describe solidity( salt).[ 16]

Experimentation was not the only approach to psychology in the German-speaking world at this time. Starting in the 1890s, employing the case study technique, the Viennese physician Sigmund Freud developed and applied the methods of hypnosis, free association, and dream interpretation to reveal putatively unconscious beliefs and desires that he argued were the underlying causes of his patients' "hysteria." He dubbed this approach psychoanalysis. Freudian psychoanalysis is particularly notable for the emphasis it places on the course of an individual's sexual development in pathogenesis. Psychoanalytic concepts have had a strong and lasting influence on Western culture, particularly on the arts. Although its scientific contribution is still a matter of debate, both Freudian and Jungian psychology revealed the existence of compartmentalized thinking, in which some behavior and thoughts are hidden from consciousness – yet operative as part of the complete personality. Hidden agendas, a bad conscience, or a sense of guilt, are examples of the existence of mental processes in which the individual is not conscious, through choice or lack of understanding, of some aspects of their personality and subsequent behavior.
World War II divert most scholars to wartime projects and account for a pause in scholarship during the 1940s.[ 237]

The ancient Egyptians use donkeys and oxen as beasts of burden, and they be responsible for plow the fields and trample seed into the soil. The slaughter of a fattened ox be also a central part of an offering ritual.[ 107] Horses be introduce by the Hyksos in the Second Intermediate Period, and the camel, although know from the New Kingdom, be not use as a beast of burden until the Late Period. There be also evidence to suggest that elephants be briefly utilize in the Late Period, but largely abandon due to lack of graze land.[ 107] Dogs, cats and monkeys be common family pets, while more exotic pets import from the heart of Africa, such as lions, be reserve for royalty. Herodotus observe that the Egyptians be the only people to keep their animals with them in their houses.[ 106] During the Predynastic and Late periods, the worship of the gods in their animal form be extremely popular, such as the cat goddess Bastet and the ibis god Thoth, and these animals be breed in large numbers on farms for the purpose of ritual sacrifice.[ 109]

By the mid 20th century, in principle, the integration of physics and chemistry be extensive, with chemical properties explain as the result of the electronic structure of the atom; Linus Pauling's book on The Nature of the Chemical Bond use the principles of quantum mechanics to deduce bond angles in ever-more complicated molecules. However, though some principles deduce from quantum mechanics be able to predict qualitatively some chemical features for biologically relevant molecules, they be, till the end of the 20th century, more a collection of rules, observations, and recipes than rigorous ab initio quantitative methods.[ citation need]

It be the discovery of the touchstone which lead the way for metal-based commodity money and coinage. Any soft metal can be test for purity on a touchstone, allow one to quickly calculate the total content of a particular metal in a lump. Gold be a soft metal, which be also hard to come by, dense, and storable. As a result, monetary gold spread very quickly from Asia Minor, where it first gain wide usage, to the entire world.

For practitioners in Europe, alchemy became an intellectual pursuit after early Arabic alchemy became available through Latin translation, and over time, they improved. Paracelsus (1493–1541), for example, rejected the 4-elemental theory and with only a vague understanding of his chemicals and medicines, formed a hybrid of alchemy and science in what was to be called iatrochemistry. Paracelsus was not perfect in making his experiments truly scientific. For example, as an extension of his theory that new compounds could be made by combining mercury with sulfur, he once made what he thought was "oil of sulfur". This was actually dimethyl ether, which had neither mercury nor sulfur.[citation needed]

In ancient China, biological topics can be find dispersed across several different disciplines, include the work of herbologists, physicians, alchemists, and philosophers. The Taoist tradition of Chinese alchemy, for example, can be consider part of the life sciences due to its emphasis on health( with the ultimate goal be the elixir of life). The system of classical Chinese medicine usually revolve around the theory of yin and yang, and the five phases.[ 8] Taoist philosophers, such as Zhuangzi in the 4th century BCE, also express ideas relate to evolution, such as deny the fixity of biological species and speculate that species have develop differ attributes in response to differ environments.[ 9]

In the United States, a scientific revolution in agriculture began with the Hatch Act of 1887, which used the term "agricultural science". The Hatch Act was driven by farmers' interest in knowing the constituents of early artificial fertilizer. Later on, the Smith-Hughes Act of 1917 shifted agricultural education back to its vocational roots, but the scientific foundation had been built.[4] After 1906, public expenditures on agricultural research in the US exceeded private expenditures for the next 44 years.[5]

James Fox of Derby have a healthy export trade in machine tools for the first third of the century, as do Matthew Murray of Leeds. Roberts be a maker of high-quality machine tools and a pioneer of the use of jigs and gauges for precision workshop measurement.

Shortly after Columbus's return from what would later be call the `` West Indies'', a division of influence become necessary to avoid conflict between the Spanish and Portuguese.[ 63] On 4 May 1493, two months after Columbus's arrival, the Catholic Monarchs receive a bull( Inter caetera) from Pope Alexander VI state that all land west and south of a pole-to-pole line 100 leagues west and south of the Azores or the Cape Verde Islands should belong to Castile and, later, all mainlands and islands then belong to India. It do not mention Portugal, which could not claim newly discover land east of the line.

In 2007 follow the release of the `` Little Children be Sacred'' report detail widespread abuse in Aboriginal communities, the Howard Government launch the Northern Territory Intervention to combat drugs and sexual abuse.

From the 1880s to 1914, the European powers expand their control across the African continent, compete with each other for Africa’s land and resources. Great Britain control various colonial holdings in East Africa that span the length of the African continent from Egypt in the north to South Africa. The French gained major ground in West Africa, and the Portuguese held colonies in southern Africa. Germany, Italy, and Spain establish a small number of colonies at various points throughout the continent, which include German East Africa( Tanganyika) and German Southwest Africa for Germany, Eritrea and Libya for Italy, and the Canary Islands and Rio de Oro in northwestern Africa for Spain. Finally, for King Leopold( rule from 1865–1909), there be the large “piece of that great African cake” know as the Congo, which, unfortunately for the native Congolese, become his personal fiefdom to do with as he please in Central Africa. By 1914, almost the entire continent be under European control. Liberia, which be settle by freed American slaves in the 1820s, and Abyssinia( Ethiopia) in eastern Africa be the last remaining independent African states.( John Merriman, A History of Modern Europe, Volume Two: From the French Revolution to the Present, Third Edition( New York: W. W. Norton& Company, 2010), pp. 819–859).

Einstein argued that the speed of light was a constant in all inertial reference frames and that electromagnetic laws should remain valid independent of reference frame—assertions which rendered the ether "superfluous" to physical theory, and that held that observations of time and length varied relative to how the observer was moving with respect to the object being measured (what came to be called the "special theory of relativity"). It also followed that mass and energy were interchangeable quantities according to the equation E=mc2. In another paper published the same year, Einstein asserted that electromagnetic radiation was transmitted in discrete quantities ("quanta"), according to a constant that the theoretical physicist Max Planck had posited in 1900 to arrive at an accurate theory for the distribution of blackbody radiation—an assumption that explained the strange properties of the photoelectric effect.
Greece

At that period, the Greek language function as a lingua franca, a language speak throughout the know world( for the Greeks and Romans) of that time and, as a result, modern linguistics struggles to overcome this. With the Greeks a tradition commence in the study of language. The Romans and the medieval world follow, and their laborious work be consider[ by whom?] today as a part of our everyday language. Think, for example, of notions such as the word, the syllable, the verb, the subject etc.

In Western Europe, a political structure was emerging: in the power vacuum left in the wake of Rome's collapse, localised hierarchies were based on the bond of common people to the land on which they worked. Tithes were paid to the lord of the land, and the lord owed duties to the regional prince. The tithes were used to pay for the state and wars.
Later in the 20th century, methodological naturalism was emphasized by Robert T. Pennock as central to scientific method, partly in response to rise of creation science.

Aristotle introduced what may be called a scientific method.[16][need quotation to verify] His demonstration method is found in Posterior Analytics. He provided another of the ingredients of scientific tradition: empiricism. For Aristotle, universal truths can be known from particular things via induction. To some extent then, Aristotle reconciles abstract thought with observation, although it would be a mistake to imply that Aristotelian science is empirical in form. Indeed, Aristotle did not accept that knowledge acquired by induction could rightly be counted as scientific knowledge. Nevertheless, induction was for him a necessary preliminary to the main business of scientific enquiry, providing the primary premises required for scientific demonstrations.

The Umayyad be center at their capital, Damascus in what's now Syria. With the Umayyad come more conquest, give them rule over central Asia, most of northern Africa, and from there, the Iberian Peninsula( modern-day Spain and Portugal). Little conversion occur at this time due to the disrespect non-Arab Muslims, or mawali( Arabic: موالي), receive from the Umayyad. Christians and Jews be treat with more respect as dhimmi( Arabic: ذمي), specifically the Ahl al-Kitab( Arabic: أهل الكتاب) or `` people of the book,'' refer to the Holy Bible which they all share. During the Umayyad age, women's position also improve from that of pre-Islamic Arabia; Muhammad's teachings ban adultery, encourage marriage and kindness to wives and daughters, and proclaim equality of women and men `` in the eyes of God. ``[ 14]

Later in the 1960s and 1970s, Edmund Leach and his students Mary Douglas and Nur Yalman, among others, introduced French structuralism in the style of Lévi-Strauss; while British anthropology has continued to emphasize social organization and economics over purely symbolic or literary topics, differences among British, French, and American sociocultural anthropologies have diminished with increasing dialogue and borrowing of both theory and methods. Today, social anthropology in Britain engages internationally with many other social theories and has branched in many directions.

Dissenters find themselves bar or discourage from almost all public offices, as well as education at England's only two universities at the time( although dissenters be still free to study at Scotland's four universities). When the restoration of the monarchy take place and membership in the official Anglican Church become mandatory due to the Test Act, they thereupon become active in banking, manufacturing and education. The Unitarians, in particular, be very involve in education, by run Dissenting Academies, where, in contrast to the universities of Oxford and Cambridge and schools such as Eton and Harrow, much attention be give to mathematics and the sciences—areas of scholarship vital to the development of manufacturing technologies.

The atomic theory of matter have be propose again in the early 19th century by the chemist John Dalton and become one of the hypotheses of the kinetic-molecular theory of gases develop by Clausius and James Clerk Maxwell to explain the laws of thermodynamics. The kinetic theory in turn lead to the statistical mechanics of Ludwig Boltzmann( 1844–1906) and Josiah Willard Gibbs( 1839–1903), which hold that energy( include heat) be a measure of the speed of particles. Interrelating the statistical likelihood of certain states of organization of these particles with the energy of those states, Clausius reinterpret the dissipation of energy to be the statistical tendency of molecular configurations to pass toward increasingly likely, increasingly disorganize states( coin the term `` entropy'' to describe the disorganization of a state). The statistical versus absolute interpretations of the second law of thermodynamics set up a dispute that would last for several decades( produce arguments such as `` Maxwell's demon''), and that would not be hold to be definitively resolve until the behavior of atoms be firmly establish in the early 20th century.[ 42][ 43] In 1902, James Jeans find the length scale require for gravitational perturbations to grow in a static nearly homogeneous medium.

The emergence of Dutch maritime power be swift and remarkable: for years Dutch sailors have participate in Portuguese voyages to the east, as able seafarers and keen mapmakers. In 1592, Cornelis de Houtman be send by Dutch merchants to Lisbon, to gather as much information as he could about the Spice Islands. In 1595, merchant and explorer Jan Huyghen van Linschoten, have travel widely in the Indian Ocean at the service of the Portuguese, publish a travel report in Amsterdam, the `` Reys-gheschrift vande navigatien der Portugaloysers in Orienten''( `` Report of a journey through the navigations of the Portuguese in the East'').[ 117] This include vast directions on how to navigate between Portugal and the East Indies and to Japan. That same year Houtman follow this directions in the Dutch first exploratory travel that discover a new sea route, sail directly from Madagascar to Sunda Strait in Indonesia and sign a treaty with the Banten Sultan.

In the 1770s-1850s Paris became a world center of medical research and teaching. The "Paris School" emphasized that teaching and research should be based in large hospitals and promoted the professionalization of the medical profession and the emphasis on sanitation and public health. A major reformer was Jean-Antoine Chaptal (1756–1832), a physician who was Minister of Internal Affairs. He created the Paris Hospital, health councils, and other bodies.[103]

The tools be form by knock pieces off a river pebble, or stones like it, with a hammerstone to obtain large and small pieces with one or more sharp edges. The original stone be call a core; the resultant pieces, flakes. Typically, but not necessarily, small pieces be detach from a larger piece, in which case the larger piece may be call the core and the smaller pieces the flakes. The prevalent usage, however, be to call all the results flakes, which can be confuse. A split in half be call bipolar flaking.

In 609 BC Necho II go to war with Babylonia, the Chaldeans, the Medians and the Scythians in an attempt to save Assyria, which after a brutal civil war be be overrun by this coalition of powers. However, the attempt to save Egypt's former masters fail. The Egyptians delay intervene too long, and Nineveh have already fall and King Sin-shar-ishkun be dead by the time Necho II send his armies northwards. However, Necho easily brush aside the Israelite army under King Josiah but he and the Assyrians then lose a battle at Harran to the Babylonians, Medes and Scythians. Necho II and Ashur-uballit II of Assyria be finally defeat at Carchemish in Aramea( modern Syria) in 605 BC. The Egyptians remain in the area for some decades, struggle with the Babylonian kings Nabopolassar and Nebuchadnezzar II for control of portions of the former Assyrian Empire in The Levant. However, they be eventually drive back into Egypt, and Nebuchadnezzar II even briefly invade Egypt itself in 567 BC.[ 70] The Saite kings base in the new capital of Sais witness a brief but spirited resurgence in the economy and culture, but in 525 BC, the powerful Persians, lead by Cambyses II, begin their conquest of Egypt, eventually capture the pharaoh Psamtik III at the battle of Pelusium. Cambyses II then assume the formal title of pharaoh, but rule Egypt from his home of Susa in Persia( modern Iran), leave Egypt under the control of a satrapy. A few temporarily successful revolts against the Persians mark the fifth century BC, but Egypt be never able to permanently overthrow the Persians.[ 75]
During the French Revolution, the National Assembly, which exist from June 17 to July 9 of 1789, be a transitional body between the Estates-General and the National Constituent Assembly.

The new Western philosophical foundations that emerged from the pursuit of reason during the Enlightenment era helped pave the way for policies that emphasized a need for a separation of church and state. Principles similar to those that dominated the material sciences could be applied to society as a whole, originating the social sciences. Politics could be studied in a laboratory as it were, the social milieu. In 1787, Alexander Hamilton wrote: "...The science of politics like most other sciences has received great improvement." (The Federalist Papers Number 9 and 51). Both the marquis d'Argenson and the abbé de Saint-Pierre described politics as a science; d'Argenson was a philosopher and de Saint-Pierre an allied reformer of the enlightenment.[4]

In 1907, a Central American Court of Justice was created. On December 13, 1960, Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, and Nicaragua established the Central American Common Market ("CACM"). Costa Rica, because of its relative economic prosperity and political stability, chose not to participate in the CACM. The goals for the CACM were to create greater political unification and success of import substitution industrialization policies. The project was an immediate economic success, but was abandoned after the 1969 "Football War" between El Salvador and Honduras. A Central American Parliament has operated, as a purely advisory body, since 1991. Costa Rica has repeatedly declined invitations to join the regional parliament, which seats deputies from the four other former members of the Union, as well as from Panama and the Dominican Republic.

The contrast to this approach, the method of doing history of science which preceded externalism, became known as internalism. Internalist histories of science often focus on the rational reconstruction of scientific ideas and consider the development of these ideas wholly within the scientific world. Although internalist histories of modern science tend to emphasize the norms of modern science, internalist histories can also consider the different systems of thought underlying the development of Babylonian astronomy or Medieval impetus theory

At the turn of the 20th century, the violent Boxer Rebellion oppose foreign influence in Northern China, and attack Chinese Christians and missionaries. When Boxers enter Beijing, the Qing government order all foreigners to leave. But instead the foreigners and many Chinese be besiege in the foreign legations quarter. The Eight-Nation Alliance send the Seymour Expedition of Japanese, Russian, Italian, German, French, American, and Austrian troops to relieve the siege. The Expedition be stop by the Boxers at the Battle of Langfang and force to retreat. Due to the Alliance's attack on the Dagu Forts, the Qing government in response side with the Boxers and declare war on the Alliance. There be fierce fighting at Tientsin. The Alliance form the second, much larger Gaselee Expedition and finally reach Beijing; the Qing government evacuate to Xi'an. The Boxer Protocol end the war.

The departure of the European powers from direct control of the region, the establishment of Israel, and the increase importance of the oil industry, mark the creation of the modern Middle East. These developments lead to a grow presence of the United States in Middle East affairs. The U.S. be the ultimate guarantor of the stability of the region, and from the 1950s the dominant force in the oil industry. When revolutions bring radical anti-Western regimes to power in Egypt in 1954, Syria in 1963, Iraq in 1968 and Libya in 1969, the Soviet Union, seek to open a new arena of the Cold War in the Middle East, ally itself with Arab socialist rulers such as Gamal Abdel Nasser of Egypt and Saddam Hussein of Iraq.

In 1971 Arrow and Frank Hahn published General Competitive Analysis (1971), which reasserted a theory of general equilibrium of prices through the economy. In 1971, US President Richard Nixon's had declared that "We are all Keynesians now"[110]

The phrase "contemporary philosophy" is a piece of technical terminology in philosophy that refers to a specific period in the history of Western philosophy. However, the phrase is often confused with modern philosophy (which refers to an earlier period in Western philosophy), postmodern philosophy (which refers to continental philosophers' criticisms of modern philosophy), and with a non-technical use of the phrase referring to any recent philosophic work.

The publication of vernacular literature increase, with Dante( d. 1321), Petrarch( d. 1374) and Giovanni Boccaccio( d. 1375) in 14th-century Italy, Geoffrey Chaucer( d. 1400) and William Langland( d. c. 1386) in England, and François Villon( d. 1464) and Christine de Pizan( d. c. 1430) in France. Much literature remain religious in character, and although a great deal of it continue to be write in Latin, a new demand develop for saints' lives and other devotional tracts in the vernacular languages.[ 304] This be feed by the growth of the Devotio Moderna movement, most prominently in the formation of the Brethren of the Common Life, but also in the works of German mystics such as Meister Eckhart and Johannes Tauler( d. 1361).[ 306] Theatre also develop in the guise of miracle plays put on by the Church.[ 304] At the end of the period, the development of the print press in about 1450 lead to the establishment of publishing houses throughout Europe by 1500.[ 307]

Metal based coins had the advantage of carrying their value within the coins themselves – on the other hand, they induced manipulations: the clipping of coins in the attempt to get and recycle the precious metal. A greater problem was the simultaneous co-existence of gold, silver and copper coins in Europe. English and Spanish traders valued gold coins more than silver coins, as many of their neighbors did, with the effect that the English gold-based guinea coin began to rise against the English silver based crown in the 1670s and 1680s. Consequently, silver was ultimately pulled out of England for dubious amounts of gold coming into the country at a rate no other European nation would share. The effect was worsened with Asian traders not sharing the European appreciation of gold altogether — gold left Asia and silver left Europe in quantities European observers like Isaac Newton, Master of the Royal Mint observed with unease.[74]

In the 19th century the empire was internally stagnant and externally threatened by western powers. The defeat by the British Empire in the First Opium War (1840) led to the Treaty of Nanking (1842), under which Hong Kong was ceded to Britain and importation of opium (produced by British Empire territories) was allowed. Subsequent military defeats and unequal treaties with other western powers continued even after the fall of the Qing dynasty.

Around the end of the 19th century and into the 20th century, the Meiji era be mark by the reign of the Meiji Emperor. During this time, Japan start its modernization and rise to world power status. This era name mean `` Enlightened Rule''. In Japan, the Meiji Restoration start in the 1860s, mark the rapid modernization by the Japanese themselves along European lines. Much research have focus on the issues of discontinuity versus continuity with the previous Tokugawa Period.[ 68] In the 1960s younger Japanese scholars lead by Irokawa Daikichi, react against the bureaucratic superstate, and begin search for the historic role of the common people. They avoid the elite, and focus not on political events but on social forces and attitudes. They reject both Marxism and modernization theory as alien and confine. They stress the importance of popular energies in the development of modern Japan. They enlarge history by use the methods of social history.[ 69] It be not until the beginning of the Meiji Era that the Japanese government begin take modernization seriously. Japan expand its military production base by open arsenals in various locations. The hyobusho( war office) be replace with a War Department and a Naval Department. The samurai class suffer great disappointment the following years.

The invention of the first write systems be roughly contemporary in with the beginning of the Bronze Age in the late Neolithic of the late 4000 BC. The first writing system be generally believe to have be invent in pre-historic Sumer and develop by the late 3000's BC into cuneiform. Egyptian hieroglyphs, and the undeciphered Proto-Elamite writing system and Indus Valley script also date to this era, though a few scholars have question the Indus Valley script's status as a writing system.

Portugal's neighbour fellow Iberian rival, Castile, have begin to establish its rule over the Canary Islands, locate off the west African coast, in 1402, but then become distract by internal Iberian politics and the repelling of Islamic invasion attempts and raids through most of the 15th century. Only late in the century, follow the unification of the crowns of Castile and Aragon and the completion of the reconquista, do an emerge modern Spain become fully commit to the search for new trade routes overseas. The Crown of Aragon have be an important maritime potentate in the Mediterranean, control territories in eastern Spain, southwestern France, major islands like Sicily, Malta, and the Kingdom of Naples and Sardinia, with mainland possessions as far as Greece. In 1492 the joint rulers conquer the Moorish kingdom of Granada, which have be provide Castile with African goods through tribute, and decide to fund Christopher Columbus's expedition in the hope of bypass Portugal's monopoly on west African sea routes, to reach `` the Indies''( east and south Asia) by travel west.[ 59] Twice before, in 1485 and 1488, Columbus have present the project to king John II of Portugal, who reject it.

However, the prime example of reference works that systematize scientific knowledge in the age of Enlightenment be universal encyclopedias rather than technical dictionaries. It be the goal of universal encyclopedias to record all human knowledge in a comprehensive reference work.[ 166] The most well-known of these works be Denis Diderot and Jean le Rond d'Alembert's Encyclopédie, ou dictionnaire raisonné des sciences, des arts et des métiers. The work, which begin publication in 1751, be compose of thirty-five volumes and over 71 000 separate entries. A great number of the entries be dedicate to describe the sciences and crafts in detail, and provide intellectuals across Europe with a high-quality survey of human knowledge. In d'Alembert's Preliminary Discourse to the Encyclopedia of Diderot, the work's goal to record the extent of human knowledge in the arts and sciences be outline:

Until 1927, motion pictures were produced without sound. This era is referred to as the silent era of film. To enhance the viewers' experience, silent films were commonly accompanied by live musicians in an orchestra, a theatre organ, and sometimes sound effects and even commentary spoken by the showman or projectionist. In most countries, intertitles came to be used to provide dialogue and narration for the film, thus dispensing with narrators, but in Japanese cinema human narration remained popular throughout the silent era. The technical problems were resolved by 1923.

Syrian bishop Jacob of Edessa( 633–708) adapt scientific material source from Aristotle, Theophrastus, Ptolemy and Basil to develop a carefully structured picture of the cosmos. He correct his sources and write more scientifically, whereas Basil’s Hexaemeron be theological in style.[ 40]

The manufactured gas industry begin in British cities in 1812–1820. The technique use produce highly toxic effluent that be dump into sewers and rivers. The gas companies be repeatedly sue in nuisance lawsuits. They usually lose and modify the worst practices. The City of London repeatedly indict gas companies in the 1820s for pollute the Thames and poison its fish. Finally, Parliament write company charters to regulate toxicity.[ 112] The industry reach the US around 1850 cause pollution and lawsuits.[ 113]

In the late 19th and early 20th centuries archaeologists worked on the assumptions that a succession of Hominans and cultures prevailed, that one replaced another. Today the presence of multiple hominans living contemporaneously near each other for long periods is accepted as proved true; moreover, by the time the previously assumed "earliest" culture arrived in northern Europe, the rest of Africa and Eurasia had progressed to the Middle and Upper Palaeolithic, so that across the earth all three were for a time contemporaneous. In any given region there was a progression from Oldowan to Acheulean, Lower to Upper, no doubt.
Ancient Greek literature –
The earliest bronze artifacts have be find in the Majiayao culture site( between 3100 and 2700 BC),[ 32][ 33] and from then on, the society gradually grow into the Bronze Age.
In the 1950s Kenneth Arrow and Gérard Debreu( 1921–2004) develop the Arrow–Debreu model of general equilibria. In 1963 Arrow publish a paper which found Health Economics.[ citation need]

While millennia of independent development were interrupted by the Portuguese and Spanish colonization of the late 15th century and the demographic collapse that followed, the continent's mestizo and indigenous cultures remain quite distinct from those of their colonizers. Through the trans-Atlantic slave trade, South America (especially Brazil) became the home of millions of people of the African diaspora. The mixing of races led to new social structures.

A genre that greatly rose in importance was that of scientific literature. Natural history in particular became increasingly popular among the upper classes. Works of natural history include René-Antoine Ferchault de Réaumur's Histoire naturelle des insectes and Jacques Gautier d'Agoty's La Myologie complète, ou description de tous les muscles du corps humain (1746). Outside ancien régime France, natural history was an important part of medicine and industry, encompassing the fields of botany, zoology, meteorology, hydrology and mineralogy. Students in Enlightenment universities and academies were taught these subjects to prepare them for careers as diverse as medicine and theology. As shown by M D Eddy, natural history in this context was a very middle class pursuit and operated as a fertile trading zone for the interdisciplinary exchange of diverse scientific ideas.[154]

During the Chinese Song dynasty( 960 – 1279 AD), not only landscape art be improve upon, but portrait paint become more standardized and sophisticated than before( for example, refer to Emperor Huizong of Song), and reach its classical age maturity during the Ming Dynasty( 1368 – 1644 AD). During the late 13th century and first half of the 14th century, Chinese under the Mongol-controlled Yuan Dynasty be not allow to enter higher posts of government( reserve for Mongols or other ethnic groups from Central Asia), and the Imperial examination be cease for the time be. Many Confucian-educated Chinese who now lacked profession turn to the arts of painting and theatre instead, as the Yuan period become one of the most vibrant and abundant eras for Chinese artwork. An example of such would be Qian Xuan( 1235–1305 AD), who be an official of the Song dynasty, but out of patriotism, refuse to serve the Yuan court and dedicate himself to paint. Examples of superb art from this period include the rich and detailed painted murals of the Yongle Palace,[ 18][ 19] or `` Dachunyang Longevity Palace'', of 1262 AD, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Within the palace, paintings cover an area of more than 1000 square meters, and hold mostly Daoist themes. It be during the Song dynasty that painters would also gather in social clubs or meetings to discuss their art or others' artwork, the praising of which often lead to persuasions to trade and sell precious works of art. However, there be also many harsh critics of others art as well, show the difference in style and taste amongst different painters. In 1088 AD, the polymath scientist and statesman Shen Kuo once write of the artwork of one Li Cheng, who he criticize as follow:

At sites date from the Lower Paleolithic Period( about 2,500,000 to 200,000 years ago), simple pebble tools have be find in association with the remains of what may have be the earliest human ancestors. A somewhat more sophisticated Lower Paleolithic tradition, know as the Chopper chopping-tool industry, be widely distribute in the Eastern Hemisphere. This tradition be think to have be the work of the hominin species name Homo erectus. Although no such fossil tools have yet be find, it be believe that H. erectus probably make tools of wood and bone as well as stone. About 700,000 years ago, a new Lower Paleolithic tool, the hand ax, appear. The earliest European hand axes be assign to the Abbevillian industry, which develop in northern France in the valley of the Somme River; a later, more refined hand-ax tradition be see in the Acheulian industry, evidence of which have be find in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. Some of the earliest known hand axes be find at Olduvai Gorge( Tanzania) in association with remains of H. erectus. Alongside the hand-axe tradition there develop a distinct and very different stone-tool industry, base on flakes of stone: special tools be make from work( carefully shape) flakes of flint. In Europe, the Clactonian industry be one example of a flake tradition. The early flake industries probably contribute to the development of the Middle Paleolithic flake tools of the Mousterian industry, which be associate with the remains of Neanderthal man.[ 25]

Artists such as Albrecht Dürer and Leonardo da Vinci, often work with naturalists, be also interested in the bodies of animals and humans, study physiology in detail and contribute to the growth of anatomical knowledge.[ 24] The traditions of alchemy and natural magic, especially in the work of Paracelsus, also lay claim to knowledge of the living world. Alchemists subject organic matter to chemical analysis and experiment liberally with both biological and mineral pharmacology.[ 25] This be part of a larger transition in world views( the rise of the mechanical philosophy) that continue into the 17th century, as the traditional metaphor of nature as organism be replace by the nature as machine metaphor.[ 26]

Claudius be poison by his wife, Agrippina the Younger in 54 AD.[ 81] His heir be Nero, son of Agrippina and her former husband, since Claudius' son Britannicus have not reach manhood upon his father's death. Nero be widely know as the first persecutor of Christians and for the Great Fire of Rome, rumour to have be start by the emperor himself.[ 82][ 83] Nero face many revolts during his reign, like the Pisonian conspiracy and the First Jewish-Roman War. Although Nero defeat these rebels, he could not overthrow the revolt lead by Servius Sulpicius Galba. The Senate soon declare Nero a public enemy, and he commit suicide.[ 84]

Beginning in the 3rd century BC, legionaries were paid stipendium (amounts are disputed but Caesar famously "doubled" payments to his troops to 225 denarii a year), could anticipate booty and donatives (distributions of plunder by commanders) from successful campaigns and, beginning at the time of Marius, often were granted allotments of land upon retirement.[191] Cavalry and light infantry attached to a legion (the auxilia) were often recruited in the areas where the legion served. Caesar formed a legion, the Fifth Alaudae, from non-citizens in Transalpine Gaul to serve in his campaigns in Gaul.[192] By the time of Caesar Augustus, the ideal of the citizen-soldier had been abandoned and the legions had become fully professional. Legionaries received 900 sesterces a year and could expect 12,000 sesterces on retirement.[193]

In 2011, the US Defense Department declared cyberspace a new domain of warfare; since then DARPA has begun a research project known as "Project X" with the goal of creating new technologies that will enable the government to better understand and map the cyber territory. Ultimately giving the Department of Defense the ability to plan and manage large-scale cyber missions across dynamic network environments.[22]

Thomas Somers and the Cabot Brothers founded the Beverly Cotton Manufactory in 1787, the first cotton mill in America, the largest cotton mill of its era,[132] and a significant milestone in the research and development of cotton mills in the future. This mill was designed to use horse power, but the operators quickly learned that the horse-drawn platform was economically unstable, and had economic losses for years. Despite the losses, the Manufactory served as a playground of innovation, both in turning a large amount of cotton, but also developing the water-powered milling structure used in Slater's Mill.[133]

After the decline of Mapungubwe, Great Zimbabwe rose on the Zimbabwe Plateau. Zimbabwe means stone building. Great Zimbabwe was the first city in Southern Africa and was the center of an empire, consolidating lesser Shona polities. Stone building was inherited from Mapungubwe. These building techniques were enhanced and came into maturity at Great Zimbabwe, represented by the wall of the Great Enclosure. The dry-stack stone masonry technology was also used to build smaller compounds in the area. Great Zimbabwe flourished by trading with Swahili Kilwa and Sofala. The rise of Great Zimbabwe parallels the rise of Kilwa. Great Zimbabwe was a major source of gold. Its royal court lived in luxury, wore Indian cotton, surrounded themselves with copper and gold ornaments, and ate on plates from as far away as Persia and China. Around the 1420s and 1430s, Great Zimbabwe was on decline. The city was abandoned by 1450. Some have attributed the decline to the rise of the trading town Ingombe Ilede.[127][128]

Edmund Halley succeeded Flamsteed as Astronomer Royal in England and succeeded in predicting the return in 1758 of the comet that bears his name. Sir William Herschel found the first new planet, Uranus, to be observed in modern times in 1781. The gap between the planets Mars and Jupiter disclosed by the Titius–Bode law was filled by the discovery of the asteroids Ceres and Pallas in 1801 with many more following.

Italian unification was the political and social movement that annexed different states of the Italian peninsula into the single state of Italy in the 19th century. There is a lack of consensus on the exact dates for the beginning and the end of this period, but many scholars agree that the process began with the end of Napoleonic rule and the Congress of Vienna in 1815, and approximately ended with the Franco-Prussian War in 1871, though the last città irredente did not join the Kingdom of Italy until after World War I.

In England the first great exponent of Renaissance architecture be Inigo Jones( 1573–1652), who have study architecture in Italy where the influence of Palladio be very strong. Jones return to England full of enthusiasm for the new movement and immediately begin to design such buildings as the Queen's House at Greenwich in 1616 and the Banqueting House at Whitehall three years later. These works with their clean lines and symmetry, be revolutionary in a country still enamour with mullion windows, crenellations and turrets.

Museums such as the British Museum be n't the only site of anthropological studies: with the New Imperialism period, start in the 1870s, zoos become unattended `` laboratories'', especially the so-called `` ethnological exhibitions'' or `` Negro villages''. Thus, `` savages'' from the colonies be display, often nudes, in cages, in what have be call `` human zoos''. For example, in 1906, Congolese pygmy Ota Benga be put by anthropologist Madison Grant in a cage in the Bronx Zoo, label `` the miss link'' between an orangutan and the `` white race'' – Grant, a renowned eugenicist, be also the author of The Passing of the Great Race( 1916). Such exhibitions be attempts to illustrate and prove in the same movement the validity of scientific racism, which first formulation may be find in Arthur de Gobineau's An Essay on the Inequality of Human Races( 1853–55). In 1931, the Colonial Exhibition in Paris still display Kanaks from New Caledonia in the `` indigenous village''; it receive 24 million visitors in six months, thus demonstrate the popularity of such `` human zoos''.

Biotechnology seem to be the solution for major social problems, include world hunger and energy crises. In the 1960s, radical measures would be need to meet world starvation, and biotechnology seem to provide an answer. However, the solutions prove to be too expensive and socially unacceptable, and solve world hunger through SCP food be dismiss. In the 1970s, the food crisis be succeed by the energy crisis, and here too, biotechnology seem to provide an answer. But once again, costs prove prohibitive as oil prices slump in the 1980s. Thus, in practice, the implications of biotechnology be not fully realize in these situations. But this would soon change with the rise of genetic engineering.

Note that despite the taboo of figurative visualization, some Muslim countries do cultivate a rich tradition in painting, though not in its own right, but as a companion to the write word. Iranian or Persian art, widely know as Persian miniature, concentrate on the illustration of epic or romantic works of literature. Persian illustrators deliberately avoid the use of shading and perspective, though familiar with it in their pre-Islamic history, in order to abide by the rule of not create any lifelike illusion of the real world. Their aim be not to depict the world as it be, but to create images of an ideal world of timeless beauty and perfect order.
An early manuscript describe dance be the Natya Shastra on which be base the modern interpretation of classical Indian dance( e.g. Bharathanatyam).

By the 6th century BC several cities had emerged as dominant in Greek affairs: Athens, Sparta, Corinth, and Thebes. Each of them had brought the surrounding rural areas and smaller towns under their control, and Athens and Corinth had become major maritime and mercantile powers as well.

The iconic Sydney Opera House open in 1973. In the same year, Patrick White become the first Australian to win a Nobel Prize for Literature.[ 385] Australian History have begin to appear on school curricula by the 1970s.[ 386] From the early 1970s, the Australian cinema begin to produce the Australian New Wave of films base on uniquely Australian themes. The South Australian Film Corporation take the lead in support filmmaking, with successes include quintessential Australian films Sunday Too Far Away( 1974), Picnic at Hanging Rock( 1975), Breaker Morant( 1980) and Gallipoli( 1981). The national funding body, the Australian Film Commission, be establish in 1975.

At the beginning of the 21st century Contemporary painting and Contemporary art in general continue in several contiguous modes, characterize by the idea of pluralism. The `` crisis'' in painting and current art and current art criticism today be bring about by pluralism. There be no consensus, nor need there be, as to a representative style of the age. There be an anything go attitude that prevail; an `` everything go on'', and consequently `` nothing go on'' syndrome; this create an aesthetic traffic jam with no firm and clear direction and with every lane on the artistic superhighway fill to capacity. Consequently magnificent and important works of art continue to be make albeit in a wide variety of styles and aesthetic temperaments, the marketplace be leave to judge merit.

Engineering achievements of the revolution range from electrification to developments in materials science. The advancements make a great contribution to the quality of life. In the first revolution, Lewis Paul be the original inventor of roller spinning, the basis of the water frame for spin cotton in a cotton mill. Matthew Boulton and James Watt's improvements to the steam engine be fundamental to the changes bring by the Industrial Revolution in both the Kingdom of Great Britain and the world.

Only free, land owning, native-born men could be citizens entitle to the full protection of the law in a city-state( later Pericles introduce exceptions to the native-born restriction). In most city-states, unlike the situation in Rome, social prominence do not allow special rights. Sometimes families control public religious functions, but this ordinarily do not give any extra power in the government. In Athens, the population be divide into four social classes base on wealth. People could change classes if they make more money. In Sparta, all male citizens be call homoioi, mean `` peers''. However, Spartan kings, who serve as the city-state's dual military and religious leaders, come from two families.

The Egyptians referred to the people west of the Nile, ancestral to the Berbers, as Libyans. The Libyans were agriculturalists like the Mauri of Morocco and the Numidians of central and eastern Algeria and Tunis. They were also nomadic, having the horse, and occupied the arid pastures and desert, like the Gaetuli. Berber desert nomads were typically in conflict with Berber coastal agriculturalists.[46]
The 19th Century be dominate by a wide variety of stylistic revivals, variations, and interpretations.

In mathematical geography, Persian Abū Rayhān al-Bīrūnī, around 1025, was the first to describe a polar equi-azimuthal equidistant projection of the celestial sphere.[48] He was also regarded as the most skilled when it came to mapping cities and measuring the distances between them, which he did for many cities in the Middle East and western Indian subcontinent. He combined astronomical readings and mathematical equations to record degrees of latitude and longitude and to measure the heights of mountains and depths of valleys, recorded in The Chronology of the Ancient Nations. He discussed human geography and the planetary habitability of the Earth, suggesting that roughly a quarter of the Earth's surface is habitable by humans. He solved a complex geodesic equation in order to accurately compute the Earth's circumference.[49] His estimate of 6,339.9 km for the Earth radius was only 16.8 km less than the modern value of 6,356.7 km.

In February 1519 Cortés go ahead anyway, in an act of open mutiny.
