Philology –

Kabuki begin shortly after Bunraku, legend have it by an actress name Okuni, who live around the end of the 16th century. Most of Kabuki's material come from Nõ and Bunraku, and its erratic dance-type movements be also an effect of Bunraku. However, Kabuki be less formal and more distant than Nõ, yet very popular among the Japanese public. Actors be train in many varied things include dancing, singing, pantomime, and even acrobatics. Kabuki be first perform by young girls, then by young boys, and by the end of the 16th century, Kabuki companies consist of all men. The men who portray women on stage be specifically train to elicit the essence of a woman in their subtle movements and gestures.

Soon after the invention of aeroplanes, military aviation became a significant component of warfare, though usually as a supplementary role. The two main types of military aircraft are bombers, which attack land- or sea-based targets, and fighters, which attack other aircraft.

During the 9th century several important developments took place. First, there was a major effort by the Church to unify the many chant traditions, and suppress many of them in favor of the Gregorian liturgy. Second, the earliest polyphonic music was sung, a form of parallel singing known as organum. Third, and of greatest significance for music history, notation was reinvented after a lapse of about five hundred years, though it would be several more centuries before a system of pitch and rhythm notation evolved having the precision and flexibility that modern musicians take for granted.

Based on archaeological evidence from an excavation at Caverna da Pedra Pintada, human inhabitants first settle in the Amazon region at least 11,200 years ago.[ 10] Subsequent human development lead to late-prehistoric settlements along the periphery of the forest that cause alterations in the forest cover by 1250 CE.[ 11]

In the late Archaic, on the north-central coastal region of Peru, a complex civilization arose which has been termed the Norte Chico civilization, also known as Caral-Supe. It is the oldest known civilization in the Americas and one of the six sites where civilization originated independently and indigenously in the ancient world, flourishing between the 30th and 18th centuries BC. It pre-dated the Mesoamerican Olmec civilization by nearly two millennia. It was contemporaneous with the Egypt following the unification of its kingdom under Menes and the emergence of the first Egyptian hieroglyphics.

The Royal Geographical Society be found in England in 1830, although the United Kingdom do not get its first full Chair of geography until 1917. The first real geographical intellect to emerge in United Kingdom geography be Halford John Mackinder, appoint reader at Oxford University in 1887.

Researchers have find that the fertile terra preta( black earth) be distribute over large areas in the Amazon forest. It be now widely accept that these soils be a product of indigenous soil management. The development of this soil enable agriculture and silviculture to be conduct in the previously hostile environment. Large portions of the Amazon rainforest be therefore probably the result of centuries of human management, rather than naturally occur as have previously be suppose.[ 36] In the region of the Xinguanos tribe, remain of some of these large, mid-forest Amazon settlements be find in 2003 by Michael Heckenberger and colleagues of the University of Florida. Among those remains be evidence of constructed roads, bridges and large plazas.[ 37]

Agriculture began independently in different parts of the globe, and included a diverse range of taxa. At least 11 separate regions of the Old and New World were involved as independent centers of origin.[11] Some of the earliest known domestications were of animals. Pigs were domesticated in Mesopotamia around 13,000 BC.[12] Sheep were domesticated in Mesopotamia between 11,000 and 9,000 BC.[13] Cattle were domesticated from the wild aurochs in the areas of modern Turkey and Pakistan around 8,500 BC.[14] Camels were domesticated late, perhaps around 3000 BC.[15]

Four years into the 20th century saw the Russo-Japanese War with the Battle of Port Arthur establish the Empire of Japan as a world power. The Russians be in constant pursuit of a warm water port on the Pacific Ocean, for their navy as well as for maritime trade. The Manchurian Campaign of the Russian Empire be fight against the Japanese over Manchuria and Korea. The major theatres of operations be Southern Manchuria, specifically the area around the Liaodong Peninsula and Mukden, and the seas around Korea, Japan, and the Yellow Sea. The resulting campaigns, in which the fledgling Japanese military consistently attain victory over the Russian forces array against them, be unexpected by world observers. These victories, as time transpire, would dramatically transform the distribution of power in East Asia, result in a reassessment of Japan's recent entry onto the world stage. The embarrass string of defeats increase Russian popular dissatisfaction with the inefficient and corrupt Tsarist government.

The burial of the dead( which, until this period, have usually be communal) become more individual. For example, whereas in the Neolithic a large chambered cairn or long barrow house the dead, Early Bronze Age people bury their dead in individual barrows( also commonly know and mark on modern British Ordnance Survey map as tumuli), or sometimes in cists cover with cairns.

Homo neanderthalensis, with his Mousterian technology emerged, in areas from Europe to western Asia, after this and continued to be the dominant group of humans in Europe and Middle East up until 40000-28000 ybp. Peking man has also been dated to this period. During Eemian Stage humans probably (see f.e. Wolf Cave) spread where ever their technology and skills allowed, Sahara dried up forming a difficult area for peoples to cross.

The Qing dynasty (1644–1912) was founded after the fall of the Ming, the last Han Chinese dynasty, by the Manchus. The Manchus were formerly known as the Jurchens. When Beijing was captured by Li Zicheng's peasant rebels in 1644, the Chongzhen Emperor, the last Ming emperor, committed suicide. The Manchus then allied with former Ming general Wu Sangui and seized control of Beijing, which became the new capital of the Qing dynasty. The Manchus adopted the Confucian norms of traditional Chinese government in their rule of China proper. Schoppa, the editor of The Columbia Guide to Modern Chinese History argues, "A date around 1780 as the beginning of modern China is thus closer to what we know today as historical 'reality'. It also allows us to have a better baseline to understand the precipitous decline of the Chinese polity in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries."[41]

The Bito clan claim legitimacy by be descend from the Bachwezi clan, who be say to have rule the Empire of Kitara. However, very little be know about Kitara; some scholars even question its historical existence. Most founding leaders of the various polities in the lake region seem to have claim descent from the Bachwezi.[ 161] There be now 13 million Tara who be part of the second African loss,( Nafi and Uma be two losses).[ citation need]

The attack on Pearl Harbor[ note 3] be a surprise military strike conduct by the Imperial Japanese Navy against the United States naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, on the morning of 7 December 1941( 8 December in Japan). The attack lead to the United States' entry into World War II.

An American invention at the time be a device to scramble the telephone call between Winston Churchill and Franklin D. Roosevelt. This be call the Green Hornet system and work by insert noise into the signal. The noise be then extract at the receive end. This system be never break by the Germans.
The historians Josephus and Pliny the Elder wrote their works during Vespasian's reign. Vespasian was Josephus' sponsor and Pliny dedicated his Naturalis Historia to Titus, son of Vespasian.

The International style be a major architectural trend of the 1920s and 1930s. The term usually refer to the buildings and architects of the formative decades of modernism, before World War II. The term have its origin from the name of a book by Henry-Russell Hitchcock and Philip Johnson which identify, categorise and expand upon characteristics common to modernism across the world. As a result, the focus be more on the stylistic aspects of modernism. The basic design principles of the International Style thus constitute part of modernism.

In 1944 Hungarian-American mathematician John von Neumann and Oskar Morgenstern published Theory of Games and Economic Behavior, founding Game Theory, which was widely adopted by economists. In 1951 Princeton mathematician John Forbes Nash Jr. published the article Non-Cooperative Games, becoming the first to define a Nash Equilibrium for non-zero-sum games.

The history of Greece during Classical Antiquity may be subdivided into five major periods.[7] The earliest of these is the Archaic period (c. 800 – c. 500 BC), in which artists made larger free-standing sculptures in stiff, hieratic poses with the dreamlike "archaic smile". The Archaic period is often taken to end with the overthrow of the last tyrant of Athens and the start of Athenian Democracy in 508 BC. It was followed by the Classical period (c. 500 – 323 BC), characterized by a style which was considered by later observers to be exemplary, i.e., "classical", as shown in the Parthenon, for instance. Politically, the Classical Period was dominated by Athens and the Delian League during the 5th century, but displaced by Spartan hegemony during the early 4th century BC, before power shifted to Thebes and the Boeotian League and finally to the League of Corinth led by Macedon. This period saw the Greco-Persian Wars and the Rise of Macedon.

Wrought iron for smiths to forge into consumer goods be still make in finery forges, as it long have be. However, new processes be adopt in the ensue years. The first be refer to today as potting and stamping, but this be supersede by Henry Cort's puddling process. Cort develop two significant iron manufacturing processes: rolling in 1783 and puddle in 1784.[ 28] Rolling replace hammer for consolidate wrought iron and expel some of the dross. Rolling be 15 times faster than hammer with a trip hammer. Roller mills be first use for make sheets, but also be develop for roll structural shapes such as angles and rails.
The astronomy of East Asia begin in China. Solar term be complete in Warring States period. The knowledge of Chinese astronomy be introduce into East Asia.

Over the next few centuries, clarity was reached in the organization of sound units, and the stop consonants were organized in a 5x5 square (c. 800 BCE, Pratisakhyas), eventually leading to a systematic alphabet, Brāhmī, by the 3rd century BCE.

The modern period has been a period of significant development in the fields of science, politics, warfare, and technology. It has also been an age of discovery and globalization. During this time, the European powers and later their colonies, began a political, economic, and cultural colonization of the rest of the world.

One of the basic requirements for a scientific community is the existence and approval of a political sponsor; in England, the Royal Society operates under the aegis of the monarchy; in the US, the National Academy of Sciences was founded by Act of the United States Congress; etc. Otherwise, when the basic elements of knowledge were being formulated, the political rulers of the respective communities could choose to arbitrarily either support or disallow the nascent scientific communities. For example, Alhazen had to feign madness to avoid execution. The polymath Shen Kuo lost political support, and could not continue his studies until he came up with discoveries that showed his worth to the political rulers. The admiral Zheng He could not continue his voyages of exploration after the emperors withdrew their support. Another famous example was the suppression of the work of Galileo, by the twentieth century, Galileo would be pardoned.

The Niger Delta comprise numerous city-states with numerous forms of government. These city-states be protect by the waterways and thick vegetation of the delta. The region be transform by trade in the 17th century. The delta's city-states be comparable to those of the Swahili people in East Africa. Some, like Bonny, Kalabari, and Warri, have kings. Others, like Brass, be republics with small senates, and those at Cross River and Old Calabar be rule by merchants of the ekpe society. The ekpe society regulate trade and make rules for members know as house systems. Some of these houses, like the Pepples of Bonny, be well know in the Americas and Europe.[ 195]

In the 13th century, paper money became known in Europe through the accounts of travelers, such as Marco Polo and William of Rubruck.[88] Marco Polo's account of paper money during the Yuan Dynasty is the subject of a chapter of his book, The Travels of Marco Polo, titled "How the Great Kaan Causeth the Bark of Trees, Made into Something Like Paper, to Pass for Money All Over his Country."[89] In medieval Italy and Flanders, because of the insecurity and impracticality of transporting large sums of money over long distances, money traders started using promissory notes. In the beginning these were personally registered, but they soon became a written order to pay the amount to whoever had it in their possession.[90] These notes can be seen as a predecessor to regular banknotes.[91] The first European banknotes were issued by Stockholms Banco, a predecessor of the Bank of Sweden, in 1661.[92] These replaced the copper-plates being used instead as a means of payment,[93] although in 1664 the bank ran out of coins to redeem notes and ceased operating in the same year.

The era of the French Revolution and the subsequent Napoleonic wars was a difficult time for monarchs. Tsar Paul I of Russia was assassinated; King Louis XVI of France was executed, as was his Queen Marie Antoinette. Furthermore, kings Charles IV of Spain, Ferdinand VII of Spain and Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden were deposed as were ultimately the Emperor Napoleon and all of the relatives he had installed on various European thrones. King Frederick William III of Prussia and Emperor Francis II of Austria barely clung to their thrones. King George III of England lost the better part of his empire.[73]

Another legend, record by Greek historian Dionysius of Halicarnassus, say that Prince Aeneas lead a group of Trojans on a sea voyage to found a new Troy, since the original be destroy in the outcome of the Trojan War. After a long time in rough seas, they land at the banks of the Tiber River. Not long after they land, the men want to take to the sea again, but the women who be travel with them do not want to leave. One woman, name Roma, suggest that the women burn the ships out at sea to prevent them from leave. At first, the men be angry with Roma, but they soon realize that they be in the ideal place to settle. They name the settlement after the woman who torch their ships.[ 17]

The increase in wealth experience by Spain coincide with a major inflationary cycle both within Spain and Europe, know as the price revolution. Spain have amass large quantities of gold and silver from the New World.[ 162] In the 1520s large scale extraction of silver from Mexico's Guanajuato begin. With the opening of the silver mines in Zacatecas and Bolivia's Potosí in 1546 large shipments of silver become the fabled source of wealth. During the 16th century, Spain hold the equivalent of US$ 1.5 trillion( 1990 terms) in gold and silver from New Spain. Being the most powerful European monarch at a time full of war and religious conflicts, the Habsburg rulers spend the wealth in wars and arts across Europe. `` I learn a proverb here'', say a French traveler in 1603: `` Everything be dear in Spain except silver''.[ 163] The spent silver, suddenly spread throughout a previously cash-starved Europe, cause widespread inflation.[ 164] The inflation be worsen by a grow population with a static production level, low salaries and a rise cost of living, which damage local industry. Increasingly, Spain become dependent on the revenues flow in from the mercantile empire in the Americas, lead to Spain's first bankruptcy in 1557 due to rise military costs.[ 165] Phillip II of Spain default on debt payments in 1557, 1560, 1575 and 1596. The increase in prices as a result of currency circulation fuel the growth of the commercial middle class in Europe, the bourgeoisie, which come to influence the politics and culture of many countries.

Ronald Coase( 1910–2013) of the Chicago School of Economics be the most prominent economic analyst of law, and the 1991 Nobel Prize in Economics winner. His first major article The Nature of the Firm( 1937) argue that the reason for the existence of firms( companies, partnerships, etc.) be the existence of transaction costs. Homo economicus trades through bilateral contracts on open markets until the costs of transactions make the use of corporations to produce things more cost-effective. His second major article The Problem of Social Cost( 1960) argue that if we live in a world without transaction costs, people would bargain with one another to create the same allocation of resources, regardless of the way a court might rule in property disputes. Coase use the example of an old legal case about nuisance name Sturges v Bridgman, where a noisy sweets maker and a quiet doctor be neighbors and go to court to see who should have to move.[ 93] Coase say that regardless of whether the judge rule that the sweets maker have to stop use his machinery, or that the doctor have to put up with it, they could strike a mutually beneficial bargain about who move house that reach the same outcome of resource distribution. Only the existence of transaction costs may prevent this.[ 94] So the law ought to preempt what would happen, and be guide by the most efficient solution. The idea be that law and regulation be not as important or effective at help people as lawyers and government planners believe.[ 95] Coase and others like him want a change of approach, to put the burden of proof for positive effects on a government that be intervene in the market, by analyze the costs of action.[ 96]
In Ban Chiang, Thailand( Southeast Asia), bronze artifacts have be discover date to 2100 BCE.

Hellenic infighting left Greek city states vulnerable, and Philip II of Macedon united the Greek city states under his control. The son of Philip II, known as Alexander the Great, invaded neighboring Persia, toppled and incorporated its domains, as well as invading Egypt and going as far off as India, increasing contact with people and cultures in these regions that marked the beginning of the Hellenistic period.

It be probable that the first musical instrument be the human voice itself, which can make a vast array of sounds, from sing, hum and whistle through to click, cough and yawn. In 2008 archaeologists discover a bone flute in the Hohle Fels cave near Ulm, Germany.[ 7][ 8][ 9] The five-holed flute have a V-shaped mouthpiece and be make from a vulture wing bone. The oldest know wooden pipes be discover near Greystones, Ireland, in 2004. A wood-lined pit contain a group of six flutes make from yew wood, between 30 and 50 cm long, taper at one end, but without any finger holes. They may once have be strap together.[ 10]

In paleolithic times, mostly animals be paint, in theory ones that be use as food or represent strength, such as the rhinoceros or large cats( as in the Chauvet Cave). Signs such as dots be sometimes draw. Rare human representations include handprints and half-human/half-animal figures. The Cave of Chauvet in the Ardèche département, France, contain the most important cave paintings of the paleolithic era,[ citation need] dating from about 36,000 BCE.[ 70][ 71] The Altamira cave paintings in Spain be do 14,000 to 12,000 BCE and show, among others, bisons. The hall of bulls in Lascaux, Dordogne, France, date from about 15,000 to 10,000 BCE.

The Kushan Empire expand out of what be now Afghanistan into the northwest of the subcontinent under the leadership of their first emperor, Kujula Kadphises, about the middle of the 1st century CE. They come of an Indo-European language speak Central Asian tribe call the Yuezhi,[ 157][ 158] a branch of which be know as the Kushans. By the time of his grandson, Kanishka the Great, the empire spread to encompass much of Afghanistan,[ 159] and then the northern parts of the Indian subcontinent at least as far as Saketa and Sarnath near Varanasi( Benares).[ 160]

A first attempt to explore western South America be undertake in 1522 by Pascual de Andagoya. Native South Americans tell him about a gold-rich territory on a river call Pirú. Having reach San Juan River( Colombia), Andagoya fell ill and return to Panama, where he spread news about `` Pirú'' as the legendary El Dorado. These, along with the accounts of success of Hernán Cortés, catch the attention of Pizarro.
This article details the history of electrical engineering.

The first known landing in Australia by Europeans was by Dutch navigator Willem Janszoon in 1606. Twenty-nine other Dutch navigators explored the western and southern coasts in the 17th century, and dubbed the continent New Holland.[34] Macassan trepangers visited Australia's northern coasts after 1720, possibly earlier.[35][36] Other European explorers followed until navigator Lieutenant James Cook claimed the east coast of Australia for Britain in 1770, without conducting negotiations with the existing inhabitants.[37] He returned with accounts favouring colonisation at Botany Bay (now in Sydney), New South Wales.

The history of agriculture records the domestication of plants and animals and the development and dissemination of techniques for raising them productively. Agriculture began independently in different parts of the globe, and included a diverse range of taxa. At least 11 separate regions of the Old and New World were involved as independent centers of origin.

Although North Africa be influence to a certain extent by European Bronze Age cultures( for example, traces of the Bell beaker tradition be find in Morocco[ dubious – discuss][ citation need]), it have long be believe that Africa do not have its own metallurgy traditions until the Phoenician colonization( ca. 1100 BC) of North Africa, and that it remain attach to the Neolithic way of life[ dubious – discuss][ citation need]. The civilization of Ancient Egypt, whose influence do not extensively cover Africa outside of the Nile's reach, be believe to be the sole exception to this rule as regards the whole range of ancient cultures of Africa. Recently, however, some discoveries have be make that appear to contradict these views.[ citation need]

In 1999, Australia lead a United Nations force into East Timor to help establish democracy and independence for that nation, follow political violence.[ 417] During this period Australia commit to a number of other peacekeeping and stabilisation operations: notably in Bougainville, include Operation Bel Isi( 1998–2003); as well as Operation Helpem Fren and the Australian-led Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands( RAMSI) in the early 2000s; and the 2006 East Timorese crisis.[ 418]

As an alternative form of medicine in India, Unani medicine got deep roots and royal patronage during medieval times. It progressed during Indian sultanate and mughal periods. Unani medicine is very close to Ayurveda. Both are based on theory of the presence of the elements (in Unani, they are considered to be fire, water, earth and air) in the human body. According to followers of Unani medicine, these elements are present in different fluids and their balance leads to health and their imbalance leads to illness.[19]

Though positivist approaches remain important in geography, critical geography arise as a critique of positivism. The first strain of critical geography to emerge be humanistic geography. Drawing on the philosophies of existentialism and phenomenology, humanistic geographers( such as Yi-Fu Tuan) focus on people's sense of, and relationship with, places. More influential be Marxist geography, which apply the social theories of Karl Marx and his followers to geographic phenomena. David Harvey and Richard Peet be well-known Marxist geographers. Feminist geography be, as the name suggest, the use of ideas from feminism in geographic contexts. The most recent strain of critical geography be postmodernist geography, which employ the ideas of postmodernist and poststructuralist theorists to explore the social construction of spatial relations.

Stone tools be make from a variety of stones. For example, flint and chert be shape( or chip) for use as cutting tools and weapons, while basalt and sandstone be use for ground stone tools, such as quern-stones. Wood, bone, shell, antler( deer) and other materials be widely use, as well. During the most recent part of the period, sediments( such as clay) be use to make pottery. Agriculture be develop and certain animals be domesticate as well.
Vespasian sent legions to defend the eastern frontier in Cappadocia, extended the occupation in Britain and reformed the tax system. He died in 79 AD.

Renaissance theatre derive from several medieval theatre traditions, such as, the mystery play that form a part of religious festivals in England and other parts of Europe during the Middle Ages. Other sources include the `` morality plays'' and the `` University drama'' that attempt to recreate Athenian tragedy. The Italian tradition of Commedia dell'arte, as well as the elaborate masques frequently present at court, also contribute to the shaping of public theatre.

Galileo Galilei have be call the `` father of modern observational astronomy'',[ 42] the `` father of modern physics'',[ 43][ 44] the `` father of science'',[ 44][ 45] and `` the Father of Modern Science''.[ 46] His original contributions to the science of motion be make through an innovative combination of experiment and mathematics.[ 47]

In 1485 Ivan III commissioned the building of the royal residence, Terem Palace, within the Kremlin, with Aloisio da Milano as the architect of the first three floors. He and other Italian architects also contributed to the construction of the Kremlin walls and towers. The small banquet hall of the Russian Tsars, called the Palace of Facets because of its facetted upper story, is the work of two Italians, Marco Ruffo and Pietro Solario, and shows a more Italian style. In 1505, an Italian known in Russia as Aleviz Novyi or Aleviz Fryazin arrived in Moscow. He may have been the Venetian sculptor, Alevisio Lamberti da Montagne. He built 12 churches for Ivan III, including the Cathedral of the Archangel, a building remarkable for the successful blending of Russian tradition, Orthodox requirements and Renaissance style. It is believed that the Cathedral of the Metropolitan Peter in Vysokopetrovsky Monastery, another work of Aleviz Novyi, later served as an inspiration for the so-called octagon-on-tetragon architectural form in the Moscow Baroque of the late 17th century.

Philological studies flourished during the Qing Dynasty, with Duan Yucai and Wang Niansun as the towering figures. The last great philologist of the era was Zhang Binglin, who also helped lay the foundation of modern Chinese linguistics. The Western comparative method was brought into China by Bernard Karlgren, the first scholar to reconstruct Middle Chinese and Old Chinese with Latin alphabet (not IPA). Important modern Chinese linguists include Y. R. Chao, Luo Changpei, Li Fanggui and Wang Li.

In 1627 the south coast of Australia be accidentally discover by François Thijssen and name't Land van Pieter Nuyts, in honour of the highest ranking passenger, Pieter Nuyts, extraordinary Councillor of India,[ 85] In 1628 a squadron of Dutch ships be send by the Governor-General of the Dutch East Indies Pieter de Carpentier to explore the northern coast. These ships make extensive examinations, particularly in the Gulf of Carpentaria, name in honour of de Carpentier.[ 84]

In 1511–1512, Portuguese captains João de Lisboa and Estevão de Fróis reach the River Plate estuary in present-day Uruguay and Argentina, and go as far south as the present-day Gulf of San Matias at 42°S( record in the Newen Zeytung auss Pressilandt mean `` New Tidings from the Land of Brazil'').[ 82][ 83] The expedition reach a cape extend north to south which they call Cape of `` Santa Maria''( Punta del Este, keep the name the Cape nearby); and after 40°S they find a `` Cape'' or `` a point or place extend into the sea'', and a `` Gulf''( in June and July). After they have navigate for nearly 300 km( 186 mi) to round the cape, they again sight the continent on the other side, and steer towards the northwest, but a storm prevent them from make any headway. Driven away by the Tramontane or north wind, they retrace their course. Also give the first news of the White King and the `` people of the mountains'' to the interior( the Inca Empire), and a gift, an ax of silver, obtain from the Charrúa natives on their return( `` to the coast or side of Brazil''), and `` to West''( along the coast and the River Plate estuary), and offer to King Manuel I.[ 84] Christopher de Haro, a Flemish of Sephardic origin( one of the financiers of the expedition along with D. Nuno Manuel), who would serve the Spanish Crown after 1516, believe that the navigators have discover a southern strait to west and Asia.

Jacksonville be especially important to the African American film industry. One notable individual in this regard be the European American producer Richard Norman, who create a string of films star black actors in the vein of Oscar Micheaux and the Lincoln Motion Picture Company. In contrast to the degrading parts offer in certain white films such as The Birth of a Nation, Norman and his contemporaries seek to create positive stories feature African Americans in what he term `` splendidly assume different roles.''

Newton had also specifically attributed the inherent power of inertia to matter, against the mechanist thesis that matter has no inherent powers. But whereas Newton vehemently denied gravity was an inherent power of matter, his collaborator Roger Cotes made gravity also an inherent power of matter, as set out in his famous preface to the Principia's 1713 second edition which he edited, and contradicted Newton himself. And it was Cotes's interpretation of gravity rather than Newton's that came to be accepted.
Applied innovation extended to commerce. At the end of the 15th century Luca Pacioli published the first work on bookkeeping, making him the founder of accounting.[66]

The military campaigns of Alexander the Great spread Greek think to Egypt, Asia Minor, Persia, up to the Indus River. The result Hellenistic civilization produce seats of learn in Alexandria in Egypt and Antioch in Syria along with Greek speaking populations across several monarchies. Hellenistic science differ from Greek science in at least two ways: first, it benefit from the cross-fertilization of Greek ideas with those that have develop in the larger Hellenistic world; secondly, to some extent, it be support by royal patrons in the kingdoms found by Alexander's successors. Especially important to Hellenistic science be the city of Alexandria in Egypt, which become a major center of scientific research in the 3rd century BC. Two institutions establish there during the reigns of Ptolemy I Soter( reign 323–283 BC) and Ptolemy II Philadelphus( reign 281–246 BC) be the Library and the Museum. Unlike Plato's Academy and Aristotle's Lyceum, these institutions be officially support by the Ptolemies; although the extent of patronage could be precarious, depend on the policies of the current ruler.[ 21]

Wallis identify a prestige hierarchy with university educate physicians on top, follow by learned surgeons; craft-trained surgeons; barber surgeons; itinerant specialists such as dentist and oculists; empirics; and midwives.[ 54]

Some economists, such as Robert E. Lucas, Jr., say that the real impact of the Industrial Revolution was that "for the first time in history, the living standards of the masses of ordinary people have begun to undergo sustained growth ... Nothing remotely like this economic behaviour is mentioned by the classical economists, even as a theoretical possibility."[4] Others, however, argue that while growth of the economy's overall productive powers was unprecedented during the Industrial Revolution, living standards for the majority of the population did not grow meaningfully until the late 19th and 20th centuries, and that in many ways workers' living standards declined under early capitalism: for instance, studies have shown that real wages in Britain only increased 15% between the 1780s and 1850s, and that life expectancy in Britain did not begin to dramatically increase until the 1870s.[5][6]

Franz Boas establish academic anthropology in the United States in opposition to this sort of evolutionary perspective. His approach be empirical, skeptical of overgeneralizations, and eschew attempts to establish universal laws. For example, Boas study immigrant children to demonstrate that biological race be not immutable, and that human conduct and behavior result from nurture, rather than nature.

Aristarchus of Samos published work on how to determine the sizes and distances of the Sun and the Moon, and Eratosthenes used this work to figure the size of the Earth. Hipparchus later discovered the precession of the Earth.

The Ming dynasty be found by Zhu Yuanzhang in 1368, who proclaim himself as the Hongwu Emperor. The capital be initially set at Nanjing, and be later move to Beijing from Yongle Emperor's reign onward.

The `` Tuʻi Tonga Empire'' or `` Tongan Empire'' in Oceania be descriptions sometimes give to Tongan expansionism and project hegemony date back to 950 AD, but at its peak during the period 1200–1500. While modern researchers and cultural experts attest to widespread Tongan influence and evidences of transoceanic trade and exchange of material and non-material cultural artifacts, empirical evidence of a true political empire rule for any length of time by successive rulers be lack.[ 15]

Austerity was another response, the policy of reducing government budget deficits. Austerity policies may include spending cuts, tax increases, or a mixture of both.[119][120] Two influential academic papers support this position. The first was Large Changes in Fiscal Policy: Taxes Versus Spending, published in October 2009 by Alberto Alesina and Silvia Ardagna. It showed that fiscal austerity measures did not hurt economies, and actually helped their recovery.[121] The second Growth in a Time of Debt, published in 2010 by Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff. It analyzed public debt and GDP growth among 20 advanced economies and claimed that high debt countries grew at −0.1% since WWII. Many governments accepted this and followed the austerity course.[citation needed]

During the tumultuous 14th century, disputes within the leadership of the Church lead to the Avignon Papacy of 1305–78,[ 294] also call the `` Babylonian Captivity of the Papacy''( a reference to the Babylonian captivity of the Jews),[ 295] and then to the Great Schism, last from 1378 to 1418, when there be two and later three rival popes, each support by several states.[ 296] Ecclesiastical officials convene at the Council of Constance in 1414, and in the following year the council depose one of the rival popes, leave only two claimants. Aristotle developed a complete normative approach to scientific inquiry involving the syllogism, which he discusses at length in his Posterior Analytics. A difficulty with this scheme lay in showing that derived truths have solid primary premises. Aristotle would not allow that demonstrations could be circular (supporting the conclusion by the premises, and the premises by the conclusion). Nor would he allow an infinite number of middle terms between the primary premises and the conclusion. This leads to the question of how the primary premises are found or developed, and as mentioned above, Aristotle allowed that induction would be required for this task.

The earliest attested examples of mathematical calculations date to the predynastic Naqada period, and show a fully developed numeral system.[202] The importance of mathematics to an educated Egyptian is suggested by a New Kingdom fictional letter in which the writer proposes a scholarly competition between himself and another scribe regarding everyday calculation tasks such as accounting of land, labor, and grain.[203] Texts such as the Rhind Mathematical Papyrus and the Moscow Mathematical Papyrus show that the ancient Egyptians could perform the four basic mathematical operations—addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division—use fractions, compute the volumes of boxes and pyramids, and calculate the surface areas of rectangles, triangles, and circles. They understood basic concepts of algebra and geometry, and could solve simple sets of simultaneous equations.[204]

Early colonial administrations were anxious to address the gender imbalance in the population brought about by the importation of large numbers of convict men. Between 1788 and 1792, around 3546 male to 766 female convicts were landed at Sydney.[153] Women came to play an important role in education and welfare during colonial times. Governor Macquarie's wife, Elizabeth Macquarie took an interest in convict women's welfare.[154] Her contemporary Elizabeth Macarthur was noted for her 'feminine strength' in assisting the establishment of the Australian merino wool industry during her husband John Macarthur's enforced absence from the colony following the Rum Rebellion.[155] The Catholic Sisters of Charity arrived in 1838 and set about pastoral care in a women's prison, visiting hospitals and schools and establishing employment for convict women.[156] The sisters went on to establish hospitals in four of the eastern states, beginning with St Vincent's Hospital, Sydney in 1857 as a free hospital for all people, but especially for the poor.[157] Caroline Chisholm (1808–1877) established a migrant women's shelter and worked for women's welfare in the colonies in the 1840s. Her humanitarian efforts later won her fame in England and great influence in achieving support for families in the colony.[158] Sydney's first Catholic Bishop, John Bede Polding founded an Australian order of nuns—the Sisters of the Good Samaritan—in 1857 to work in education and social work.[159] The Sisters of St Joseph, were founded in South Australia by Saint Mary MacKillop and Fr Julian Tenison Woods in 1867.[160][161][162] MacKillop travelled throughout Australasia and established schools, convents and charitable institutions. She was canonised by Benedict XVI in 2010, becoming the first Australian to be so honoured by the Catholic Church.[163]

Cook return to Hawaii in 1779. After sail around the archipelago for some eight weeks, he make landfall at Kealakekua Bay, on'Hawaii Island', largest island in the Hawaiian Archipelago. Toramana's son Mihirakula, a Saivite Hindu, move up to near Pataliputra to the east and Gwalior to the central India. Hiuen Tsiang narrate Mihirakula's merciless persecution of Buddhists and destruction of monasteries, though the description be dispute as far as the authenticity be concern.[ 191] The Huns be defeat by the Indian kings Yasodharman of Malwa and Narasimhagupta in the 6th century. Some of them be drive out of India and others be assimilate in the Indian society.[ 192]

It is important to note that ancient precedent existed for alternative theories and developments which prefigured later discoveries in the area of physics and mechanics; but in light of the limited number of works to survive translation in a period when many books were lost to warfare, such developments remained obscure for centuries and are traditionally held to have had little effect on the re-discovery of such phenomena; whereas the invention of the printing press made the wide dissemination of such incremental advances of knowledge commonplace. Meanwhile, however, significant progress in geometry, mathematics, and astronomy was made in medieval times, particularly in the Islamic world as well as Europe.

Great Zimbabwe is the largest medieval city in sub-Saharan Africa. By the late nineteenth century, most buildings reflected the fashionable European eclecticism and pastisched Mediterranean, or even Northern European, styles.

The word "Renaissance" is borrowed from the French language, where it means "re-birth". It was first used in the eighteenth century and was later popularized by French historian Jules Michelet (1798–1874) in his 1855 work, Histoire de France (History of France).[78][79]

Apart from some scattered reference in ancient and medieval records, rest on slender evidence and in need of interpretation, the earliest clearly verifiable human flight take place in Paris in 1783, when Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier and François Laurent d'Arlandes go 5 miles( 8.0 km) in a hot air balloon invent by the Montgolfier brothers. The Wright brothers make the first sustain, control and power heavier-than-air flight on December 17, 1903, in their revolutionary aircraft, the Wright Flyer.
In Central Europe, the 17th century scientist and educator John Amos Comenius promulgated a reformed system of universal education that was widely used in Europe.

In Eastern Europe, Byzantium revive its fortunes under Emperor Basil I( r. 867–886) and his successors Leo VI( r. 886–912) and Constantine VII( r. 913–959), members of the Macedonian dynasty. Commerce revive and the emperors oversee the extension of a uniform administration to all the provinces. The military be reorganise, which allow the emperors John I( r. 969–976) and Basil II( r. 976–1025) to expand the frontiers of the empire on all fronts. The imperial court be the centre of a revival of classical learning, a process know as the Macedonian Renaissance. Writers such as John Geometres( fl. early 10th century) compose new hymns, poems, and other works.[ 130] Missionary efforts by both eastern and western clergy result in the conversion of the Moravians, Bulgars, Bohemians, Poles, Magyars, and Slavic inhabitants of the Kievan Rus'. These conversions contribute to the founding of political states in the lands of those peoples—the states of Moravia, Bulgaria, Bohemia, Poland, Hungary, and the Kievan Rus'.[ 131] Bulgaria, which be found around 680, at its height reach from Budapest to the Black Sea and from the Dnieper River in modern Ukraine to the Adriatic Sea.[ 132] By 1018, the last Bulgarian nobles have surrender to the Byzantine Empire.[ 133]

Most of the subcontinent be conquer by the Maurya Empire during the 4th and 3rd centuries BCE. From the 3rd century BCE onwards Prakrit and Pali literature in the north and the Sangam literature in southern India start to flourish.[ 11][ 12] Wootz steel originate in south India in the 3rd century BCE and be export to foreign countries.[ 13][ 14][ 15] Various parts of India be rule by numerous dynasties for the next 1,500 years, among which the Gupta Empire stand out. This period, witness a Hindu religious and intellectual resurgence, be know as the classical or `` Golden Age of India''. During this period, aspects of Indian civilisation, administration, culture, and religion( Hinduism and Buddhism) spread to much of Asia, while kingdoms in southern India have maritime business links with the Middle East and the Mediterranean. Indian cultural influence spread over many parts of Southeast Asia which lead to the establishment of Indianised kingdoms in Southeast Asia( Greater India).[ 16][ 17]

Aristotle's inductive-deductive method use inductions from observations to infer general principles, deductions from those principles to check against further observations, and more cycles of induction and deduction to continue the advance of knowledge[ 14]

The ancient people who be consider the first scientists may have think of themselves as natural philosophers, as practitioners of a skilled profession( for example, physicians), or as followers of a religious tradition( for example, temple healers).

Overall, from about 1910, American films have the largest share of the market in all European countries except France, and even in France, the American films have just push the local production out of first place on the eve of World War I. So even if the war have not happen, American films may have become dominant worldwide. Although the war make things much worse for European producers, the technical qualities of American films make them increasingly attractive to audiences everywhere.

Music and theatre scholars study the history and anthropology of Semitic and early Judeo-Christian culture, have also discover common links between theatrical and musical activity in the classical cultures of the Hebrews with those of the later cultures of the Greeks and Romans. The common area of performance be find in a `` social phenomenon call litany,'' a form of prayer consisting of a series of invocations or supplications. The ancient Egyptians cultivated emmer and barley, and several other cereal grains, all of which were used to make the two main food staples of bread and beer.[104] Flax plants, uprooted before they started flowering, were grown for the fibers of their stems. These fibers were split along their length and spun into thread, which was used to weave sheets of linen and to make clothing. Papyrus growing on the banks of the Nile River was used to make paper. Vegetables and fruits were grown in garden plots, close to habitations and on higher ground, and had to be watered by hand. Vegetables included leeks, garlic, melons, squashes, pulses, lettuce, and other crops, in addition to grapes that were made into wine.[105]

The Renaissance begin in times of religious turmoil. The late Middle Ages be a period of political intrigue surround the Papacy, culminate in the Western Schism, in which three men simultaneously claim to be true Bishop of Rome.[ 67] While the schism be resolve by the Council of Constance( 1414), a result reform movement know as Conciliarism seek to limit the power of the pope. Although the papacy eventually emerge supreme in ecclesiastical matters by the Fifth Council of the Lateran( 1511), it be dog by continued accusations of corruption, most famously in the person of Pope Alexander VI, who be accuse variously of simony, nepotism and father four children( most of whom be marry off, presumably for the consolidation of power) while a cardinal.[ 68]

Much later in the Roman period, Pliny the Elder produce a very extensive discussion of many more minerals and metals then widely use for practical ends. He be among the first to correctly identify the origin of amber as a fossilized resin from trees by the observation of insects trap within some pieces. He also lay the basis of crystallography by recognise the octahedral habit of diamond.
In the 12th and 13th centuries, Central Asian Turks invaded parts of northern India and established the Delhi Sultanate in the former Hindu holdings.[275]

Witelo is considered a precursor of perception psychology. His Perspectiva contains much material in psychology, outlining views that are close to modern notions on the association of ideas and on the subconscious.

The basic construction form be more or less similar to Eastern Asian building system. From a technical point of view, buildings be structure vertically and horizontally. A construction usually rise from a stone subfoundation to a curve roof cover with tiles, hold by a console structure and support on posts; walls be make of earth( adobe) or be sometimes totally composed of movable wooden doors. Architecture be build accord to the k'an unit, the distance between two posts( about 3.7 meters), and be design so that there be always a transitional space between the `` inside'' and the `` outside.''

During the Second World War( 1939–1945), India be control by the United Kingdom, with the British holding territories in India include over five hundred autonomous Princely States; British India officially declare war on Nazi Germany in September 1939.[ 378] The British Raj, as part of the Allied Nations, send over two and a half million volunteer soldiers to fight under British command against the Axis powers. Additionally, several Indian Princely States provide large donations to support the Allied campaign during the War. India also provide the base for American operations in support of China in the China Burma India Theatre.

One of the more colorful figures in 20th-century mathematics was Srinivasa Aiyangar Ramanujan (1887–1920), an Indian autodidact who conjectured or proved over 3000 theorems, including properties of highly composite numbers, the partition function and its asymptotics, and mock theta functions. He also made major investigations in the areas of gamma functions, modular forms, divergent series, hypergeometric series and prime number theory.

De Stijl be also the name of a journal that be publish by the Dutch painter, designer, writer, and critic Theo van Doesburg propagate the group's theories. Next to van Doesburg, the group's principal members be the painters Piet Mondrian, Vilmos Huszár, and Bart van der Leck, and the architects Gerrit Rietveld, Robert van't Hoff, and J.J.P. Oud. The artistic philosophy that form a basis for the group's work be know as neoplasticism — the new plastic art( or Nieuwe Beelding in Dutch).

In the early part of the last century, a parallel concept call Unit Processes be use to classify reactive processes. Thus oxidations, reductions, alkylations, etc. form separate unit processes and be study as such. This be natural consider the close affinity of chemical engineering to industrial chemistry at its inception. Gradually however, the subject of chemical reaction engineering have largely replace the unit process concept. This subject look at the entire body of chemical reactions as have a personality of its own, independent of the particular chemical species or chemical bonds involve. The latter do contribute to this personality in no small measure, but to design and operate chemical reactors, a knowledge of characteristics such as rate behaviour, thermodynamics, single or multiphase nature, etc. be more important. The emergence of chemical reaction engineering as a discipline truly signal the severance of the umbilical cord connect chemical engineering to industrial chemistry, and serve to cement the truly unique character of this discipline.

To enforce a trade monopoly, Muscat, and Hormuz in the Persian Gulf, be seize by Afonso de Albuquerque in 1507, and in 1507 and 1515, respectively. In 1521, a force under António Correia conquer Bahrain, usher in a period of almost eighty years of Portuguese rule of the Gulf archipelago.[ 91] In the Red Sea, Massawa be the most northerly point frequent by the Portuguese until 1541, when a fleet under Estevão da Gama penetrate as far as Suez.

From the 5th century, Western Europe was plunged into a period of general disorder that lasted (with a brief period of stability under the Carolingian Empire in the 9th century) until the 10th century. As such, most organized theatrical activities disappeared in Western Europe. While it seems that small nomadic bands traveled around Europe throughout the period, performing wherever they could find an audience, there is no evidence that they produced anything but crude scenes.[33] These performers were denounced by the Church during the Dark Ages as they were viewed as dangerous and pagan.
